name: Abyss_Guide
summary: The is a Seasonal Guide (also known as Quest Giver) from the Season of Abyss who offers quests and cosmetics. The Abyss Guide is found standing on the boat in the Treasure Reef. The Ultimate Guide offered an necklace_u, an mask_u, an headpiece_u, and an cape_u for Season Pass holders. This Ultimate Guide also provided a new cosmetic in their Quest Tree, permanently available to all players: a mask.

Friendship Tree.description: The Friendship Tree was available to the right of the Quest Tree during the Season of Abyss. Now that the Season is over, these cosmetics are no longer available.

name: Admiring_Actor
summary: The Admiring Actor is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Rhythm who offers the inline_text Expression. The Admiring Actor is found in the Forest Boneyard under the first pavilion of the broken bridge. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, and the .

Memory.text: The Admiring Actor can be found in the Boneyard in Hidden Forest, under the first bridge gazebo with an occasional Dark Plant under it. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 3 memory fragments and a 6-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Admiring Actor can be seen wading through the flooded ground of the Boneyard, seeming to scan the surroundings as they look for something. Throughout the memory, players will have to make their way through polluted water and rain, endangering the health of the light and the memory fragments. Players can either hurry from fragment to fragment and let the light recharge under shelter before continuing, or completely activate the bridge (including the Jellyfish) before starting the Spirit's memory, as this will stop the polluted rain. At the end of the memory, the Admiring Actor brings their hands to their mouth and outstretches them, blowing a kiss towards the player.

levels.description: will make your avatar squat slightly before standing up tall to blow a kiss with both hands, while a whimsical popping sound effect plays.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with a light-pink large heart appearing between the avatar's hands as they blow a kiss.
will make your avatar blow one kiss to their left with just their left hand, and another to their right with just their right hand while whimsical popping sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with two large hearts appearing first to the left and then to the right, in the same order that your avatar blows kisses.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit consists out of a light-blue wrap top with mid-length sleeves, black high-waisted pants, and fitted dark-blue boots with golden details, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is horizontal and in the shape similar to a bird, with a long orange beak and accents, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

===Hints=== Due to changes in the way [[Traveling Spirits#Hints|Traveling Spirits]] are revealed, Spirits are no longer expected to receive text hints for the foreseeable future. Below are the hints that were provided when this Spirit visited during the period when text hints were given out. The hints given before the [[Admiring Actor]]'s first appearance were: {{Collapse |id=mw-customcollapsible-TSHint |label=First Visit Hints |content=
* Will have some fingers * Will also probably have some shoes too * May even have some EYES * Will be wanting to become friends with many Skykids! * Is NOT going to be aeri in a spirit disguise * Is toooooootally not a krill * Is definitely not a stack of crabs in a coat * Will be traveling from a galaxy far far away * Prices will need at least one candle
}} The hints given before the [[Admiring Actor]]'s second appearance were: {{Collapse |id=mw-customcollapsible-TSHint |label=Second Visit Hints |content=
* Loves receiving flowers * Doesn't like taking long walks * Is bad at directions * Would like dogs if they ever met one * Will be in Sky:COTL * Is in a secret club * Hates getting caught in traffic * Gets startled easily * Wishes they were even taller * Dislikes being alone * Knows multiple languages * Always packs trail mix * Hates exercising, don't be like them folks * Can wink with both eyes * Likes the color blue * Likes sugary cereals * Hates getting wet * Likes lofi music * Prefers overcast skies * Does ceramics as a hobby * Is great at improv * Is bad at card games * Prefers designer clothing * Always loses at rock paper scissors * Likes shiny objects * Likes alliteration * Burns their cooking * Enjoys writing * Has a bug collection * Seems to rarely sleep
}} The hints given before the [[Admiring Actor]]'s third appearance were: {{Collapse |id=mw-customcollapsible-TSHint |label=Third Visit Hints |content=
* Was short as a child * Has never worked in retail * Would visit Zora's domain in Hyrule first * Is perceptive to others emotions * Takes their coffee with 4 shots of espresso * Lies about sleeping
}}

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this entity is dark grey and round, with a crescent-shaped hole for an eye on the left side, and a complete crack going from the top right to the bottom left, sprouting Darkness Plant on the right eye, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Darkness Plant Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Neck Accessory.description: The Neck Accessory offered by this entity is a small gray Dark Crab that rests on the player's left shoulder, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Dragon Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this entity is inspired by a Dark Dragon, with a long spiky section of hair in the back resembling a Dark Dragon's tail, two strands of hair in the front resembling the front legs, and a black hair accessory with a red dot in the middle attached to the forehead resembling a Dark Dragon's head, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Dragon Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this entity is a small simplified Darkness Plant that rests to the top left side of the player's head, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Darkness Plant Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this entity is inspired by Darkness Plants, colored black and teal, with a waved edge, a collar shaped like a Darkness Plant, and small glowing orb ornaments around the trim, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Darkness Plant Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this entity (also called Dark Horn or Krill Horn) is gray and horn-shaped, with a similar texture to dead wood, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a held Prop that can be used to make a deep call. It is not considered an Instrument since Music Sheets cannot be played with it, and it cannot be used to practice in the Harmony Hall's Rehearsal Room. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Dragon Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Traveling Spirit.description: During the Season of Shattering, there were two separate Friendship Trees for the Ancient Darkness' collectibles. In front of the Ancient Darkness structure, the Dragon Tree could be found, offering items mostly themed around Dark Dragons, hence the informal name. Behind it was the Darkness Plant Tree, offering items themed mostly around Darkness Plants. Despite differing from Seasonal Spirits, the Shattering entities are confirmed to return in the future In the Season of Shattering TGC Designer Q&A on Reddit, TGC_Atlas answered the question "How will the 'Spirits' for this season work when it comes to Travelling Spirits? Will they ever return?" with "They will return. It will be a while though. We have a few ideas currently and are still considering what is the best way to re-introduce them in the future.".
Traveling Spirit.raw:
During the [[Season of Shattering]], there were two separate Friendship Trees for the Ancient Darkness' [[collectibles]]. In front of the Ancient Darkness structure, the '''Dragon Tree''' could be found, offering items mostly themed around [[Dark Dragons]], hence the informal name. Behind it was the '''Darkness Plant Tree''', offering items themed mostly around [[Flora, Minerals and Elements of Sky#Darkness|Darkness Plants]]. Despite differing from Seasonal Spirits, the Shattering entities are confirmed to return in the future <ref>In the  [https://www.reddit.com/r/SkyGame/comments/x85xze/comment/innethr/ Season of Shattering TGC Designer Q&A on Reddit], TGC_Atlas answered the question "How will the 'Spirits' for this season work when it comes to Travelling Spirits? Will they ever return?" with "They will return. It will be a while though. We have a few ideas currently and are still considering what is the best way to re-introduce them in the future."</ref>.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this entity includes a straight-cut, knee-length white underdress with yellow triangle accents around the bottom, and a long-sleeved white robe with a trim shaped like Manta wings, dipped in yellow around the edges, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Manta Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hairstyles.description: The first Hair offered by this entity glows and is shaped like a Royal Jellyfish, with a big white blob sitting on top of the head as the body, attached to it are four white tentacles with a yellow tip, and a yellow crown that sits on top of the body, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Jellyfish Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this entity is a pale yellow butterfly that rests towards the top side of the player's head, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Jellyfish Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

= Jellyfish Cape =.description: The first Cape offered by this entity is shaped like a Jellyfish, poofy and white with a yellow, zig-zag crown-like pattern around the neckline and several short tentacles tipped with yellow, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Jellyfish Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

= Manta Cape =.description: The second Cape offered by this entity is shaped like a Small Manta, resembling the ones found near the large bells monument at Sanctuary Islands, short and white with the tail end barely tipped yellow, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season, from the Manta Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Traveling Spirit.description: During the Season of Shattering, there were two separate Friendship Trees for the Ancient Light's collectibles. At the base of the Ancient Light structure, the Jellyfish Tree could be found, offering items mostly themed around Jellyfish, hence the informal name. Above was the Manta Tree, offering items themed mostly around Mantas. Despite differing from Seasonal Spirits, the Shattering entities are confirmed to return in the future In the Season of Shattering TGC Designer Q&A on Reddit, TGC_Atlas answered the question "How will the 'Spirits' for this season work when it comes to Travelling Spirits? Will they ever return?" with "They will return. It will be a while though. We have a few ideas currently and are still considering what is the best way to re-introduce them in the future.".

name: Anxious_Angler
summary: The Anxious Angler is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Abyss who offers the inline_text Expression. The Anxious Angler is found in the Treasure Reef, on the far-left islands, on the opposite side of the lagoon past the Abyss Guide's ship. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, a Hair, and a Cape.

Memory.text: <div> <div> The Anxious Angler can be found in the Treasure Reef, on the far-left islands, on the opposite side of the lagoon past the Abyss Guide's ship. This Spirit has a standard memory with 6 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Anxious Angler, accompanied by the Abyss Guide, can be seen going out fishing along the rocks. The Anxious Angler tosses a net into the water and comes up with a decent haul of fish while the Abyss Guide watches closely with a bucket in hand. The Anxious Angler then rushes ahead, leaving the Abyss Guide behind as they stretch out an arm, as if to say, "Wait up!" Now alone and vulnerable, the Anxious Angler tenses up as they realize that something sinister has drawn near - a Dark Dragon, cruising along in the shallows behind them. At the end of the memory, the Anxious Angler tenses up further, fearfully glancing over their shoulder as they anticipate the worst... but they go unnoticed by the Dark Dragon, and they heave a gusty sigh of relief.

levels.description: will make your avatar hunch their shoulders, loosely raising their hands to hold them close to their torso, before slowly looking over their right shoulder for a few seconds, then heave a sigh of relief while a wooden tapping sound effect plays.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with three white dots appearing in your avatar's line of vision and a small breath cloud appearing as they sigh.

will make your avatar raise their hands close to their body, slightly bend their knees, and slowly look over their left shoulder, before physically flinching. Immediately afterwards, they stand up straight, holding one hand over their mouth with the other arm crossed over their body while looking around, their head moving in a fast, choppy motion. At last, they relax. During this Level, a rattling sound builds up, comes to a halt with a sudden drum sound, and is then followed by a few dull guitar notes.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with three larger, blue glowing dots appearing in your avatar's line of vision before small blue sparkles, representing nerves or sweat, rain from their side.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit includes a long-sleeve, off-white tunic with brown accents and a high neck with a "v"-shaped slit, dark gray pants, and dark brown boots, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's sixth node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is dark gray and resembles a dull, extinguished version of the Base Mask that features a long, light gray scar across the lower half of the face, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit consists out of a brown angler hat, a simple braid in the back, and short, choppy bangs, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a short, dark-gray shawl with a fringed edge and a small golden ornament attached to the front, filled with a turquoise crystal, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Apologetic_Lumberjack
summary: The Apologetic Lumberjack is a Regular Spirit in Hidden Forest who offers the inline_text Expression. The Apologetic Lumberjack is found in Boneyard, next to a large tree stump to the left after entering the area from Forest's Brook. (Early Beta testers know this area as "Tree Tunnels.") The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Facepiece and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Apologetic Lumberjack can be found in Boneyard next to a large tree stump to the left after entering the area from Forest's Brook. (Early Beta testers know this area as "Tree Tunnels.") This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 5 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. All of the memory fragments are sheltered from the rain. As their memory unfolds, the Apologetic Lumberjack is seen using an axe to chop down a large tree. Once they've made enough swings to the felling notch, the humongous tree comes crashing down - and nearly crushes another nearby Spirit. At the end of the memory, the Apologetic Lumberjack profusely apologizes to the Spirit they nearly squashed, dropping to their hands and knees in a deep bow to demonstrate their sincerity.

Face Accessory.description: The Face AccessoryThis item was recategorized from a Mask to a Face Accessory as a result of the Closet category expansion in Patch . offered by this Spirit is a silver head guard in the shape of a diamond (closely resembling the Elder of the Forest's Face Accessory), costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fifth node.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a pair of small, high pigtails tied with silver and blue bands and short bangs, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node.

name: Applauding_Bellmaker
summary: The Applauding Bellmaker is a Regular Spirit in Daylight Prairie who offers the inline_text Expression. The Applauding Bellmaker is found in Prairie Villages on the left-hand island, in a cave behind a two-player door. The only collectible offered by this Spirit is a Hair.

Memory.text: The Applauding Bellmaker can be found in Prairie Villages on the left-hand island, in a cave behind a two-player door that also houses a Child of Light. This is likely to be the first multi-person door encountered by new players. To open it, two players must each hold their Flame to one of the flame icons on the door. If you are alone, you can request help from another player by Deep Calling or explore the rest of the area while you wait for others to appear. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 5 memory fragmentsMemory fragment count provided by . and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Applauding Bellmaker is seen carrying a large bell with the help of another Spirit. Together, they make their way out of the cave and up the hill, pausing to take a rest partway through the climb. Continuing onward, the Spirits reach the bell tower at the peak of the island. At the end of the memory, the Applauding Bellmaker's companion climbs the bell tower to install the new bell. Now working once again, the bell begins to spin and ring out, causing the Applauding Bellmaker to clap in congratulation of a job well done.

levels.description: will make your avatar raise both hands to chest level and clap them together at a moderate pace. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your character.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with white starburst effects appearing from your avatar's clapping hands.
will make your avatar raise both hands to chest level and clap them together with exaggerated movements at a slow pace. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your character.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with purple starburst effects appearing from your avatar's clapping hands.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a pair of short, horizontal pigtails tied with a silver and blue band, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node.

name: Ascetic_Monk
summary: The Ascetic Monk is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Moments who offers the inline_text Expression. The Ascetic Monk is found in the Prairie Peaks, on the snowy mountain top to the left about halfway through the area. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Ascetic Monk can be found in the Prairie Peaks, on the snowy mountain top to the left about halfway through the area. Climb the side of the mountain via a natural path that will take you directly to the Spirit. A few flowers strewn across your path can help you gain back your wing power if you don't have enough to go all the way. This Spirit has a standard memory with 8 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Ascetic Monk can be seen building three structures resembling cairns, carefully pilling stones on top of each other to form a triangle. Once completed, they strike a meditative pose at the center and concentrate to balance the rocks - but a strong wind knocks the Spirit off their feet, causing the structures to collapse on themselves. Undeterred, they start over and build the structures back up, once again attempting to achieve balance. At the end of the memory, the Ascetic Monk is in harmony with the wind, keeping all three monuments in balance at the same time. However, their concentration soon breaks, and the three monuments fall yet again. Discouraged by the situation, the Ascetic Monk slumps in defeat and lets their arms fall.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a long gray robe with dull blue ornaments, long sleeves, and a beige sash with yellow ornaments wrapped from shoulder to hip. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a beige bandana marked with a yellow triangle, that wraps around the player's eyes and is tied in the back with a knot. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a yellow sun-shaped tattoo printed on a shaved head. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

name: AURORA_Encore_Concerts
summary: Sky is collaborating once more with acclaimed vocal artist AURORA to guide players through a musical journey! The AURORA Encore Concerts run from August 23, 2023 at 00:00 PDT (UTC-7) through September 3, 2023 at 23:59 PDT (UTC-7), during which the AURORA Concert will be open to everyone as part of a celebration for Sky's attendance at gamescon in Cologne, Germany. For the duration of the event, the AURORA Guide appears in Home, offering to teleport players directly to the Coliseum.

name: Backflipping_Champion
summary: The Backflipping Champion is a Regular Spirit in the Valley of Triumph who offers the inline_text Expression. The Backflipping Champion is found in the Citadel, in one of the small outer towers to the left of the main structure. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Facepiece and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Backflipping Champion can be found in the Citadel, in one of the small outer towers to the left of the main structure, beneath an intact roof. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 10 memory fragments and a 4-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Backflipping Champion hops onto a Manta and rides it around the main Citadel structure. The pair then pass through the large floating ring at the center of the area before heading towards the tallest towers, where the Spirit dismounts. At the end of the memory, the Backflipping Champion warms up with a quick stretch and then performs a backflip that smoothly transitions into a proud pose as the Spirit shows off for their onlookers.

levels.description: will make your avatar hop into a crouch before pushing off into a backflip, then land in a crouch before standing up.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with sparkles following both feet and light particles bursting out from your avatar's hand upon landing.
will make your avatar curl forward and push off from their right leg into a front flip, then land in a crouch before standing back up with a hop.

name: Baffled_Botanist
summary: The Baffled Botanist is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Assembly who offers the inline_text Expression. The Baffled Botanist is found in the Hidden Forest, in the third area of the Forest Clearing, behind the first treehouse on the player's left-handed side upon entering. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, and a Prop.

Memory.text: The Baffled Botanist can be found in the Hidden Forest, in the third area of the Forest Clearing, behind the first treehouse on the player's left-handed side upon entering. This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. The second and fifth memory fragments are exposed to the polluted rain, so players should hurry with reliving them. As their memory unfolds, the Baffled Botanist can be seen carrying a heavy lantern from the bottom of the treehouse, up the stairs, and onto a bookshelf located on the top platform. Once done, they go down again, pick up another lantern, and bring it up the stairs. Unfortunately, they drop the lantern off the top platform. At the end of the memory, the Baffled Botanist looks from the treehouse down to the Scolding Student, which stands next to the broken lantern, which makes the Botanist slam their palm against their forehead and shake their head in dismay.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is round and stone-gray, with a single yellow teardrop shape placed under the right eye, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a short choppy hairstyle with bangs hanging into and over the face as if they've been swept in direction by the wind, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a grey spotlight with yellow accents, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. It produces a beam of light, illuminating whatever it points at. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Bearhug_Hermit
summary: The Bearhug Hermit (colloquially known as the Yeti) is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Dreams who offers the inline_text. The Bearhug Hermit is found in the Village of Dreams behind a building near the steps leading to the boats. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a headpiece, a Hair, and the .

Memory.text: The Bearhug Hermit can be found in the Village of Dreams behind the building leading to the platform where boats can be activated to take players to the top of the slope in the Village. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 7 fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. Along the way, steps will help the player carry the Spirit to the top but some controlled flying will be required for portion of the path without steps. As their memory unfolds, the Hermit can be seen following the Cheerful Spectator and Leaping Dancer from afar while hiding behind the buildings and on the mountain. Afterwards, the Hermit continues on their mountain path until they spot the little Skater hanging from a cliff. At the 4th memory, players will need to carry the light from inside the tunnel on your right to the top of the overhang with the little Skater. Let it drop below to activate the 5th memory of the Hermit diving to catch the falling little Skater. At the end of the memory, the little Skater is grateful that the Hermit saved them from falling. To comfort them, the Hermit gives the little Skater a big bearhug.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is overall white and fluffy, consisting of a short-sleeved top, arm warmers, a grey belt with a piece of black, red and yellow fabric hanging from it, long fluffy pants, and hoof-like shoes, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Head Accessory.description: The Head AccessoryThis item was recategorized from a Hair Accessory to a Face Accessory as a result of the Closet category expansion in Patch . It became a Head Accessory after the split of the Face Accessory category in Patch . offered by this Spirit is a pair of big red horns, each attached to one side of the head, one of which is partially cut off as if broken, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is big and fluffy, seamlessly transitioning from the top hair to a beard, with a small, flat, black and red colored hat on top, and a small ponytail sticking out of it, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Free's fifth node ( total). Note that when worn with a mask, players will only see a small portion of the mask below, since the hair covers most of the face.

name: Beckoning_Ruler
summary: The Beckoning Ruler is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of The Little Prince who offers the inline_text Expression. The Beckoning Ruler is found towards the back of Starlight Desert, left of the throne on the floating Crown Island between the Rose Garden and the giant pile of books. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Beckoning Ruler can be found towards the back of Starlight Desert, left of the throne on the floating Crown Island between the Rose Garden and the giant pile of books. This Spirit has a standard memory with 6 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Beckoning Ruler can be seen attempting to boss around some Birds which have gathered in different spots on their Crown Island. Some Birds pay the Spirit no mind, while others fly away as they approach. The Beckoning Ruler then strides over to a row of stone statues depicting soldiers holding their swords high in the air, and motion them to move several times. At the end of the memory, the Beckoning Ruler sits on their throne and looks to their left at one of the statues. They stand up to beckon to the statue, but after no response from it, the Spirit walks over and demandingly points at the statue and then towards the ground, motioning them to move once again. The Little Prince enters the scene and asks, "You know they can't move, right?" "I am entitled to command their obedience! My orders are reasonable," the Spirit replies before turning back towards the statue. "From now on, stay where you are." Raising a hand to his chin, the Little Prince contemplates aloud, "Grown-ups are so strange."

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is dark gray and resembles the face of a frog with the player's face visible inside its opened mouth, a thin mustache, and a straight beard with the ends styled into four wide rolls, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a dark gray crown with spikes of varying height (closely resembling the shape of the Crown Island in Starlight Desert) that sits on top of straight, mid-length hair with the ends styled into two wide rolls, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

name: Bereft_Veteran
summary: The Bereft Veteran is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Remembrance who offers the inline_text Expression. The Bereft Veteran is found in the Repository of Refuge in an opening in the wall, on the player's left when entering the area. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Bereft Veteran can be found in the Repository of Refuge in an opening in the wall, on the player's left when entering the area. This Spirit has a standard memory with 8 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Bereft Veteran can be seen as their younger self, standing on a ladder and hanging Chimes on the front porch of their home while their little child watches from below. As the memories progress, the child progresses from being a young kid to an adult and the Bereft Veteran gets older. The child soon leaves home on their own to become a soldier, holding a spear in their hand as they wave goodbye. On a snowy day, the Bereft Veteran sits on a chair inside their home when a soldier comes knocking at their door. They show the Veteran a notice and it is apparent that they've lost their child to the war. Filled with grief, the Bereft Veteran is left standing, crumpled over, next to the Chimes that the two installed together many years ago. At the end of the memory, the Bereft Veteran looks at the Chimes in front of them, remembering their forever-lost child and mourning them with one hand on their heart and the other touching their forehead.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is similar to the Base Mask but colored dark grey, with a big, bushy mustache, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was offered to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a messy short-medium hairstyle that covers the left half of the face, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a long olive-green coat with a darker shoulder scarf, small white buttons, and beige horizontal lines near the Cape's tattered trim, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was offered to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Bird_Whisperer
summary: The Bird Whisperer is a Regular Spirit in Daylight Prairie who offers the inline_text. The Bird Whisperer is found in the Bird Nest, on the right-hand floating island with a hole through it, at the base of the ruined tower. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and .

Memory.text: The Bird Whisperer can be found in the Bird Nest, on the right-hand floating island with a hole through it, at the base of the ruined tower. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 4 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Bird Whisperer is seen carefully ascending the tower, winding around the ruined building to reach the very top. Following them can be a little tricky since any platforms to land on are quite small. The player can either make use of guided movement by walking in the direction of the desired platform and letting the game jump for them, or by expending some Cape Energy to fly directly to the memory fragments. At the end of the memory, the perches on top of the tower, admiring the many Birds flying past. The Spirit sprinkles food around them and whistles (not the same sound as the Bird Call given by them) which attracts a single Bird. It lands to peck around a little bit before chirping and flying away.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a lopsided ponytail tied on top of the head with a silver and blue band, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fourth node.

name: Blushing_Prospector
summary: The Blushing Prospector is a Regular Spirit in Hidden Forest who offers the inline_text Expression. The Blushing Prospector is found beneath a pavilion in Forest's Brook, along the left-hand wall near the entrance from Forest Clearing. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and a Instrument Instrument.

Memory.text: The Blushing Prospector can be found beneath a pavilion in Forest's Brook, along the left-hand wall near the entrance from Forest Clearing. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 5 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. The final memory fragment is the only one not sheltered from the rain. As their memory unfolds, a Spirit is seen carrying an umbrella and approaching a tunnel that the Blushing Prospector stands within. The Spirit offers their umbrella as a shield for the relentless rain, which the Blushing Prospector hesitantly accepts. The pair walk further down the tunnel together until they reach the exit on the other side, where they wave farewell as they go their separate ways. Umbrella in hand, the Blushing Prospector moves toward the ruins of a building to continue on with their day. At the end of the memory, the Blushing Prospector fidgets bashfully, touched by the other Spirit's kindness.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a pair of braided pigtails tied with a silver and blue band and tidy bangs, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node.

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is a brown, double-headed drum shaped like an hourglass, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fifth node. It is played while sitting down. The Drum plays the percussion part on Music Sheets. As with all percussion Instruments, it offers only 8 sounds, all of which are unpitched sounds that do not correspond to different musical notes. Five sounds are for the actual drum sounds; three are for secondary sounds made by hitting, rubbing or slapping the side of the Drum (or its metal part - triangle sound). In Harmony Hall, the Drum can be found in the left-hand room, in a corner to the left of the fireplace, with the other percussion Instruments.

name: Boogie_Kid
summary: The Boogie Kid is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Belonging who offers the inline_text Expression. The Boogie Kid is found in Isle of Dawn, before the gate of a butterfly cave in a cloud island to the right of the temple. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit and a Mask.

Memory.text: The Boogie Kid is found in Isle of Dawn, in a cloud island containing a butterfly filled cave, located to the right of the temple. This Spirit has a standard memory with 4 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. Players use the set of two switches to open the grate. Then, they can fly up to an elevated switch on the right to bring down a moving platform on the other side of the cave. This leads players down a hallway to another set of switches to unlock a sealed butterfly jar. Once the seal is burned, the butterflies flutter to the center of the room where the Spirit once stood. A Deep Call amongst the butterflies causes them to lift the player up and through the hole in the ceiling. As their memory unfolds, the Boogie Kid can be seen opening their arms wide, looking up at the stream of light coming from the hole above, before running towards a tunnel which leads to the top of the island in the clouds. Across the small lake at the top of the island, the Boogie Kid looks up, with arms wide open, at the swarm of butterflies dancing about. At the end of the memory, the Boogie Kid does a little dance in place with their arms loosely lifted up at their sides. The player steps closer, grabs a bell from underneath their cape and rings it, causing the Boogie Kid to stop. They bring their hand to their chin and think for a short while, before they raise up their arm in epiphany, with a glowing exclamation mark blinking above their head.

levels.description: will make your avatar bring up their arms in front of their chest and sway slightly from side to side in-place, while rhythmic bongo sounds plays. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your avatar.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with a glowing burst of sparkles rotating around your avatar's hands.
will make your avatar energetically step from side to side with their arms held up, while faster bongo sounds play. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your avatar.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with a wider glowing burst of sparkles rotating around your avatar's hands.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a long, beige, fluffy jumpsuit, with a simple belt of that same color, balloon pants, a white fluffy neckpiece, arm- and boot cuffs, and blue mittens and boots, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is round and plain beige, similar to the Base Mask, with three rhombus-shaped yellow stones in the middle of the forhead, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

* Will be joining you from a Zoom Call * Will be hungry for candles * Is gonna have some eyes to see * Is afraid of the ocean * Doesn't know how to swim * Is in a Zoom meeting with the rest of TGC * Is coming from a galaxy far far away * Really loves shredded cheese at 3 am * Has pollen allergies * Is a TikTok superstar
}} The hints given before the [[Boogie Kid]]'s second appearance were: {{Collapse |id=mw-customcollapsible-TSHint |label=Second Visit Hints |content=
* Has a favorite snack: string cheese * Draws comics during class * Isn't good at meditating * Is a budding musician * Enjoys playing pranks * Hopes to adopt their very own crab someday * Doesn't like coffee * Is hoppingcrow * Is NOT Pointing Candlemaker * Enjoys decorating * Is alexdolly's plushie * Gets bored on long trips * Always cheers on their friends! * Has a rock collection * Writes action short stories * Likes mint chip ice cream * Would probably play videogames * Loves the outdoors * Likes making forts
}} The hints given before the [[Boogie Kid]]'s third appearance were: {{Collapse |id=mw-customcollapsible-TSHint |label=Third Visit Hints |content=
* Has heated debates about whether sticky buns or cinnamon rolls are better * Gets excited about the small things * Often gets lost without meaning to * Likes to solve problems * Enjoys the sight of migrating butterflies * Will be your cheerleader * Is dedicated at practicing their talents * Treats life like an adventure game * They've got their own theme song * Wears things that a loved one made for them * Enjoys hiking with you * [ash] (The answer is that they're BOTH delicious) * (According to Ash, their silhouette looks like Clefairy.) * [tio] If you show a lot of love to Tio and Ash, they will release the silhouette in 30 minutes
}}

name: Bowing_Medalist
summary: The Bowing Medalist is a Regular Spirit in the Valley of Triumph who offers the inline_text Expression. The Bowing Medalist is found at the very top of the Coliseum stadium seating, to the right of the Temple entrance. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Facepiece and a Hair.

Memory.text: <div>The Bowing Medalist can be found at the very top of the Coliseum stadium seating, to the right of the Temple entrance. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 8 memory fragments and a 4-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Bowing Medalist races down the ramp in between the stadium seats on the very right side of the Coliseum. The Spirit then leaps off of the ramp and into the ice rink in the center of the Coliseum, where they perform a series of complicated spins and jumps all across the rink. At the end of the memory, the Bowing Medalist stands on the center podium upon finishing their performance. They wave to the onlookers in the Coliseum before taking a bow.

levels.description: will make your avatar take a bow at the waist with their hands kept straight at their sides.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with a glowing halo around your avatar's head and a ray of light following their left hand.
will make your avatar take a deeper, more dramatic bow at the waist, with their right hand placed over their torso while extending their left hand behind them.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with a larger glowing halo around your avatar's head and a ray of light following their left hand.

Face Accessory.description: The Face AccessoryThis item was recategorized from a Mask to a Face Accessory as a result of the Closet category expansion in Patch . offered by this Spirit is a silver head guard with curved horns, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fifth node.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a large and spiky lion's mane, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node.

name: Bumbling_Boatswain
summary: The Bumbling Boatswain is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Abyss who offers the inline_text Expression. The Bumbling Boatswain is found in Treasure Reef, next to the ladder leading up to the Abyss Guide's ship. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hairpiece, a Cape, and .

Memory.text: The Bumbling Boatswain can be found very near the Abyss Guide's ship in Treasure Reef in Golden Wasteland, where a ladder is placed like a bridge between the ship and the land. This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Bumbling Boatswain, accompanied by the Abyss Guide, can be seen going scavenging for resources that might help them do repairs on the ship. They find some wooden boards near a broken boat and take them back to the ship. Back on the ship, the Bumbling Boatswain promptly walks into a stick from a canopy tent before the Abyss Guide can warn them, making the planks they've collected fall onto their head. They rub their head in pain while the Abyss Guide reaches out to them, concerned. At the end of the memory, the Bumbling Boatswain rubs their head in pain while the Abyss Guide concernedly reaches towards them.

levels.description: will make your avatar rub their lowered head with their right hand, looking up every now and then, while drum and trombone sound effects play at the beginning of the Expression. Every time your avatar looks up, a small squeaking sound plays. Your avatar will continue rubbing their head until you move; when you do, your avatar will let their hand fall and quickly shake their head.

makes the same motion as Level 1, with a big, orange exclamation mark flickering above your avatar's head during the beginning of the Expression, and orange circular ripples coming from the right hand as they rub their head.

will make your avatar bend down and hold their chest with both hands, before breathing heavily, holding their chest in pain with their left hand, and supporting themselves on their right knee with their right hand, occasionally looking up and reaching forward with their left hand, while drum and descending trombone sound effects play at the beginning of the Expression. Your avatar will continue these actions until you move; when you do, your avatar will straighten up, their hand still on their chest, and take one last heavy breath.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with orange circular ripples quickly coming from your avatar's back.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a gray extinguished version of the Base Mask with a pale scar stretching across the entire face and a mid-length beard, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Spirit is a big, fluffy, brown hat shaped like an acorn cap, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's sixth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a dark blue overcoat with wide sleeves, a beige interior, and beige accent lines in the front, each line adorned with a turquoise square-shaped stone button, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Butterfly_Charmer
summary: The Butterfly Charmer is a Regular Spirit in Daylight Prairie who offers the inline_text Expression. The Butterfly Charmer is found to the left of Butterfly Fields, at the entrance of a large hollow rock dome. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit and two tiers (Cape Tier 2 Cape) of a Cape.

Memory.text: The Butterfly Charmer can be found to the left of Butterfly Fields, at the entrance of a large hollow rock dome. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 3 memory fragmentsMemory fragment count provided by . and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Butterfly Charmer is seen darting around the inside of the hollow dome structure, peeking into several holes within the rock walls. At the end of the memory, the Spirit stands at the center of the dome, admiring the numerous Butterflies fluttering throughout the air. The Butterfly Charmer then raises a hand to allow a Butterfly to briefly land on it before flying away.

levels.description: will make your avatar raise their left arm to the side with their palm facing up and turn their head to look at it. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your character.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with a white glow coming from the raised hand.

will make your avatar complete a full 360 spin on their left leg and raise their left arm forward with their palm facing up and head tilted to look at it. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your character.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with light sparkles flying around your avatar during the spin and a purple glow coming from their raised hand.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a beige half-sleeve top with matching loose, knee-length pants, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's first Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fourth node.

Cape.description: The Butterfly Charmer offers two standard-style yellow Capes; a Tier 1 and a Tier 2 version, costing and respectively. Both are permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node and second Wing Buff respectively. The Tier 2 Cape (and the second Wing Buff that unlocks it) are not needed to complete the Daylight Prairie Constellation. These were both added to the Friendship Tree in Patch on December 15, 2020.

name: Cackling_Cannoneer
summary: The Cackling Cannoneer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Abyss who offers the inline_text Expression. The Cackling Cannoneer is found in the Treasure Reef, on the big island to the player's left, where the Abyss Guide's ship is docked. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, a Cape, and the .

Memory.text: <div> <div> The Cackling Cannoneer can be found in the Treasure Reef, on the big island to the player's left-handed side where the Abyss Guide's ship is docked, past the Bumbling Boatswain and near a broken, wooden boat. This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Cackling Cannoneer can be seen carrying a harpoon gun and sauntering up the slope with the Abyss Guide, who carries a rolled-up target sheet. They stop at a broken wall to prepare for what seems like target practice. The Cannoneer gestures the Abyss Guide to hurry ahead to nail the target sheet to a faraway wall before running back to take cover. Once the two Spirits are safely out of the way, the Cackling Cannoneer takes aim and shoots - hitting the bullseye dead-on. The two Spirits go and observe the target sheet, happy with the shot. At the end of the memory, the Abyss Guide punches the air in delight while the Cackling Cannoneer throws their head back and arms halfway up while laughing heartily and gleefully, pleased by the incredibly successful shot.

levels.description: will make your avatar throw back their head and lift up their clenched fists before laughing heartily, their whole body shaking with the motion, while dark bassoon sound effects play.

makes the same motion as Level 1, with red flames igniting and quickly flaming up as your avatar lifts their hands, then burning in place from their hands. This level is also accompanied by a flame igniting sound effect at the beginning of the Expression.

will make your avatar start to laugh slowly, with their head tilted down and their hands close to their body, before spreading their legs further apart, throwing their head back, and lifting up their arms with clenched fists away from their body while laughing manically, while rising bassoon sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with several high red flames igniting around your avatar on the ground as soon as they spread their legs further apart.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit includes an incomplete, dark gray, diagonally-cracked mask with uneven holes for the eyes and a light crack near the chin that sits on the lower half of the face, and three gray, faded, triangle-shaped markings printed across the exposed forehead, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Hair.description: This Hair offered by this Spirit includes a set of three long, fluffy braids on the right half on the head, two of which hang over the shoulder in the front. Each braid has small strands sticking out, and is tied with wide brown bands at the bottom. The left side of the Hair is shaved and decorated with three triangle-shaped, faded markings near the hairline. The Hair costs from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's sixth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit consists of two layers, tied together in the front with a square-shaped, golden brooch with a turquoise stone, and are shifted slightly to the side: a tattered, dark green cloak, and a shorter, also tattered, layer on top with dark purple scales, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Caring_Companion
summary: The Caring Companion is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Two Embers Part 1. The Caring Companion is found in The Last City, inside a Manatee holding pen, in the back left of the area. Note that they can only be visited after completing Quest #2. The collectible offered by this Spirit is a Prop offered after finishing Quest #5.

Memory.text: The Caring Companion can be found in The Last City, inside a Manatee holding pen, in the back left of the area. The Caring Companion has no conventional memory, but rather a cutscene and a set of interactions. After completing Quest #5 of the Season of The Two Embers - Part 1, players can view their memory and interact with this Spirit. The Caring Companion will also follow the player around in the area, though they will disappear when transitioning to another sub-area or teleporting home. The Manatee Emote Menu can be opened by selecting the inline_text icon at the bottom of the screen. Petting will make the Manatee fly up in front of the player's avatar, before they pet its head. Cuddle will make the player's avatar sit down and pat on their lap, before the Manatee flies to them, lies down on their back, and gets patted on the belly. Down will make the player's avatar make a downward motion with their hand, after which the Manatee sits down in front of them. Using the inline_text Expression will make the Manatee get out of their sitting position and come to the player.

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a carved butterfly toy in white, purple and pale pink like the one taken by the Manatee from the Tender Toymaker during Quest #1, costing . It is a placable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. When visiting the Caring Companion, the Prop can be thrown away by Deep Calling, which will make the Manatee go and fetch it for the playerother than that, it is a purely cosmetic item with no further functionality. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node, after completing Quest #5.

Season Friendship Tree.description: This Friendship Tree shows all the collectibles that can be purchased from this Seasonal Spirit. Unlike typical Seasonal Spirits, all items remain available to all players who have completed the Quest #5 from the Season of The Two Embers - Part 1 and cost regular Currency.

name: Ceasing_Commodore
summary: The Ceasing Commodore is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Abyss who offers the inline_text Expression. The Ceasing Commodore is found in the Treasure Reef on the back side of the little island where the player first lands, near the Abyss Guide's ship. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, and a Cape.

Memory.text: <div> <div> The Ceasing Commodore can be found by flying over the back end of the hill where you first arrive, behind the Abyss Guide's ship. This Spirit has a standard memory with 8 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Ceasing Commodore and the Abyss Guide can be seen going on a search for black crystals. On their search through the island, they spot two crystals at different places, and assemble them in a bucket the Abyss Guide carries, while the Commodore looks for new findings. A bit further on their way, the two adventurers spot another crystal at the top of a tower. The Abyss Guide immediately tries to climb up the wall, but the Ceasing Commodore calmly stops them, volunteering to scale the tower instead. The remaining memory fragments may be a little difficult to gather if you dont have enough Cape Power, as they are placed high up on the tower wall. Use a Deep Call to summon the nearby butterflies, and let yourself be carried up the tower, where a Light Bloom on the wall can be used to recharge your Wings and help you stay there. At the end of the memory, the Ceasing Commodore calms the Abyss Guide's determination to climb the tower. Executing what the Abyss Guide had intended to do, the Ceasing Commodore later hangs from the top ledge of the tower, triumphantly holding the large crystal above their head, while the Abyss Guide, watching from below, jumps up delight.

levels.description: will make your avatar take a small step forward and slightly tilt their head to the side, before extending their arms loosely to the front, palms facing forward, and gently moving them up and down twice, while calm sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 1, but with one invisible circle, surrounded by a white glow, surrounding each of your avatar's hands, as well as trails of while sparkles following their motion.

will make your avatar loosely extend their arms, palms facing foreard, and calmly turn to one side, then the other, and at last assume a centered position, with their arms spread apart infront of them, looking from side to side, while calm sound effects play.

makes the same motion as Level 3, but with two big invisible circles, surrounded by a white glow, appearing on the avatar's hands with each turn, as well as trails of white sparkles following their motion.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit features a tattered, dark-gray version of the Base Mask, with a light scar across the face and a turquoise crystal on the forehead, and a long beard that is divided into two braids, tied with a grey hairband, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit consists of several thick braids along the scalp, adorned with brown hair accessories and shaved sides with manta tattoos along the side hairline, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a fluffy brown cloak with a black and beige trim, and a beige interior, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Ceremonial_Worshiper
summary: The Ceremonial Worshiper is a Regular Spirit in Daylight Prairie who offers the inline_text Expression. The Ceremonial Worshiper is found after the Eight Player Puzzle is completed, behind a two-player door requiring the inline_text Expression and a Spirit Gate requiring six Spirits from Daylight Prairie. This Spirit does not offer any collectibles.

Memory.text: The Ceremonial Worshiper can be found after the Eight Player Puzzle is completed, behind a two-player door requiring the inline_text Expression and a Spirit Gate requiring six Spirits from Daylight Prairie. This Spirit does not have a conventional memory quest; there is no kneeling figure that needs to be lit up. Instead, a cutscene (where the Ceremonial Worshiper and another Spirit are shown reaching towards the sky) is triggered once the Eight Player Puzzle's elevated platform rises to a special area, after all eight golden disks are lit at the same time, and the red candles surrounding the raised platform are lit. All players in the area are then automatically granted the Teamwork Expression.

name: Cheerful_Spectator
summary: The Cheerful Spectator is a Regular Spirit in the Valley of Triumph who offers the inline_text Expression. The Cheerful Spectator is found in the Coliseum, halfway up the seats and above the entrance from the Races. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and a Instrument Instrument.

Memory.text: The Cheerful Spectator can be found in the Coliseum, halfway up the seats and above the entrance from the Races. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 1 memory fragment and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Cheerful Spectator stands on their seat with their arms raised to cheer enthusiastically alongside four other Spirits. At the end of the memory, the Cheerful Spectator hops in place and punches their fists into the air to express their excitement.

levels.description: will make your avatar wind back their arm and then jump up, punching the air with their right fist.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with sparkles following the punching hand.
will make your avatar hunch forward, wiggling with excitement, and then burst into a high jump up, punching the air with their left fist.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with sparkles and a ray of light following the punching hand.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a large afro with a small curl poking out above the forehead, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node.

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is a gray piano keyboard marked with the symbol (despite not being a Seasonal Spirit), costing . It has 12 white keys and 8 black keys but only plays 15 notes, and is played while kneeling. It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fifth node. The Piano plays the melody part on Music Sheets. Its pitch is in the middle range of the game's melody instruments; in C Major, it covers C4 to C6. In Harmony Hall, the Piano can be found on the back wall, to the left of the large decorative panel. It is mounted high on the wall, above the .

name: Chill_Sunbather
summary: The Chill Sunbather is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Sanctuary who offers the inline_text Expression. The Chill Sunbather is found in Sanctuary Islands, next to a Darkness Plant outside a cave on the front right side of the main island. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Facepiece, a Hairpiece, a Cape, and a Prop.

Memory.text: The Chill Sunbather can be found in Sanctuary Islands, next to a Darkness Plant outside a cave on the front right side of the main island. This Spirit has a carry Spirit memory with 10 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. During the memory, the Spirit must be carried through the depths of the cave, up a winding path leading to a Child of Light, and then back out again. This cave is home to many Dark Crabs so repeated Deep Calls are recommended to prevent them from knocking players out of the Spirit's circle. As their memory unfolds, the Chill Sunbather can be seen exploring the cave at a leisurely pace alongside the Sanctuary Guide, seeming unconcerned about the danger presented by the Dark Crabs. As the Spirit makes their way up the spiraling path towards its end, a mischievous pair of Crabs scuttle away with the Chill Sunbather's hat and sunglasses, prompting an alarmed Sanctuary Guide to chase after them to retrieve the stolen items. Unbothered by the theft, the Chill Sunbather continues traveling, eventually making their way back outside of the cave's entrance. At the end of the memory, the Chill Sunbather stands within the cave at the bottom of the winding path, relaxed and idly scratching their belly despite missing both their cape along with their hat and sunglasses. The Sanctuary Guide jogs up to the Spirit to hand over the recovered items, which the Chill Sunbather accepts with little fanfare. Dressed once again in their tropical attire, the Spirit returns to idly scratching their belly as the Sanctuary Guide shakes their head with exasperation.

levels.description: will make your avatar lean back, head tilted to periodically look around, and scratch their belly with their right hand while a low squeaky sound effect plays with every scratch. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your character. Exiting this Expression will make your avatar heartily pat their belly with a nod while a drum sound effect plays.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with sparkles appearing from the avatar's scratching hand, and a glowing blue halo surrounding the same hand during the final pat gesture.

will make your avatar lean back exaggeratedly, head tilted to periodically look around, and pat their belly with both hands while a hollow drum sound effect plays with every pat. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your character.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with sparkles appearing from the avatar's hands.

Face Accessory.description: The Face AccessoryThis item was recategorized from a Mask to a Face Accessory as a result of the Closet category expansion in Patch . offered by this Spirit is a large pair of sunglasses with opaque orange lenses and white frames, costing The Chill Sunbather's Face Accessory price increased from to during their second visit as a Traveling Spirit, presumably due to the new lens effect added to the item in Patch . from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total). In the Patch, a toggle was added to apply an orange/yellow tint to the game.

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair AccessoryThis item was recategorized from a Hair to a Hair Accessory as a result of the Closet category expansion in Patch . offered by this Spirit is a frayed and floppy tan sunhat adorned with a small golden Crab on the right side, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit uses the Base Cape shape and is dark orange with a lighter orange floral pattern and interior, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a gray reclining beach lounge, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. Unlike most other chairs, this item does not offer the ability to Chat with other players - it is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. It appears as a miniature recliner on its owner's back when carried. This item was not available during the Season of Sanctuary. Instead, it was added to the Chill Sunbather's Friendship Tree during their first visit as a Traveling Spirit on August 19, 2021, in conjunction with Days of Summer. During this event, a 30-minute preview Spell of the Prop () was also available for free.

name: Chuckling_Scout
summary: The Chuckling Scout is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Assembly who offers the inline_text Expression. The Chuckling Scout is found in the Forest Boneyard, on a platform outside the Boneyard's treehouse. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, Footwear, a Mask, and a Prop.

Memory.text: The Chuckling Scout can be found in the Boneyard, positioned around the perimeter of a small treehouse on the player's immediate right if entering from the Forest's Brook. The Daydream Forester is also located on the outside of this treehouse; the Chuckling Scout and the Daydream Forester can be found on opposite sides of the structure. This Spirit has a standard memory with 6 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. Be wary while reliving this memory because the Spirit can be damaged by the polluted rain. Be quick to collect the fragments and make sure to bring a friend to recharge. As their memory unfolds, the Chuckling Scout and the Daydream Forester can be seen walking around the perimeter of the treehouse, on the far side of the small stream. The two appear to be gathering sticks before Daydream Forester is distracted from the task and wanders off. The Chuckling Scout follows their friend, sneaking along behind their fellow, preoccupied, Spirit. The Daydream Forester does not seem to notice the Chuckling Scout following along behind them, striking funny poses. At the end of the memory, the Chuckling Scout silently stands behind the Daydream Forester, waiting for the other Spirit to finally notice them. Not realizing that the Chuckling Scout had been following behind them the entire time, the Forester turns around and jumps in alarm. After their sneaky surprise, the Chuckling Scout lets out a small chuckle, shaking their head in amusement.

levels.description: will make your avatar lift their left hand to their lower half of the face as if muffling a chuckle, their shoulders shaking as they laugh, finishing their act off with a slight shake of the head, while whistling sound effects, accompanied by chimes, that together sound like chuckling sounds, play.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with white starburst particles popping up in front of your avatar's face.

will make your avatar lean back and hold both hands to their stomach as they heartily laugh, before stopping to look around and cover their mouth first with one hand, then the other, as if they've realized they have been caught laughing, while whistling sound effects, accompanied by chimes, that together sound like chuckling sounds, play.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with many pink starburst particles popping up in front of your avatar's face.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit includes a light-beige overall and a short-sleeved top underneath, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Shoes.description: The Shoes offered by this Spirit are beige boots with brown shoelaces, crossed twice, costing from the Traveling Spirit. The boots were separated from the outfit in the Patch, becoming a separate cosmetic.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a round dark-grey mask with a thick yellow line under the eyes and a stick tied to each side of the Mask, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is an aerial floating hoop, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. It appears as a hoop on its owner's back when carried. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Comfort_of_Kindness
summary: The Comfort of Kindness is a Seasonal Shop from the Season of Moomin. The Comfort of Kindness is found on a grassy mound to the right in Moominvalley Glade. Unlike typical Seasonal Spirits, there is no need to first relive a Spirit memory to access this Shop and it does not offer an Expression. The collectibles offered by this Shop are a Neckpiece, a Hair, a Cape, a Prop_p, and a Prop_c.

Neck Accessory.description: The Neck Accessory offered by this Shop is a large pink bow tie wrapped around the player's neck. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's fourth node.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Shop is a tightly pulled-back bun shaped like an onion. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's second node.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Shop is a pair of five ghostly, finger-like appendages that stick out from both sides of the player's back, closely resembling the "hands" of the Hattifatteners. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Props.description: This Seasonal Shop offers a total of two Props: a Bridge Painting and a Chandelier.

=Bridge Painting=.description: The first Prop offered by this Shop is an oval painting depicting a bridge over a river with a thick wooden frame, decorated by three spikes on top and a single spike on the bottom. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. When carried on its owner's back, it appears as a blue bag with a yellow drawstring. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

=Chandelier=.description: The second Prop offered by this Shop is a simple bronze chandelier with four arms, each holding a white candle. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces and functions as a light source. Once placed, the player can light the candles and interact with the item to switch the light off and on. When carried on its owner's back, it appears as a blue bag with a yellow drawstring. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

name: Compassionate_Cellist
summary: The Compassionate Cellist is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Duets. The Compassionate Cellist is found in the Concert Hall in Aviary Village, in the curtained-off area behind the backstage hallway where the Duets Seasonal Shops can be found. This Seasonal Spirit is particularly unique compared to others, requiring players to first complete the fourth Seasonal Quest to access their cosmetics and they do not offer an Expression. In addition, this Spirit remains permanently available after the Season ends. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Facepiece and the Instrument.

Face Accessory.description: The Face Accessory offered by this Spirit is a golden tiara made of two disconnected bands that curl over the player's forehead and is topped by a four-pointed star, costing . It is permanently available to all players after completing the fourth Seasonal Quest from the Season of Duets.

Instrument.description: Not to be confused with instrument_c The Instrument offered by this Spirit is the Duets Cello. It has a light purple body with gold accents and features a gradient fish scale design on both the upper and lower half of the body, costing . It is permanently available to all players after completing the fourth Seasonal Quest from the Season of Duets. The player is standing while playing the Instrument, which plays 15 notes, and shares the same sound as the Musician's Legacy Cello.

Friendship Tree.description: This Friendship Tree shows all the collectibles that can be purchased from this Seasonal Spirit. Unlike typical Seasonal Spirits, all items remain permanently available to all players who have completed the fourth Seasonal Quest from the Season of Duets and cost regular Currency.
