name: Confetti_Cousin
summary: The Confetti Cousin is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Belonging who offers the inline_text Expression. The Confetti Cousin is found in Butterfly Fields on top of the round, hollow dome containing the Butterfly Charmer. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Confetti Cousin can be found in Butterfly Fields on top of the round, hollow dome containing the Butterfly Charmer. This Spirit has a collection memory with 9 memory fragments and an 8-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Confetti Cousin can be seen playfully exploring the grassy hills of the Butterfly Fields, stopping frequently to admire blooming flowers. At the end of the memory, the carefree Confetti Cousin launches colorful scraps of confetti into the air several times, using a small popper. The player steps closer, grabs a bell from underneath their cape and rings it, causing the Confetti Cousin to stop. They bring their hand to their chin and think for a short while, before they raise up their arm in epiphany, with a glowing exclamation mark blinking above their head.

levels.description: will make your avatar raise their hands to shoulder level, before performing a pulling gesture as if popping a confetti popper, launching yellow confetti into the air, which turns pink as it falls down, while a popping sound and bell jingling sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 1, but with yellow confetti that turns into different shades of pink and blue, while popping, bell jingling, and quiet firework sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 1, but with green confetti that turns into different shades of orange and red, while popping, bell jingling, and firework launch sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 1, but with yellow confetti that turns red and white, while popping, bell jingling, and firework explosion sound effects play.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a medium length hairstyle with full, short bangs and a large red bow at the top of a thin hairband of that same color, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such cannot be worn over other Hairstyles.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is red with faint diamond markings near the collar, and a straight yellow trim and inner lining, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Confident_Sightseer
summary: The Confident Sightseer is a Regular Spirit in Valley of Triumph who offers the inline_text. The Confident Sightseer is found on a ledge high above the Ice Rink, directly to the right of the entrance from Valley's Social Space. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Confident Sightseer can be found on a ledge high above the Ice Rink, directly to the right of the entrance from Valley's Social Space. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 4 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. Players with few Winged Lights can approach this ledge directly from the slide into the Ice Rink - simply slow down to walk for the last section and use the thin ledge to the right of the slide's end. Alternatively, players can use the momentum of the slide to launch into flight and steer towards the cliff. As their memory unfolds, the Confident Sightseer is seen helping a young Spirit climb the tall ledges along the sides of the Ice Rink. They encourage their small companion to cross the thin arch that stretches between a gap in the cliff before stopping to admire the dazzling view that awaits them at their final destination. At the end of the memory, the young Spirit sits to play in the sand as the Confident Sightseer stands nearby, still admiring the view. They then turn to call the young Spirit over, holding their arms out to pick up them up in a hug. The Confident Sightseer lifts the young Spirit onto their shoulders and turns to face the Ice Rink, taking in the golden landscape that stretches before them.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a beige half-sleeve top with matching baggy pants that cover the feet, costing . Is it permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fourth node.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a flared bob, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node.

name: Costumed_Confetti_Cousin
summary: The Costumed Confetti Cousin is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of the Blue Bird. The Costumed Confetti Cousin is found at the Blue Bird Theater in the Elevated Clearing from Hidden Forest. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, a Hair, and a Hairpiece.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a red knee-length dress with high-collared undershirt, white stockings, and red shoes. It features puffed sleeves, a V-shaped waistband, and diamond decorations hanging off the hem. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a teal, bird-themed masquerade mask. The top, bottom, and eyes are trimmed in silver, and it features a small pointed beak and forehead diamond. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a wide-brimmed red hat with a round bob underneath. The hat has a silver rim and band, and diamond with a large feather. It was available to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Spirit is a large, off-center red bow. It was available to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

name: Courageous_Soldier
summary: The Courageous Soldier is a Regular Spirit in the Golden Wasteland who offers the inline_text. The Courageous Soldier is found in the Graveyard Entrance (also known as the "First Krill Area"), directly in front of the entryway and between two tall columns. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and two tiers (Cape Tier 2 Cape) of a Cape.

Memory.text: The Courageous Soldier can be found in the Graveyard Entrance (also known as the "First Krill Area"), directly in front of the entryway and between two tall columns. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 7 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. The Dark Dragon in this area may lead to difficulty in collecting this Spirit, but patience is key in avoiding its line of sight. As their memory unfolds, the Courageous Soldier makes their way across the rocky terrain of this area, taking care to avoid the Dark Dragon that is circling around the perimeter of the area. They walk across the Polluted Water and up through the broken structure in the center of the area, seemingly unfazed by the danger around them. They finally reach the top of the collapsed structure and continue to trek up to the large awning, where they are no longer in the line of sight of the Dark Dragon. At the end of the memory, the Courageous Soldier stares off into the distance, looking upon the Graveyard that stretches on in front of them. They remain resolute, their stance wide and strong, with their hands balled into fists.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a spiky mohawk, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node.

Cape.description: The Courageous Soldier offers two standard-style green Capes; a Tier 1 and a Tier 2 version, costing and respectively. Both are permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node and second Wing Buff respectively. The Tier 2 Cape (and the second Wing Buff that unlocks it) are not needed to complete the Golden Wasteland Constellation. These were both added to the Friendship Tree in Patch on February 6, 2021.

name: Crab_Walker
summary: The Crab Walker is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Enchantment who offers the inline_text Expression. The Crab Walker is found in the Forgotten Ark, at the entrance of the Dark Crab infested caves to the right of the Ark. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Crab Walker can be found in the Forgotten Ark, at the entrance of the Dark Crab infested caves to the right of the Ark. This Spirit has a collection memory with 6 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Crab Walker can be seen moving throughout the cave tunnels and goofing around with the Crabs that inhabit it, occasionally doing funny poses to imitate the Dark Creatures. At the end of the memory, the Crab Walker is surrounded by several sleeping Crabs, with a single one awake and scuttling across the cave floor. The Crab Walker playfully imitates its movements, puffing up their Cape and squatting down while shuffling from side to side. The bustling Crab suddenly attacks the Crab Walker, which jumps up in fear and runs away.

levels.description: will make your avatar puff up their Cape, squat down, put their hands behind their back, and imitate a [[Dark Crab|Crab]] walking side to side. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your avatar.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with a big, triple golden halo around your avatar's head.

will make your avatar briefly perform the same motion as in Level 1 but at a quicker pace, then flip over onto their back, arms and legs waving helplessly in the air, imitating a stunned Crab. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your avatar. Exiting this Expression will make your avatar rock forward and struggle to stand, before rocking backwards to flip right-side up and land on their feet.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with a glowing halo around your avatar's head while they're upright, and golden light particles flowing around their body while flailing on their back.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a headwear that consists out of tied up hair, a broad purple band around the head with yellow embroidery, and a purple piece of fabric laid around the sides, top, and back of the head, secured with a thin yellow band, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit has a warm, light purple color with a broad, dark purple band around the trim, which is embroidered with yellow thread, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Crab_Whisperer
summary: The Crab Whisperer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Lightseekers who offers the inline_text. The Crab Whisperer is found in the Crab Fields, inside a pipe next to the tunnel entrance from Graveyard. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, a Cape, a Prop, and the .

Memory.text: The Crab Whisperer can be found in the Crab Fields, inside a pipe next to the tunnel entrance from Graveyard. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 5 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. During the memory, the Spirit must be carried through the wrecked ship and up the pipes leading to the Battlefield entrance. Beware the many Dark Crabs along the route and the single Dark Dragon patrolling the shipwreck. Repeated Deep Calls are recommended to prevent Crabs from knocking you out of the Spirit's circle. As their memory unfolds, the Crab Whisperer can be seen traveling cautiously across the inhospitable landscape, braving the dangers of Dark Creatures to search the wreckage of the giant ship. Eventually, the Spirit finds their way up the pipes that climb the back wall of the area - where at the top, the fallen body of another Spirit lies buried in the sand. At the end of the memory, the Crab Whisperer mournfully lets out a high pitched wail.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a round beige mask with a vertical blue stripe over one eye, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit includes a wide-brimmed sunhat with a decorative blue band and medium-length hair, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is blue and shaped like petals, with a yellow trim and a light-purple turtleneck piece, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a vertical section of a pipe, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. This Prop appears as a small pipe on its owner's back when carried. This item was not available during the Season of Lightseekers. Instead, it was added to the Crab Whisperer's Friendship Tree during their second return as a Traveling Spirit on September 2, 2021.

name: Dancing_Performer
summary: The Dancing Performer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Dreams who offers the inline_text Expression. The Dancing Performer is found in the Village of Dreams, on the left when entering from Valley's Social Space, under a canopy in an alley between two buildings. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, a Cape, and the Instrument.

Memory.text: The Dancing Performer can be found in the Village of Dreams, at the end of the slope when entering from Valley's Social Space, between the second- and third-to-last buildings on the left, under a canopy. This Spirit has a standard memory with 6 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Dancing Performer can be seen carrying their Lute and a jar, making their way down to the nearby ice rink. Once at the bottom of the slope, they find the little Skater sitting in the snow by the rink with their head dropped. Seeing this, the Dancing Performer puts down the jar and pulls out their Lute to play a little tune, capturing the little Skater's attention and lifting their sad mood. With their confidence regained, they join the Dancing Performer to dance on the ice rink as the older Spirit continues to strum an upbeat song. At the end of the memory, the Dancing Performer demonstrates a dance with sweeping motions to the applause of the little Skater, teaching them some moves to copy and learn for their final performance at the Coliseum.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is red with yellow and black accents and shaped like the head of a red-crowned crane, with a small beak as well as a full beard, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit includes a black wide-brimmed hat with a chinstrap and yellow accents, sitting on top of tied up hair, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a yellow overcoat with wide sleeves, black lining around the sleeves' trim and the coat's bottom edge, as well as faint zig-zag marks around the bottom hems, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is the Lute, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It has a brown body with a white-colored front, as well as black and yellow accents and four strings. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total). The player is sitting while playing the Instrument, which plays 15 notes. The Lute plays the melody part on Music Sheets. Its pitch is one octave below the standard Instrument (in C major, it covers C3 to C5). In Harmony Hall, the Lute can be found in the left room with all the other stringed Instruments. It is the third Instrument from the left.

name: Daydream_Forester
summary: The Daydream Forester is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Assembly who offers the inline_text Expression. The Daydream Forester is found in the Hidden Forest's Boneyard, behind a treehouse on the player's immediate right when entering from Forest's Brook. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, and the .

Memory.text: The Daydream Forester can be found in the Boneyard, positioned around the perimeter of a small treehouse on the player's immediate right if entering from the Forest's Brook. This Spirit has a standard memory with 6 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. Note that most of the memory fragments are exposed to polluted rain, so be sure to collect them quickly. As their memory unfolds, the Daydream Forester can be seen trailing behind the Chuckling Scout, who is gathering sticks. Daydream Forester follows the Chuckling Scout across the small stream and blows bubbles during their walk. The Forester then follows a particularly large bubble towards the edge of a small cliff at the edge of the area, not noticing the drop-off in front of them. Chuckling Scout leaps after the Daydream Forester and grabs them by the ankle to prevent them from walking off the edge of the cliff. The two Spirits recover under a nearby tree. At the end of the memory, the two Spirits trek back to the smaller treehouse together. The Daydream Forester is distracted by another large bubble and the Chuckling Scout giggles at the sight.

levels.description: will make your avatar look around absentmindedly before holding their right hand up to their face to blow small blue bubbles, while gentle chime and bubbling sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with extra purple bubbles popping up alongside the blue bubbles.

will make your avatar lean forward to blow a single large bubble, and then leap up and try to pop the bubble before waiting for it to drift closer to the ground. Once the bubble is just above your avatar's head, they will pop the bubble. During this Expression, a second bubble sound effect plays and a quiet popping noise can be heard when the character pops the bubble.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with sparkles raining down from the bubble.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is round and dark gray, with a thick yellow line under the eyes, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit features a crown of small yellow flowers with green leaves placed on top of long, voluminous hair with side-swooped bangs and a loose braid in the back, costing The Daydream Forester's Hair price decreased from to during their second visit as a Traveling Spirit. from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Days_of_Color
summary: Days of Color (formerly known as Days of Rainbow) is an annual charity event celebrating diversity, unity, and hope that usually happens around mid-June and lasts until the beginning of July, loosely coinciding with Pride Month. As part of the celebrations, Sky encourages players to make a difference in the real world by partnering with charities that champion equality and support marginalized communities, to whom they donate part of the net profit from IAP sales.

images.file: Five Days of Feast Promo Image.png|Five Days of Feast Promo image

name: Days_of_Healing
summary: The Days of Healing was a one time charity fundraising event held from May 18 to noon PDT (UTC-7) June 22 2020.See . In continuation of TGC's integration of real-world relief efforts in Sky, TGC partnered with Doctors Without Borders and the #PlayApartTogether initiative to support the fight against COVID-19.

title: Days of Music
date: November 25 to December 11, 2024Days of Music 2024 was extended by 2 days due to bugs and server errors. TGC then announced on the In-Game Inbox that they would be extending the event for one more day, for a total of three more days.
name: Days_of_Music
summary: Days of Music is a new event based on the previous year's Harmony Hall Grand Opening celebration event. Days of Music began on July 3, 2023 at 00:00 and ended on July 16, 2023 at 23:59 PDT (all times, UTC -7), taking place in Harmony Hall in Valley of Triumph. During the event, the Harmony Hall Guide at Home offered to take players to the event area.

name: Days_of_Nature
summary: Days of Nature is an annual charity event celebrating Earth Day by highlighting real-life ecological and environmental issues that usually happens around mid-April and lasts until the beginning of May. As part of the celebrations, Sky encourages players to make a difference in the real world by partnering with charities that take concrete action to clean and protect our planet, to whom they donate part of the net profit from IAP sales.

name: Days_of_Summer
summary: To celebrate the summer, Days of Summer began on August 12 (00:00 PDT, UTC-7) through August 25 (23:59 PDT) 2021. For the occasion Home space was decorated with a little beach adorning a sand castle, the Days of summer guide, a tunnel under the sand castle and a fire pit. A floating island gave players the ability to chat and players were able to get some light by lighting seashells and hanging near the fire pit. Themed items for this event were offered through the Summer Guide, in-game shop and Traveling Spirits.

name: Days_of_Summer_Lights
summary: Days of Summer Lights was a later phase of the Days of Summer event where the Lantern from the previous year returned for the occasion as an IAP. The event ran from September 20, 2021 at 00:00 PDT (UTC-7) through October 3, 2021 at 23:59 PDT (UTC-7) and the bonfire in Home was lit once again for players to collect up to a certain amount of Light, growing in size during the second week for a hurrah to celebrate the time of year.

name: Days_of_Treasure
summary: Welcome to Days of Treasure, where maps be mysterious, shovels be plenty, and bounty be ripe for the plunderin! From Monday, March 3, 2025 at 00:00 PST (UTC-8) through Sunday, March 16, 2025 at 23:59 PDT (UTC-7), mind your sea legs and gather 'round, for adventure calls in the land of the seven realms! A series of enchanted maps have drifted into the realms of Sky, leading to troves of hidden wonders. But beware, for the sands of time slip swiftly through the glass, and once the maps magic fades, so too will the treasures! Aye, ye must be swift, sharp, and ready to heave ho!

name: Dismayed_Hunter
summary: The Dismayed Hunter is a Regular Spirit in Hidden Forest who offers the inline_text Expression. The Dismayed Hunter is found in Boneyard, under a ledge to the right after entering the area from Forest's Brook. (Early Beta testers know this area as "Tree Tunnels".) The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and two tiers (Cape Tier 2 Cape) of a Cape.

Memory.text: The Dismayed Hunter can be found in Boneyard, under a ledge to the right after entering the area from Forest's Brook. (Early Beta testers know this area as "Tree Tunnels".) This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 4 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. All of the memory fragments are sheltered from the rain. As their memory unfolds, the Dismayed Hunter is seen stalking through the hollow tree tunnels with a bow in hand, seemingly in an attempt to hunt. The Spirit then pauses to take aim at an unseen entity but ends up losing sight of their prey. At the end of the memory, the Dismayed Hunter stands at the end of the tree tunnels and clutches their head as they glance around, distraught by their failed hunting attempt.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a pair of fluffy pigtails, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node.

Cape.description: The Dismayed Hunter offers two standard-style purple Capes; a Tier 1 and a Tier 2 version, costing and respectively. Both are permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node and second Wing Buff respectively. The Tier 2 Cape (and the second Wing Buff that unlocks it) are not needed to complete the Hidden Forest Constellation. These were both added to the Friendship Tree in Patch on March 16, 2021.

name: Divining_Wise_Grandparent
summary: The Divining Wise Grandparent is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of the Blue Bird. The Divining Wise Grandparent is found at the Blue Bird Theater in the Elevated Clearing from Hidden Forest. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Facepiece, and a Cape.

Face Accessory.description: The Face Accessory offered by this Spirit is a headpiece with silver curls sprouting from a diamond-shaped base. The central vane has glowing symbols at the top. It was available to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is butterfly-shaped, with a starry interior. The high-collared shoulder mantle features two silver moons and tassels. The Cape is decorated with a scalloped silver line, and trimmed in the same color. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Doublefive_Light_Catcher
summary: The Doublefive Light Catcher is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Lightseekers who offers the inline_text. The Doublefive Light Catcher is found on the central floating island of the Bird Nest, behind the small tower. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, and the Instrument.

Memory.text: The Doublefive Light Catcher is found on the central floating island of the Bird's Nest, behind the smallest tower, on the player's left when entering by the Butterfly Fields entrance. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 4 memory fragements and a 6-minute overall time limit. This Spirit memory is relatively easy, with the only difficult portion involving carrying the light to the top of the broken tower, since part of the wall is missing. This portion can either be completed by using the advanced technique of carrying the light by flying, or by making their way up from inside the broken tower, jumping across a series of planks. As their memory unfolds, the Doublefive Light Catcher can be seen playing the flute with a friend as they make their way to the top of the broken tower. The last fragment shows the Spirits sharing a double high five.
Memory.alt_text: Relive the Doublefive Light Catcher's memory

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is plain and beige, with one blue line under each eye, bent in the middle, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a wide, round hat with a brown top, blue underside and chin strap, as well as small glowing light-balls around the edge and tied up hair underneath, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by the Doublefive Light Catcher is the Flute, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is purple with lighter-colored triangles on the sides and is held horizontally. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total). The player is standing up while playing the Instrument, which plays 15 notes. The Flute plays the wind part on Music Sheets. Its pitch the same as the standard Instrument (in C major, it covers C4 to C6). In Harmony Hall, the Flute can be found on the back wall, behind and to the right of the front counter, propped up against the wall next to the alcove containing the Panflute and Horn.

name: Drafts_Days_of_Color
summary: Days of Color (formerly known as Days of Rainbow) is an annual charity event celebrating diversity, unity, and hope that usually happens around mid-June and lasts until the beginning of July, loosely coinciding with Pride Month. As part of the celebrations, Sky encourages players to make a difference in the real world by partnering with charities that champion equality and support marginalized communities, to whom they donate part of the net profit from IAP sales.

name: Echo_of_an_Abandoned_Refuge
summary: The Echo of an Abandoned Refuge is a Seasonal Shop from the Season of Revival. The Shop is found within the left-most building in Aviary Village, marked outside by a sign with Revival's emblem. The collectibles offered by this Shop are Shoes, a Hairpiece, a Cape, and the .

Shoes.description: The Shoes offered at this Shop are a pair of beige sandals with knee-high cross straps. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered at this Shop is an orange paper boat, closely resembling Message Boats, that sits on top your head. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered at this Shop has a blocky orange gradient with a yellow trim, a fluffy white collar, and four red tassels hanging from the neck. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Season Friendship Tree.description: This Friendship Tree provides the collectibles sold by this Shop during the Season of Revival. This Tree can no longer be accessed. However, the items listed here will be available for purchase when the Shop returns as a Traveling Spirit - or in some other form. It is currently unknown how these items will return after the Season of Revival has ended. Because the Echo of an Abandoned Refuge was not a Seasonal Spirit, either the Traveling Spirit system would have to be modified to allow for non-Spirits, or else thatgamecompany will have to introduce another mechanism for obtaining past-Season cosmetics.

Memory.text: The Elder is sitting on an anvil in front of the altar, looking at the broken stone fragments floating in their hand. They let the shards fall away as they rub their wrist. The small child (you) walks up from behind with a flame in hand. The Elder turns around after sensing your presence. They hop off the anvil and land in front of the child. You timidly look up at them towering over you and back at the flame in your hands. The Elder snatches the flame and brings it to the anvil. With their robe now glowing, the Elder stretches their left hand towards the sky to call forth a radiant hammer. They strike the flame twice, throw the hammer aside, and summon the stone fragments to encase the flame in a octahedron container. The octahedron ascends.

Ultimate Shield Face Accessory.description: The Ultimate Shield Face AccessoryThis item was recategorized from a Mask to a Face Accessory as a result of the Closet category expansion in Patch . costs and is only available once you have acquired the above Elder's Ultimate Hair.

Ultimate Hair.description: The Ultimate Hair costs and is only available once you have completed the Hidden Forest Constellation. It is made of long hair that hangs over the eyes and is tied in sections at the bottom, a few of which are laid over the shoulders in the front, each tied by a wide, blue, ring-shaped hair accessory with silver edges.

Memory.text: The Isle Elder's memory begins with a view of the Eden Mountain. The camera pans down to show the Elder plodding along with the help of a long staff, past an endless flock of birds. The Elder with the broken mask comes forward and kneels to capture the alter candle's flame with the tip of their staff. As they raise their staff, radiating with energy, the missing parts of the mask emerge to complete it, finally regaining their former glory. Now standing tall and proud, the Elder notices the small kid (you), kneeling and looking up at them. You exchange nods with them. With a wave of their staff, the Elder redirects the flight of birds into the sky. Back at the temple, the doors open and the birds swoop into the now illuminated room.

Ultimate Shield Face Accessory.description: The Ultimate Shield Face AccessoryThis item was recategorized from a Mask to a Face Accessory as a result of the Closet category expansion in Patch . costs and is only available once you have acquired the above Elder's Ultimate Hair.

Ultimate Hair.description: The Elder Isle Ultimate Hair costs and is only available once you have completed the Isle of Dawn Constellation. It is a mid-lengthed beard that is split in the middle and rounded at the sides. Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Face Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

Memory.text: The camera pans down to show an Elder who appears to be sleeping soundly with a large jar under one arm. Suddenly, the Elder wakes up, gets up, and stretches their arms, extending them to show their full wingspan. They turn around and gasp at the sight of the candles on the altar. The Elder picks up the candle flame and brings it up to their chest, which causes their robe to illuminate. Re-energized, the Elder molds a butterfly with the flame between their hands. The glowing butterfly flies away making a circle around the little child (you), but comes back to rest on the Elder's shoulder. The Elder offers the big jar to the butterfly and it flies inside. They place the jar squarely on the altar. Back at the temple, all the jars in the room suddenly explode with sparkles of light and fill the room with butterflies.

Ultimate Shield Face Accessory.description: The Ultimate Shield Face AccessoryThis item was recategorized from a Mask to a Face Accessory as a result of the Closet category expansion in Patch . costs and is only available once you have acquired the above Elder's Ultimate Hair.

Ultimate Hair.description: The Ultimate Hair costs and is only available once you have completed the Daylight Prairie Constellation. It consists of a chunk of hair sticking out on each side of the head, pointing slightly upwards.

Memory.text: The Valley Elders' memory begins the camera panning up to show the temple and coliseum. The child (you) turns around to see a figure standing alert in the distance, holding a radiant stick to their side. The Twins step apart in an theatrical reveal and show off by striking their synchronized poses, twirling their paddles, and performing flips. They take a giant leap and jump over the child. The Twin with the bobbed hair kneels and holds out their hand. Seeing this, the Twin with the spiky hair takes a step forward to extend their hand further towards the child, but is immediately cut off by the first Twin. Using their paddle, the second Twin hits the flame out of the child's hands and catches it, while the other Twin and child follow in pursuit. The second Twin dodges a swing by the other Twin with a great leap and lobs the flame once again. The flame rebounds off the child's failed catch back to the second Twin. This short-lived game of cat-and-mouse ends with the second Twin launching the flame out of the coliseum.

Ultimate Hair.description: The Ultimate Hair costs and is only available once you have completed the Valley of Triumph Constellation. It is a voluminous chin-lengthed hairstyle that is styled like a big triangle with perfectly straight ends, small inwards-curled strands near the cheeks, and a triangle-shaped bang.

Memory.text: The kneeling Elder with the octahedron looks up towards the child (you). They make beckoning gesture and the child approaches with flame in hand. The Elder picks up the octahedron and brings it up to their face with their eyes closed briefly. They hold out the octahedron to the child and nod, signaling for the child to do the same. The child complies and the flame enters the octahedron. The Elder hands the child the dimly glowing octahedron. Looking up, the child releases the octahedron as it floats up into the darkness. Against the starry background, the camera pans down towards an dim octahedron. It fills up with light. Each of the realm's constellations radiate out and transform into beautiful murals, depicting each Elder's story. After the final Vault constellation mural is revealed, all the Elders appear standing in line (from left to right: Forest, Wasteland, Vault, Prairie, Isle, and Valley). The Vault Elder lowers their arms and the murals fade away behind them. One at a time, all of them but the Vault Elder slowly kneel before you. The camera pans up towards a constellation in the shape of a crown. It transforms into a kneeling royal holding a floating orb in front of a castle and pillars.

Ultimate Hair.description: The Ultimate Hair costs and is only available once you have completed the Vault of Knowledge Constellation. It is a smooth, fitted, hood-like hairstyle that is rounded at the bottom and goes over the shoulders, only leaving a hole for the face.

Memory.text: The mighty Elder, wielding a spear and shield, jumps down from high above and lands next to the small child (you). The Elder thrusts their spear and swings their shield. With a final swing of the spear, the Elder collapses to the ground. The child walks over with flame in hand and places it on their spear. The spear begins to glow and the Elder uses it as support to stand back up. Their robes begin to illuminate as they wave their spear upwards, ejecting the flame into the sky.

Ultimate Hair.description: The Ultimate Hair costs and is only available once you have completed the Golden Wasteland Constellation. It is short mohawk hairstyle with long hair at the bottom, which is styled in big triangle-shaped sections that stick out.

name: Exhausted_Dock_Worker
summary: The Exhausted Dock Worker is a Regular Spirit in Daylight Prairie who offers the inline_text Expression (not to be confused with Prairie's other weary worker, the ). The Exhausted Dock Worker is found in a tunnel on the left-hand side of Prairie Caves, behind a Spirit Gate requiring one Spirit from Hidden Forest. The only collectible offered by this Spirit is a facepiece.

Memory.text: The Exhausted Dock Worker can be found in a tunnel on the left-hand side of Prairie Caves, behind a Spirit Gate requiring one Spirit from Hidden Forest. There are two possible entrances to this tunnel: one in the central cave itself, and one closer to the Prairie Villages exit. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 5 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Exhausted Dock Worker is seen strolling down through the tunnel, steadily making their way to the boat dock and into the nearby chamber containing a warehouse. At the end of the memory, another Spirit pulls a large, heavy jar off the shelves of the warehouse and tosses it to the Exhausted Dock Worker. They catch it, stumbling backwards with the weight of the jar, and hastily sets it down on the step behind them with a huge thud. The Exhausted Dock Worker wipes their brow, and the other worker shakes their head at the unimpressive display.
Memory.alt_text: Relive the Exhausted Dock Worker's memory

levels.description: will make your avatar raise your right arm to swipe it across their forehead, as if to wipe away sweat.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with light particles, representing sweat, appearing from the wiping gesture.
will make your avatar raise both arms to swipe them across their forehead more emphatically, as if to wipe away sweat.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with light particles, representing sweat, appearing from the wiping gesture.

Face Accessory.description: The Face AccessoryThis item was recategorized from a Mask to a Face Accessory as a result of the Closet category expansion in Patch . offered by this Spirit is a silver head guard in the shape of an upside-down "U" (closely resembling the Elder of the Prairie's Face Accessory), costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fifth node.The Exhausted Dock Worker's Friendship Tree was modified with Patch in August 2020. The Face Accessory was previously available from the Tree's fourth node (i.e., you did not need to purchase the Blessing first).

name: Fainting_Warrior
summary: The Fainting Warrior is a Regular Spirit in the Golden Wasteland who offers the inline_text Expression. The Fainting Warrior is found on the left side of Broken Temple, behind one of the ruined columns. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Fainting Warrior can be found on the left side of Broken Temple, behind one of the ruined columns. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 2 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Fainting Warrior stumbles across the sandy dunes towards another ruined column farther ahead. At the end of the memory, the Fainting Warrior staggers alongside the column, clutching their left shoulder as if they were wounded. Eventually, unable to keep moving, they collapse onto all fours and pass out.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a silver head guard with pointed horns and a mouthpiece that obscures most of the face (closely resembling the Elder of the Wasteland's Mask), costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fifth node.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a long length of hair on the right side of a shaved head, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node.

name: Festival_Spin_Dancer
summary: The Festival Spin Dancer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Rhythm who offers the inline_text Expression. The Festival Spin Dancer is found in the Bird Nest, underneath the landing platform at the entrance when arriving from the Butterfly Fields. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Hair, a Prop, and the .

Memory.text: The Festival Spin Dancer can be found in the Bird Nest, underneath the landing platform at the entrance of the area when arriving from the Butterfly Fields. They are located on the bottom left of the hill that supports the platform. This Spirit has a standard memory with 3 memory fragments and a 3-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Festival Spin Dancer can be seen making their way up the hill and to the stone steps to arrive at the landing platform that faces the area's many floating islands. At the end of the memory, the Festival Spin Dancer takes a bow, hands held straight at their sides, before launching into a spinning dance that they invite the player to imitate.
Memory.alt_text: Relive the Festival Spin Dancer's memory

levels.description: first making a little jump before spinning to the right and then the left. The dance ends with their left hand extended above their head and the right stretched toward their right foot, face turned to follow the gesture, while rhythmic percussion sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with a pink star trailed by sparkles spinning around your dancing avatar.

will make your avatar strike unique dance poses according to which buttons you press on a pop-up menu while fun, short percussion accents play. This pop-up menu is identical to the menu used by the player to hit specific notes when playing an [[Instrument]].
makes the same motion as Level 3 with small sparkles appearing from your avatar's hands.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a pair of puffy purple pants with boots of that same color, and a light blue wrap top, decorated with golden ornaments at the belt and boots, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a ponytail that fans upwards with a gold hair tie, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a pole with a purple flag adorned by the Season of Rhythm emblem, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. This item was not available during the Season of Rhythm. Instead, it was added to the Festival Spin Dancer's Friend Tree during their second visit as a Traveling Spirit on October 14, 2021.

title: Feudal Lord
name: Feudal_Lord
summary: The Feudal Lord, also known as the King, is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of the Nine-Colored Deer who offers the inline_text Expression. The Feudal Lord is found in the Crescent Oasis, to the left of the doorway of the Royal Palace in the village. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hairpiece, a Cape, and the .

Memory.text: The Feudal Lord can be found in the Crescent Oasis, to the left of the doorway of the Royal Palace in the village. This Spirit has a standard memory with 6 memory fragments and a 10-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Feudal Lord can be seen standing arm-in-arm with the Princess at the entrance of the Royal Palace, ready to deliver an announcement in front of a crowd of gathered Spirits. They seek the capture of the Nine-Colored Deer and are calling upon the public for help. As the Feudal Lord hangs up a notice with details of their request outside the building, the Herb Gatherer arrives to the scene, drawn in by the crowd. At the end of the memory, the crowd has dispersed and the Feudal Lord walks back to the Princess waiting on the steps in front of the Palace's entrance. The Feudal Lord stumbles and trips as they climb the stairs, resulting in the Princess picking them up and carrying them back inside.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a pair of large, curved eyebrows on the player's bare face. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Spirit is a tall, golden forehead piece with a small blue gem embedded in the base. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a red cloak that only covers the player's back, with a black and gold drape over the shoulders that features three yellow tassels on the back. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Forgetful_Storyteller
summary: The Forgetful Storyteller is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Performance who offers the inline_text Expression. The Forgetful Storyteller is found on the right side of the Village Theater when entering the area through the main entrance. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, a Hair, and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Forgetful Storyteller can be found in the Village Theater, on the ledge just above the right entrance to the backstage area if facing the stage from within the audience. This Spirit has a standard memory with 10 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Forgetful Storyteller can be seen meeting with the Modest Dancer on a nearby bench. The two talk together on the bench, and a mask and a book are propped up against the bench next to the Storyteller. The Storyteller soon has to say goodbye, and begins to walk away before the Modest Dancer calls them over since they had forgotten the extra mask they brought. The Forgetful Storyteller thanks them and continues towards the stage. Modest Dancer then realizes that Storyteller forgot their book as well, and is seen chasing after the Storyteller to return it to them. The Forgetful Storyteller turns to the Dancer as they present the forgotten book, thankful for the Dancer's help. At the end of the memory, the Dancer returns the book with a flourish, and the Forgetful Storyteller presses their palms agains their cheek in an adoring "Awww" expression.

levels.description: will make your avatar press both palms together and place their clasped hands on their left cheek, rocking from side to side as if admiring something, while a slow xylophone riff sound effect plays.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with a bunch of red hearts quickly flying up behind your avatar.

will make your avatar lean forward to rest their head in their hands, gently shaking their head, while a quick xylophone riff sound effect plays. At the end of the Expression, your avatar will put their hands on their knees and tilt their head to the left as the xylophone riff comes to a close.

makes the same motion as Level 3, with a trail of small pink hearts following the movement of your avatar's hands, as well as a bunch of red hearts flying up during the first half of the Expression, and a big pink heart flickering above their head during the second half.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit includes a long-sleeved top that is divided in the middle, one side a light pink and the other red, as well as poofy red pants and dark-blue shoes with pointed tips, topped with white pom-poms, costing from the Traveling Spirit. The top has a cream-colored pointed collar, yellow stitching around the waist, and is cut in a zig-zag pattern at the bottom. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is round and dark blue, with a light blue circle printed on the lower half, a pointy nose, and droopy eyes, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a red hat resembling that of a joker, with an orange border, yellow stitching around the face hem, and a white tassel hanging from each hat tip, with short, choppy hair peaking out from under the hat, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is made of a flat rectangle that is colored red on the left side, with yellow, rhombus-shaped markings, and dyed yellow on the right side, with red, rhombus-shaped markings, tied together by the top corners in front of the player's throat with a yellow bow, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's sixth node ( total).

name: Frantic_Stagehand
summary: The Frantic Stagehand is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Performance who offers the inline_text. The Frantic Stagehand is found in the Village Theater on the player's left when coming from the Village of Dreams, between two buildings. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, a Hair, and the .

Memory.text: The Frantic Stagehand can be found in the Village Theater, on the player's left when entering from Village of Dreams, between two buildings that face the Theater's stage. This Spirit has a standard memory with 8 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Frantic Stagehand can be seen carrying a large pile of props over to the Village Theater's stage. The Mellow Musician is seen leaning against a nearby building, and watches as the Stagehand drops a small item. The Stagehand walks back to pick up the fallen item, and continues on their way. After this, they drop a much bigger prop, and Musician rushes over to help pick up the larger prop. The two Spirits both carry the props together, sharing the workload for the rest of the walk. At the end of the memory, the two Spirits pause for a moment after dropping off the props near the backstage entrance. The Musician wipes their forehead, and Stagehand dusts off their hands. The Frantic Stagehand then extends a hand to the Mellow Musician, and the two gently shake hands.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a dark blue, long-sleeved dress with a lighter grey shoulder piece and a paint-stained cloth attached to the side, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a round, stone gray mask with a pointed nose and a long, bushy monobrow, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a dark blue hood with cat ear shapes and yellow stitching around the face-framing hem, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

name: Frightened_Refugee
summary: The Frightened Refugee is a Regular Spirit in the Golden Wasteland who offers the inline_text Expression. The Frightened Refugee is found on an elevated platform near a pit of Dark Crabs, partway through Broken Temple. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and a Instrument Instrument.

Memory.text: The Frightened Refugee can be found on an elevated platform near a pit of Dark Crabs, partway through Broken Temple. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 4 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Frightened Refuge runs across the wreckage of the platform, fleeing from an unseen danger and taking shelter within the crooked building nearby. At the end of the memory, the Frightened Refuge glances nervously at their surroundings. Suddenly, the entire building shakes with a loud rumbling noise, causing the Spirit to duck down in terror.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a puffy ponytail with a blue hair tie, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node.

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is a round, wooden hand-held bass harp, costing . It is a four-string Instrument that plays 15 notes and is played standing up. The Contrabass plays the bass part on Music Sheets. Its pitch is three octaves below the standard Piano (in C Major, it covers C1 to C3). In Harmony Hall, this Instrument can be found in the left-hand room, on the same wall as the guitars, sitting on the floor in front of the .

name: Gloating_Narcissist
summary: The Gloating Narcissist is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of The Little Prince who offers the inline_text Expression. The Gloating Narcissist is found behind the right statue on the Starlight Desert's amphitheater, behind the entrance from Vault of Knowledge. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Hair, and the .

Memory.text: The Gloating Narcissist can be found behind the right statue on the Starlight Desert's amphitheater, behind the entrance from Vault of Knowledge. This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and a 10-minute time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Gloating Narcissist can be seen enthusiastically performing for an empty amphitheater. At first, they strike dramatic poses on a floating boat that from one side of the stage to the other. Afterwards, the Spirit dismounts to pose directly in front of the various mirrors that populate the stands. Lastly, the Gloating Narcissist ends the performance by taking a bow at center stage. At the end of the memory, the Spirit pumps up the nonexistent crowd by gesturing widely, in hopes of generating a stronger response. The Little Prince enters the scene clapping, promoting the Gloating Narcissist to announce, "A traveler from afar is here to admire me. I am the handsomest, best-dressed, richest, and most intelligent man on the island." Confused, the Little Prince looks around the empty amphitheater and replies, "But you're the only man here." As if they didn't hear anything, the Gloating Narcissist continues to hype up the nonexistent crowd, calling for them to "Please keep applauding!" The Little Prince obliges and contemplates aloud, "The grown-ups are certainly very odd."

levels.description: will make your avatar raise both arms up and scoop their hands a few times to dynamically animate others to applaude, while whistling and cheering crowd sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with glowing, golden sparkles flying up slowly around your avatar, and blue trails of light following the motion of their hands.

will make your avatar rapidly step to the left with one leg, hold their left hand behind their ear, and scoop their hand up a few times, before standing up straight and holding their right hand behind their right ear, then the left hand behind their left ear, and finally only raising their forearms and scooping their hands inwards a few times, while whistling and applauding sound effects play.

makes the same motion as Level 3, with a blue trails of light following the motion of your avatar's hands, as well as a few glowing, golden sparkles slowly flying up from around your avatar at the final gesture.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit includes a blue, sleeveless jumpsuit with a thick, lighter blue stripe down the middle, poofy pants which end over the knees, and long, blue gloves that reach higher than the elbows, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is made of wavy hair with a side part, a few shorter strands hanging down the front, and longer hair in the back, which is slightly pulled back on the sides, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Grateful_Shell_Collector
summary: The Grateful Shell Collector is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Sanctuary who offers the inline_text Expression. The Grateful Shell Collector is found in the Sanctuary Islands, on the main island at the base of the waterfall where its river runs into the sea. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair, a Cape, and a Prop.

Memory.text: The Grateful Shell Collector can be found in the Sanctuary Islands at the entrance of a large cave, located at sea level and to the left side of the main island if entering from Bird Nest. This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Grateful Shell Collector can be seen making their way through the main island, looking for seashells to collect. The Spirit spots one shell at the bottom of the cave, then goes up to the higher opening in the cave, where they meet the waving Sanctuary Guide, standing next to another shell. The two Spirits then venture into one of the long and winding tunnels above the cave mouth, making their way down the slide. After they exit the tunnel, the Sanctuary Guide offers a shell to the Grateful Shell Collector. At the end of the memory, the Grateful Shell Collector and the Sanctuary Guide stand in the shallow water of the beach, keeping an eye out for more seashells. The Sanctuary Guide then approaches the other Spirit with another discovered shell. The Grateful Shell Collector bows their head and shakes their clasped hands in thanks.
Memory.alt_text: Relive the Grateful Shell Collector's memory

levels.description: will make your avatar bring both hands up to press against their cheeks, before bowing their head and shake their clasped hands infront of them, while wooden xylophone sound effects play.

makes the same motion as Level 1, with a pink heart appearing above the head during the first half of the Expression, and a shower of white light particles falling from the avatar's clasped hands during the second half of the Expression.

will make your avatar sway a bit while holding their hands over their heart and pat one hand with the other, before bowing slightly with crossed legs and opening up their arms wide in a gesture of thanks, while higher wooden xylophone sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with multiple small red hearts flying up and surrounding the avatar, as well as white light particles following their hand movements.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is in a short bowl-cut that goes over half the eyes, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is of a coral color with a rounded edge and beige lines around it, resembling the shape of a seashell, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a pair of wooden deck chairs, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces, and functions as a two-player Chat item. They appear as a pair of chairs on their owner's back when carried. This item was not available during the Season of Sanctuary. It was first introduced in conjunction with the Days of Summer, when the Grateful Shell Collector first returned as a Traveling Spirit on September 30th, 2021.

name: Gratitude_Guide
summary: The Gratitude Guide is a Seasonal Guide from the Season of Gratitude who offered cosmetics and no Quests. The Gratitude Guide was only found at Home during the Season and is longer present in the game. The Ultimate Guide offered a necklace_u and a mask_u for Season Pass holders.

Friendship Tree.raw: Unlike later Ultimate Guides, the Gratitude Guide did not have a Friendship Tree. Instead, the [[#Ultimate Mask|Ultimate Gift]] was obtained by clicking the flag in the middle of the Seasonal Constellation after completing all [[Season of Gratitude#Spirits and Cosmetics|Seasonal Spirits]]. '''Now that the Season is over, their cosmetics are no longer available.'''

name: Greeting_Shaman
summary: The Greeting Shaman is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Gratitude who offers the inline_text Expression. The Greeting Shaman is found on the Fourth Floor of the Vault of Knowledge, at the top of the moving platforms located in front of the Hidden Forest Constellation. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask and the Instrument.

Memory.text: The Greeting Shaman can be found on the Fourth Floor of the Vault of Knowledge , at the top of a set of nine moving platforms in front of the Hidden Forest Constellation. This Spirit has a standard memory with 5 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. This Spirit memory can be challenging to complete, as it involves navigating between moving platforms to collect each memory fragment. It is technically possible to complete this memory without flying (as shown in the video), although it will be of much help if the player has enough Cape Energy. It is possible to travel across the whole structure by jumping between platforms and by waiting for each pair of platforms to come together and jump at the point of closest approach. If the player has enough Cape Energy and means to recharge (such as a friend or an Instant Recharge Spell), this memory can also be completed by flying. As their memory unfolds, the Greeting Shaman can be seen dancing on moving platforms of varying altitudes, striking different poses along the way. At the end of the memory, the Greeting Shaman acknowledges the player by punching one fist into the flat palm of their other hand and motioning it forwards.

levels.description: will make your avatar raise their arms in a 90 angle and punch a closed fist into their opened left palm, before sharply pushing their arms forward with both hands still held together while a thud and a bell sound effect play.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with small golden sparkles appearing from your avatar's hands while they are touching.

will make your avatar rapidly stretch both arms forward, joining at the hands, pull them closer to their chest while they stay parallel to the ground, and move both arms outwards before performing the same motion as in Level 1, while punching and bell sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with a small burst of golden sparkles coming from your avatar's hands at the moment of impact.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is an orange-colored head of a creature with two horns, a rounded snout, a big open smile filled with golden teeth, and brown fur on the sides, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is the Large Bell, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is made of a metallic body and handle, with orange details and golden accents. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total). The player is standing up while playing and clanging on the bell with large arms movement just like the Small Bell. Both bells have similar sounds, but the large bell is somewhat louder with more of an echo and extended ring. In Harmony Hall, the Large Bell can be found in the left-hand room, in a corner with the other percussion Instruments.

name: Hairtousle_Teen
summary: The Hairtousle Teen is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Belonging who offers the inline_text. The Hairtousle Teen is found in the Underground Caverns in Hidden Forest, at the entrance from the Elevated Clearing, near the butterfly jars. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a headpiece, the Instrument, and the .

Memory.text: The Hairtousle Teen is found in the Underground Caverns in Hidden Forest, at the entrance from the Elevated Clearing, near the butterfly jars. This Spirit has a standard memory with 6 memory fragments and a 20-minute overall time limit. At the beginning of the memory, players can burn the wax over the jars containing butterflies and perform a Deep Call, which will make the butterflies gather around the player's avatar and lift them up the cliff to a few Light Blooms, which can be used to ascend further. As their memory unfolds, the Hairtousle Teen can be seen playing guitar for the Pleaful Parent, sitting besides them. Suddenly, the Hairtousle Teen walks away with their head and shoulders dropped, while the Pleaful Parent runs after them. The two Spirits makes their way to a room that is only accessible through a gate which the Pleaful Parent cannot get through, as it is closed. The third fragment is located behind a closed gate, which can only be opened by a button from far away. While the gate does close quickly as soon as the player leaves the button, it is possible to pass through alone, by dashing or flying very quickly when the gate has opened all the way. It will be of most help to have a friend open the gate, before the player passes through and collects the fragment, which will keep the gate open for a bit longer so that the friend can also pass through and join the player. Inside, the Hairtousle Teen stands infront of a ukulele. They take the instrument with them and play it alone on a cliff behind the room, without the Pleaful Parent. Eventually, the Hairtousle Teen takes off alone and retreats to a spot high up on a mountain, opposite of their room. To collect the last fragment on top of a high mountain, Jellyfish and Light Blooms can be of help to ascend further and charge the player's wings. At the end of the memory, the Hairtousle Teen plays a melody on their ukulele, while the player grabs a bell from underneath their cape and rings it, causing the Pleaful Parent to appear infront of the Hairtousle Teen. They stand up and reunite with the Pleaful Parent by playfully tousling their hair. At last, the Pleaful Parent leaves through a tunnel.

Head Accessory.description: The Head Accessory This item was recategorized from a Hair Accessory to a Face Accessory as a result of the Closet category expansion in Patch . It became a Head Accessory after the split of the Face Accessory category in Patch . offered by this Spirit is a pair of round red earmuffs with a fluffy white interior, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is the Ukulele, costing from the Traveling Spirit The Hairtousle Teen's Instrument price decreased from to during their second visit as a Traveling Spirit.. It is a reddish chestnut color with beige and black accents and three white strings. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total). The player sits while playing the Instrument, which plays 15 notes. The Ukulele plays the melody part on Music Sheets. Its pitch is the same as the Instrument and one octave below the standard Instrument; in C major, it covers C3 to C5. In Harmony Hall, the Ukulele can be found in the left room with all the other stringed Instruments. It is the second Instrument from the left.

name: Handstanding_Thrillseeker
summary: The Handstanding Thrillseeker is a Regular Spirit in the Valley of Triumph who offers the inline_text Expression. The Handstanding Thrillseeker is found in the Citadel, behind a parapet on a bridge near the arched entrance. The only collectibles offered by this Spirit are two tiers (Cape Tier 2 Cape) of a Cape.

Memory.text: The Handstanding Thrillseeker can be found in the Citadel, behind a parapet on a bridge near the arched entrance. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 6 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Handstanding Thrillseeker and another Spirit race each other along the main Citadel structure, dashing skillfully up several stairs and across parapets. The unnamed Spirit initially takes the lead, before the Handstanding Thrillseeker quickly catches up and overtakes them, throwing their arms out in celebration as they cross the finish line. At the end of the memory, the victorious Handstanding Thrillseeker waves towards their onlookers and backflips into a handstand - only to lose their balance and tip over.

Cape.description: The Handstanding Thrillseeker offers two standard-style pink Capes; a Tier 1 and a Tier 2 version, costing and respectively. Both are permanently available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node and second Wing Buff respectively. The Tier 2 Cape (and the second Wing Buff that unlocks it) are not needed to complete the Valley of Triumph Constellation. These were both added to the Friendship Tree in Patch on May 27, 2021.

title: Herb Gatherer
name: Herb_Gatherer
summary: The Herb Gatherer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of the Nine-Colored Deer who offers the inline_text Expression. The Herb Gatherer is found within the village in the Crescent Oasis, in front of the bridge that spans across the river outside of the Royal Palace. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Hair, and an Prop.

Memory.text: The Herb Gatherer can be found within the village in the Crescent Oasis, in front of the bridge that spans across the river outside of the Royal Palace. This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and a 10-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Herb Gatherer can be seen kneeling on a blanket that displays various herbs, selling their wares to the residents of the village. A passing Spirit stops to make a purchase but is soon called away by their companions. The distracted shopper drops one of their purchased herbs as they hurry away, prompting the Herb Gatherer to chase after them to return it, grabbing their attention with a whistle. With all their herbs accounted for, the shopper continues heading towards a gathering crowd, followed by a curious Herb Gatherer. At the end of the memory, the Herb Gatherer observes what has drawn a crowd - the Feudal Lord has posted a notice calling for the capture of the Nine-Colored Deer for all to see.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a pair of loose beige pants and two cross body sashes - one black and one white - tucked into a black waistband. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a beige turban with a loose strip hanging in the back. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it cannot be worn over other Hairstyles.

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a small, gray pot with a light blue cloth wrapped around the neck. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

title: Hide'n'Seek Pioneer
name: Hide'n'Seek_Pioneer
summary: The Hide'n'Seek Pioneer is a Regular Spirit in Hidden Forest who offers the inline_text Expression. The Hide'n'Seek Pioneer is found in Forest's Brook in a cave hidden by Darkness Plants, on the right-hand side of the brook before the bridge. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Hide'n'Seek Pioneer can be found in Forest's Brook in a cave hidden by Darkness Plants, on the right-hand side of the brook before the bridge. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 5 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. All of the memory fragments are sheltered from the rain. After burning the Darkness covering the entrance and entering the cave, Deep Calling is recommended to flip the three Dark Crabs guarding the area, preventing them from attacking while you locate the Spirit. As their memory unfolds, the Hide'n'Seek Pioneer is seen beginning a game of Hide and Seek with another Spirit, holding their hands over their eyes as they count down while the other rushes out of the cave to find a hiding spot. The young Spirit then begins to seek out their fellow player, darting about the Forest's Brook in a spirited hunt. At the end of the memory, the Hide'n'Seek Pioneer finally spots the other Spirit peeking around the corner of a pavilion. Still feeling playful, the young Spirit glances both ways behind them in dramatic fashion, as if to request another game of Hide and Seek.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a sleeveless beige dress, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's second Wing Buff. This item was added to the Friendship Tree in Patch on April 1, 2021. The Outfit (and the Wing Buff that unlocks it) are not needed to complete the Hidden Forest Constellation.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit closely resembles the Base Mask but with rounder proportions, costing . This special Mask, which causes players wearing it to be Chibi-sized, is a popular tool for going Out of Bounds (OOB). The Shrink Spell can also be used to temporarily mimic the Mask's effect.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a chin-length bob with bangs, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node.
