name: Hiking_Grouch
summary: The Hiking Grouch is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Sanctuary who offers the inline_text Expression. The Hiking Grouch is found in the Sanctuary Islands, on a grassy outcrop to the right of the main island when facing its front. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Neckpiece, a Hair, and a Prop.

Memory.text: The Hiking Grouch can be found in the Sanctuary Islands, on a grassy outcrop to the right of the main island when facing its front. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 6 memory fragments and a 25-minute overall time limit. During the memory, the Spirit must be carried all the way up the mountain. Certain sections of the path require flying while carrying the Spirit, making this one of the more difficult memories to complete - particularly for players with little Winged Light. The best way to complete this memory is to slowly fly up against the wall while carrying the light - this ensures that the light does not fall down but instead "climbs up the wall" with the player. As their memory unfolds, the Hiking Grouch can be seen being lead up the mountain by the Sanctuary Guide. Together, the two Spirits climb the steps winding around the steep peaks to reach the summit - with the Hiking Grouch looking sullen throughout the entire trek. At the end of the memory, the Sanctuary Guide gestures towards the stunning view from the top of the mountain, encouraging their companion to admire the islands' natural beauty. Utterly unimpressed, the Hiking Grouch crosses their arms and turns away, snubbing the Sanctuary Guide's efforts.

levels.description: will make your avatar twist their upper body to the side, cross both arms, and turn their head away, before looking back and turning to the side again, while a squeaky sound effect resembling an infant's cry plays. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your character.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with a red symbol portraying a popped vein appearing near the head.

will make your avatar take an exaggeratedly big step to the side, their arms with balled fists swinging with the motion, before crossing their arms in a dramatically offended manner and periodically and abruptly looking over their shoulder, while a deeper squeaky sound effect resembling an infant's cry plays. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your character.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with red symbol portraying a popped vein appearing near the head and white light sparkles flying out at the beginning of the motion.

Mask.description: This Mask offered by this Spirit includes a Base Mask and a set of bushy eyebrows and mustache, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Neck Accessory.description: The Neck Accessory offered by this Spirit is a black bowtie, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a bald crown with a u-shaped pattern of hair around the head, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a pair of blue folding beach chairs with faint triangle markings, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces, and allows two players to sit and chat at the same time. The Prop appears as a miniature version of the beach chairs on its owner's back when carried. This item was not available during the Season of Sanctuary. Instead, it was first introduced as an event item for Days of Summer in August 2021 (costing the same ). It was then added to the Hiking Grouch's Friendship Tree during their first return as a Traveling Spirit on February 17, 2022.

title: Hunter
name: Hunter
summary: The Hunter is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of the Nine-Colored Deer who offers the inline_text Expression. The Hunter is found in the Crescent Oasis, on top of the stone ledge that features a Mural near the pool of water. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Hair, and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Hunter can be found in the Crescent Oasis, on top of the stone ledge that features a Mural near the pool of water. This Spirit has a standard memory with 5 memory fragments and a 10-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Hunter spots a pair of Mantas flying nearby and begins to hunt them, carefully sneaking closer with a net in hand. As the Spirit closes in, they start running and launch the net towards the fleeing creatures. At the end of the memory, the Hunter has managed to net one of the Mantas while the other escapes, safe from capture. Pleased by this success, the Hunter stands over their quarry and strikes a pose, proudly flexing both arms.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a wide, salmon colored long-sleeve robe with black boots, a dark red waist wrap, and yellow accents. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is long, curly hairstyle with a small layer pulled up into a bun and a thin red forehead band. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a tattered, loosely wrapped tan scarf with brown accents that drapes over the player's back and is tied in the front with a string. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Indifferent_Alchemist
summary: The Indifferent Alchemist is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Enchantment who offers the inline_text Expression. The Indifferent Alchemist is found far past the Forgotten Ark, on the hills behind the polluted pond. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Indifferent Alchemist can be found far past the Forgotten Ark, on the hills behind the polluted pond where the Red Light is collected. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 6 memory fragments and a 12-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Indifferent Alchemist can be seen climbing over the hill and crawling to a cave entrance below. They sprint through the cave until they reach to what seemed like a dead end in the cave. At the end of the memory, the Alchemist procures a blue light and tosses it into the air. The blue light circles around the room until it settles down on the sand in the center. The Alchemist then shrugs as the blue light doesn't seem to do anything else.

levels.description: will make your avatar hold their hands up and to the side in a shrug pose, shaking their head in confusion, while a saxophone like sound effect plays.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with trails of white sparkles following the avatar's hands, as well as a big glowing question mark appearing over the avatar's head.

will make your avatar raise their arms, palms facing up, and turn from one side to another, their confusion being emphasized with notes of an oboe, before facing forward, still shrugging, while a whistle flute sound effect plays.

makes the same motion as Level 3, with trails of white sparkles following the avatar's hands, and a big, glowing, flickering exclamation mark appearing over the avatar's head with each turn, as well as a big glowing question mark on the final shrug.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit includes a version of the Base Mask but with a shiny golden square replacing the glowing hole on the forehead, as well as a long wavy beard, tied at the end with a brown band, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit consists of a purple turban with golden accents, as well as long wavy hair hanging down the back, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit has two layers, the upper, shorter one having a slightly lighter purple tone and a yellow fringe trim, as well as yellow tassels hanging from a string of the same color, and the lower layer being a slightly darker shade of purple, using the trim of the Base Cape, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Inspiration_of_Inclusion
summary: The Inspiration of Inclusion is a Seasonal Shop from the Season of Moomin. The Inspiration of Inclusion is found on a grassy mound to the right in Moominvalley Glade. Unlike typical Seasonal Spirits, there is no need to first relive a Spirit memory to access this Shop and it does not offer an Expression. The collectibles offered by this Shop are an Outfit, a Neckpiece, a Hairpiece, a Prop_c, and a Prop_p.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Shop is a white, sleeveless romper with a puffy lower half, closely resembling the body shape of Moomintroll. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's fifth node.

Neck Accessory.description: The Neck Accessory offered by this Shop is a red and white striped scarf with a thick fringe that drapes over the player's back. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Shop is a wreath of colorful flowers that sits on top of the player's head. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Props.description: This Seasonal Shop offers a total of two Props: a Grandfather Clock and a Moominhouse Painting.

=Grandfather Clock=.description: The first Prop offered by this Shop is a tall wooden grandfather clock with a pair of four-pointed stars that function as the clock hands. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. When placed, the smaller star on the clock face moves to indicate the minute of the current hour and continually produces a soft ticking sound. When carried on its owner's back, it appears as a blue bag with a yellow drawstring. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's first node.

=Moominhouse Painting=.description: The second Prop offered by this Shop is a square painting depicting the brightly colored Moominhouse sitting on a hill with a thick wooden frame. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. When carried on its owner's back, it appears as a blue bag with a yellow drawstring. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's third node.

name: Jelly_Whisperer
summary: The Jelly Whisperer (sometimes called the Jellyfish Whisperer) is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Sanctuary who offers the inline_text. The Jelly Whisperer is found in the Sanctuary Islands, within a cavern filled with floating Jellyfish on the back side of the main island. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Hair, a Prop, and the .

Memory.text: The Jelly Whisperer can be found in the Sanctuary Islands, within a cavern filled with floating Jellyfish on the back side of the main island. This Spirit has a collection memory with 10 memory fragments and a 16-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Jelly Whisperer and the Sanctuary Guide can be seen roaming around the cavern together, playfully interacting with the many floating Jellyfish that inhabit the area, and performing several flips and jumps by bouncing on their tops. At the end of the memory, the two Spirits stare at a particularly large Jellyfish with awe. The Jelly Whisperer lets out several gentle sounding Calls that echo through the cavern, to which the Jellyfish responds with its own Call.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit includes a pair of dark brown cargo pants and a beige wrap-top with mid-length sleeves, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit resembles a white jellyfish with four tentacles and yellow accents, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a striped beach umbrella, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces and protects players who stand under it from polluted rain. Note that it cannot be held in hand while walking (unlike the umbrellas from the , the Days of Summer event, or the Season of Lightseekers Ultimate Prop). It appears as an open umbrella on its owner's back when carried. This item was not available during the Season of Sanctuary. Instead, it was added to the Jelly Whisperer's Friendship Tree during their first visit as a Traveling Spirit on November 25, 2021.

name: Jolly_Geologist
summary: The Jolly Geologist is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Moments who offers the inline_text Expression. The Jolly Geologist is found in the Prairie Peaks, in a cave located at the far right of the area. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Facepiece, a Hair, a Prop, and the .

Memory.text: The Jolly Geologist can be found in the Prairie Peaks, in a cave located at the far right of the area. Follow a little path leading to a cave at the base of a mountain, where the Spirit is located inside its entrance. This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Jolly Geologist can be seen walking through the cave, collecting luminescent minerals dotted throughout its cavities. Wandering further into the cave, the Spirit spots light coming from an underground water source. Curious, the Jolly Geologist jumps into the water to investigate and swims through a tunnel leading to a large cavern. Awaiting inside is a huge structure of minerals that illuminates the surroundings in a dazzling display of natural beauty. At the end of the memory, the Jolly Geologist cannot contain their joy and does a jaunty victory dance, celebrating their greatest find.

Face Accessory.description: The Face Accessory offered by this Spirit is the bottom half of a gray skull jaw, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a gray, skull-shaped helmet with a blue gem embedded in the forehead and blue drapes on the sides, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a square gray jar filled with long, blue crystals, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Kizuna_AI
summary: The Virtual YouTuber Kizuna AI began her "indefinite hiatus" on February 26, 2022 JST (UTC+9), and to help her fans in Sky mark the occasion, a bundle of items was offered for those wishing for something to remember her by.

name: Laidback_Pioneer
summary: The Laidback Pioneer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Lightseekers who offers the inline_text. The Laidback Pioneer is found on the right side of Forest's Brook, inside a hollow tree downhill from the bonfire. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, a Prop, and the .

Memory.text: The Laidback Pioneer can be found on the right side of Forest's Brook, inside a hollow tree downhill from the bonfire. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 4 memory fragments and a 10-minute overall time limit. In order to successfully carry the light to each fragment through the polluted rain, players can use trees as cover, letting the light recharge in safety before advancing further. As their memory unfolds, the Laidback Pioneer can be seen taking a hike through the rain with their umbrella to the campfire on the higher elevation. After each collected fragment, a big flower spawns in its place. At the end of the memory, the Laidback Pioneer sits down to relax by the campfire, while two other spirits are standing at the side, chatting.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is round and beige, with a tilted line going through the left eye, and a small blue teardrop beneath it, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit consists out of brushed back hair that is loosely french braided in the back tied in a low bun, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a blue umbrella with light-blue details and a straight white grip, costing from the Traveling Spirit. When equipped, this umbrella is carried by the player and provides protection from polluted rain. It cannot be placed and therefore cannot be used in Shared Spaces (unlike the prop offered by the ). When carried on its owners back, the Prop appears in its closed form, with the handle pointing up and to the right. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Laughing_Light_Catcher
summary: The Laughing Light Catcher is a Regular Spirit in Daylight Prairie who offers the inline_text Expression. The Laughing Light Catcher is found in Prairie Villages on the right-hand island, inside a large cave. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and a Instrument Instrument.

Memory.text: The can be found in Prairie Villages on the right-hand island, inside a large cave with a hole in the ceiling. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 4 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Laughing Light Catcher and another Spirit are seen picking up large jars inside the cave. Together, they proceed to carry them outside and up a hill, towards the bell tower that sits atop the small island. At the end of the memory, both Spirits have set down their jars as a flock of Birds passes overhead. The Laughing Light Catcher watches curiously as several balls of light float nearby, while the other Spirit attempts to catch one with a staff. They fail at this task, causing the Laughing Light Catcher to burst into laughter, amused by their companion's clumsy flailing.
Memory.alt_text: Relive the Laughing Light Catcher's memory

levels.description: will make your avatar clutch their stomach with one hand and slap their knee with the other, laughing, and then swipe a hand across their face as if wiping away tears.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with white starburst effects near your avatar's head.

will make your avatar put their hands on their hips and throw back their head with laughter, then lean forward and drum both hands on their knees while stomping both feet, as if they can't contain their amusement.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with many pink starburst effects near your avatar's head.

Hair.description: This Hair offered by this Spirit is a pair of puffy pigtails with blue hair ties, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fourth node.

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is a wooden hand-held harp, costing . It is a seven-string Instrument that plays 15 notes and is played standing up. The IAP variant inspired by this item, the Fledgling Harp, was later introduced with Harmony Hall. The two harps have the same sound, but different visuals. The Harp plays the melody part on Music Sheets. Its pitch is one octave below the standard Piano (in C Major, it covers C3 to C5). In Harmony Hall, this Instrument can be found in the left-hand room, on the same wall as the guitars, sitting on a shelf behind the .

name: Leaping_Dancer
summary: The Leaping Dancer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Gratitude who offers the inline_text Expression. The Leaping Dancer is found behind a two-player door on the right side of the Valley of Triumph's Ice Rink. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask and the Instrument.

Memory.text: The Leaping Dancer can be found in the small room behind the two-player door in the Valley of Triumph's Ice Rink. This door is at the bottom of a slope, to the right of the tunnel with the Troupe Juggler. This Spirit has a collection memory with 21 memory fragments and a 1 minute and 50 seconds overall time limit. Unlike other collection memory Spirits, the Leaping Dancer does not have any memory fragments featuring some sort of story. During their memory, the player must quickly skate around the center ice rink to gather the star-shaped fragments before the time runs out. The player must then open the two-player door once again to return to the Spirit's statue. At the end of the memory, the Leaping Dancer joyfully springs up into the air, landing on both feet with their arms stretched out.

levels.description: will make your avatar turn to the side while quickly jumping high up in the air with their arms outstretched and their legs spread vertically and wide apart, before landing on both feet, in a similar pose to the one they struck in the air, while a high-pitched whistling sound effect plays.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with a trail of white light particles following the movement of your avatar's feet.

will make your avatar jump up, complete a somersault mid-air, and land on the ground in the same pose as seen in Level 1. A similar whistling sound effect plays, but an extra riff is added during the somersault.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with a trail of white light particles following the movement of your avatar's feet.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is red with yellow accents and resembles the face of a fox, with tall, upward pointing ears, a protruding snout, and slanted eyes, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is the Small Bell, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It has a metallic body, golden top, interior, and accents, and an orange handle at the top. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node (total). Most of its characteristics are similar to the . The player stands up while playing and clanging on the bell with large arm movements. The Bell plays the percussion part on Music Sheets. As with all percussion Instruments, it only has 8 notes. These notes are a subset (CDGA in C major) of one octave: i.e., the first row notes are C4, D4, G4, and A4 (from left to right); the second row notes have the same pitches (C4, D4, G4, and A4) but a different timbre. These are a subset of the Instrument's lower octave. The notes shift based upon the current key, as with all Instruments, so more generally the Bell's notes correspond to notes 8, 9, 12, and 13 of the Piano. However, to add one extra complication, keys G, A, A, B or B are shifted down by one octave -- i.e., in those keys the Bell's notes are notes 1, 2, 5, and 6 in the Piano's lower octave. Note that when playing with other Instruments, other players' notes (the purple notes) are shown based on location, not pitch. So in C major, if a Piano plays G4 (its 5th note), the note that turns purple for the Bell is its 5th note, which is C4 instead of G4. In Harmony Hall, the Small Bell can be found in the left-hand room, in a corner with the other percussion Instruments.

name: Levitating_Adept
summary: The Levitating Adept is a Regular Spirit in the Vault of Knowledge who offers the inline_text Expression. The Levitating Adept is found on the Second Floor of Vault, behind the four-player door that must be lifted. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Facepiece and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Levitating Adept can be found on the Second Floor of Vault, behind the four-player door that must be lifted, hiding behind a column in the back left corner of the room. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 3 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Levitating Adept guides two Spirits around the room, pointing to the various lanterns on the floor-to-ceiling shelves. The Levitating Adept then climbs up a ladder to retrieve a lantern while the other two watch, and the trio proceed to carry the lantern into the center of the room. At the end of the memory, the Levitating Adept joins two other Spirits attempting to lift a lantern with telekinesis. While the other two struggle, the Levitating Adept succeeds, lifting the lantern into the air with ease.

will make your avatar lean down and thrust their left hand forward dramatically. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your character.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a simple long and straight cut with messy bangs, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Trees second node.

summary: The Lightseeker Guide is a Seasonal Guide from the Season of Lightseekers who offered cosmetics and no Quests. The Lightseeker Guide was only found at Home during the Season and cannot be found today since they are no longer present in the game. The Ultimate Guide offered a necklace_u and a prop_u for Season Pass holders.

Instead, the [[Lightseeker Guide#Ultimate Gifts|Ultimate Gift]] was obtained by clicking the flag in the middle of the Seasonal Constellation after completing all [[Season of Lightseekers#Spirits and Cosmetics|Seasonal Spirits]]. name: Light_Whisperer
summary: The Light Whisperer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Flight who offers the inline_text. The Light Whisperer is found in the Wind Paths, on the bottom left side of the main island when facing it from the area's main entrance. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Hair, a Hairpiece, and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Light Whisperer can be found in the Wind Paths, on the bottom left side of the main island when facing it from the area's main entrance, next to a pond, with a waterfall above. This Spirit has a standard memory with 9 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Light Whisperer can be seen strolling around the pond as they spot an injured baby Manta. The Spirit hurries to its side and immediately takes the injured creature to a nearby island in a boat pulled by a second, larger Manta. The Light Whisperer urgently carries the Light Creature towards a care station set up on the smaller island, where they tend to the baby Manta. After the Light Whisperer's good care, the baby Manta is able to fly again with help of their caretaker, taking off into the sky as the Spirit watches. At the end of the memory, the Light Whisperer releases the baby Manta into the air, which calls back to the Spirit as it flies away. The Light Whisperer returns the farewell call and watches as the creature flies off.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit consists of a long-sleeved tunic in varying shades of blue with a beige belt, one rolled-up sleeve, simple white pants with beige boots overneath, and decorative strings around the right arm and boots, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is messy and short, with a longer part on the right side tied together by a wide blue band, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Spirit is a simple white bird with a yellow head and tail tip, that sits on top of the player's head, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is light blue and shaped like a bird's plumage, with yellow details on the sides and the tail end that make it look like the Cape is made out of feathers, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Lively_Navigator
summary: The Lively Navigator is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Flight who offers the inline_text Expression. The Lively Navigator is found in the Wind Paths, on the higher of two floating islands to the left of the largest main island when coming from the area's main entrance. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair, a Hairpiece, a Cape, and the .

Memory.text: The Lively Navigator can be found in the Wind Paths, on the higher of two of floating islands to the left of the largest main island when coming from the area's main entrance. This Spirit has a standard memory with 8 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Lively Navigator can be seen boarding a flying boat pulled by a single Manta. They arrive shortly afterwards at the main island and dock the boat to begin walking, following a path that winds around to the other side. The Lively Navigator then grabs a pair of hand-held flags that are laying nearby and begins to work, using marshaling signals with the flags to direct the flow of traffic in the Wind Paths. Sometime later, a flying boat carrying the Talented Builder arrives, with a large flock of Mantas headed directly towards them. Alarmed by the potential collision, the Lively Navigator scrambles to direct the other Spirit out of danger. At the end of the memory, the Talented Builder waves with gratitude towards the Lively Navigator from the boat as they continue on their way without incident. Pleased by the job well done, the Lively Navigator nods back in affirmation.

levels.description: will make your avatar raise both arms straight ahead at chest level, palms facing inwards, before stretching their right arm straight up as a cymbal and chime sound effect plays. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your avatar.

makes the same motion as Level 1, with trails of small golden sparkles following your avatar's hands as they raise them, and a glowing, green, vertical light periodically shooting up from the hand pointing towards the sky, beginning when they've stopped moving, and a trail of sparkles like in the beginning of the Expression following your avatar's raised hand as it is dropped down again when the avatar has been moved.

will make your avatar take a big step forward on one foot and raise both arms straight ahead at chest level, palms touching, before then straightening to wave both hands together in a wide circle, before pointing them straight up, torso facing the side as they raise a bent leg, periodically glancing up and to the side, as a drum and more elaborate chime sound effect plays. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your avatar. Upon doing so, your avatar will drop their arms and turn back to the front with a little hop.

makes the same motion as Level 3, with trails of small, golden sparkles following your avatar's hands as they move, and as they exit the Expression, it will have small, gray dust clouds following the foot that is being dragged in the middle of the Expression.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit consists of short, spiky, fluffy hair partially tied in a small, low ponytail with a blue band in the back, and a pair of brown retro aviator goggles at the hairline with blue accents, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Spirit is a pair of single white, blue, and yellow feathers, one on each side of the head, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is inspired by a bird's plumage, with long feather-like fabric sections tied off with brown bands in the front of the Cape, a fluffy white collar, a blue half on the left of the Cape, and an orange half on the right side, divided down the center by fluffy white feathers, with each Cape half accented by a darker, flower-like shape coming from the collar, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Lookout_Scout
summary: The Lookout Scout is a Regular Spirit in the Golden Wasteland who offers the inline_text Expression. The Lookout Scout is found in the Battlefield inside the large broken fortress, at the bottom of a broken wall towards the left. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Facepiece and a Instrument Instrument.

Memory.text: The Lookout Scout can be found in the Battlefield inside the large broken fortress, at the bottom of a broken wall towards the left. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 6 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Lookout Scout climbs across the rubble of the fortress, carefully making their way up towards the peak of the structure, until they finally arrive at the tallest point. At the end of the memory, the Lookout Scout peers upon the horizon with their hand shading their eyes, before turning around and sounding a call with their horn.

Face Accessory.description: The Face AccessoryThis item was recategorized from a Mask to a Face Accessory as a result of the Closet category expansion in Patch . offered by this Spirit is a silver head guard with pointed horns (closely resembling the Face Accessory worn by Backflipping Champion, but with shorter spikes), costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fifth node.

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is a simple gray horn, costing . It plays 15 notes and is played standing up. The Horn plays the wind part on Music Sheets. Its pitch is two octaves below the standard Piano (in C Major, it covers C2 to C4). The horn is the only Instrument with this particular range. In Harmony Hall, this Instrument can be found on the back wall, behind and to the right of the front counter, in an alcove below the .

name: Marching_Adventurer
summary: The Marching Adventurer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Assembly who offers the inline_text Expression. The Marching Adventurer is found in the Forest's Brook, on top of a hill across from the sheltered house inside a hill on the player's left when first entering the area. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, and a Prop.

Memory.text: The Marching Adventurer can be found in Forest's Brook, atop a hill and directly across from the gazebo where the Blushing Prospector can be found. This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. Note that some fragments are exposed to the polluted rain, so be quick to collect them. As their memory unfolds, the Marching Adventurer and the Scaredy Cadet can be seen walking along the hills above the brook. The Marching Adventurer spots a stick that looks just right, and continues to carry it throughout the rest of the memory. The Adventurer and the Cadet soon come across a large, fallen log connecting two hills like a bridge. The Adventurer decides to march across the log, but the Cadet is frightened by the idea of walking across the log and soon finds a quicker, alternative route to cross the gap between the two hills. The Adventurer and the Cadet meet up again towards the end of the memory. At the end of the memory, the Adventurer finds the Cadet on a ledge a little higher up. The Cadet joins the Adventurer on the lower level, and the Marching Adventurer shows the Cadet how to march in time and with confidence, keeping their eyes forward.

levels.description: will make your avatar march in place, arms swinging to chest level and legs lifting energetically with each step, while a steady drumbeat plays in rhythm with the steps. The action is continued for as long as you don't move your avatar.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with white trails of light following the motion of your avatar's hands and white starburst effects bursting from their feet each time they touch the ground again.

will make your avatar leap up into the air before marching with their arms held closer to their torso and their legs brought up quicker while a fast drumbeat plays. After every fourth step your avatar will jump up again. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your avatar.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with green trails of light following the motion of your avatar's hands.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a dark grey mask with a yellow triangle under the right eye and a white eyepatch on the left, secured with a grey band over the head, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit consists out of thick dreadlocks tied together in a high ponytail with a yellow and green hairband, with several shorter locks hanging down in front of the face, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a tiki torch, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. When lit, its flame will recharge the player's wings. It appears as a torch on its owner's back when carried. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Meditating_Monastic
summary: The Meditating Monastic is a Regular Spirit in the Vault of Knowledge who offers the inline_text Expression. The Meditating Monastic is found on a floating island connected to another by spiraling stepping stones on the Fourth Floor of Vault, but is only visible if you first inline_text by the statue at its center. The cosmetics offered by this Spirit are a Hair and a Prop Prop.

Memory.text: The Meditating Monastic can be found on a floating island connected to another by spiraling stepping stones on the Fourth Floor of Vault, at the statue surrounded by White Candles. The Spirit is only visible after using the inline_text Expression from Praying Acolyte by the statue until it is fully lit up white, after lighting the White Candles that surround it. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 3 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. Note that players who have not activated the Spirit by Praying can still follow their memories, but will be unable to complete the final step and collect the Meditating Monastic's Expression. As their memory unfolds, the Meditating Monastic climbs the spiraling stones to reach the larger floating island above. At the end of the memory, the Meditating Monastic floats off the ground and crosses their legs to sit mid-air, peacefully contemplating the view from their higher vantage point.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a long beard, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Trees second node.

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a rectangular wooden table with four chairs, costing . It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces, and functions as a four-player Chat item. It is a popular tool for going Out of Bounds (OOB).

name: Melancholy_Mope
summary: The Melancholy Mope is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Passage who offers the inline_text Expression. The Melancholy Mope is found in the Isle of Dawn, hidden behind a tall stone between the Passage Stone and the main ramp. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a headpiece, and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Melancholy Mope can be found in the Isle of Dawn, hidden behind a tall stone between the Passage Stone and the main ramp. (Note: Meditate next to the Passage Stone campfire and turn Isle of Dawn to nightfall in order to see this Spirit.) This Spirit has a standard memory with 9 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Melancholy Mope can be seen sitting in a field, gazing longingly at the blossoming flowers. Two other young Spirits invite them to join in chasing a Butterfly, but before Melancholy Mope can refuse, one of the Spirits takes their hand and drags them by force towards the Butterflies. The Melancholy Mope remains reluctant to play, wanting to stay behind, but both Spirits take their hands and force them to climb the hill in search of the Butterflies. The Melancholy Mope spots more flowers nearby and quickly loses interest in the chase. As the other two Spirits continue running ahead, the Melancholy Mope quietly turns back to their initial location. At the end of the memory, the oblivious young Spirits chase the Butterfly beneath a moonlit sky as the Melancholy Mope morosely watches them from afar.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit includes a dark-beige, long-sleeved underdress with a long, light-yellow vest on top, tied just under the chest with a broad, magenta belt whose end hand down the front and are decorated with a beige emblem, as well as dark-purple pants, high, magenta boots with a turned over cuff and decorated with a lighter string, and magenta wrist wraps with the same string as found on the boots. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Head Accessory.description: The Head Accessory This item was recategorized from a Hair Accessory to a Face Accessory as a result of the Closet category expansion in Patch . It became a Head Accessory after the split of the Face Accessory category in Patch . offered by this Spirit is a pair of brown, tusk-shaped ear pendants. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a shaggy style, with side-swept bangs that end just over the eyes, shorter hair in the front and sides, and longer hair in the back. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

name: Mellow_Musician
summary: The Mellow Musician is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Performance who offers the inline_text Expression. The Mellow Musician is found left of the main entrance to the Village Theater, at the top of some steps between two buildings. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, a Cape, and the Instrument.

Memory.text: <div> The Mellow Musician can be found left of the main entrance to the Village Theater, at the top of some steps between two buildings. This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Mellow Musician and the Frantic Stagehand can be seen carrying a stack of props over towards the Theater. The Frantic Stagehand loads the props onto a sled for easier transport, but the Musician is distracted by something on the other side of the row of buildings. The Musician finds the Twirling Champion and the Cheerful Spectator playing music together on their instruments, and forgets about the task at hand. The Stagehand looks around, confused as to where the Musician went. Eventually, the Stagehand finds the Musician bouncing along to the beat of the music that the Champion and Spectator are playing. At the end of the memory, the Stagehand is seen running over to the Musician, who is bobbing their head along to the song. The Stagehand puts their hands on their hips in response to the sight before them.

levels.description: will make your avatar bob their head back and forth as if listening to a fun song, while a distinct, faintly electronic beat plays. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your avatar.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with a white glowing circle around your avatar's head and a small burst of light particles spreading and following the head's movement.

will make your avatar close their eyes, sway back a little, and lift up their right leg, before letting it step forward and then bopping their whole body up and down while slowly moving from side to side in rhythm with the music, while a similar beat with a slower tempo plays. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your avatar.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with a white glowing circle around your avatar's head and a burst of small light particles spreading and following the head's movement.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is oval and stone gray, with a pointy nose, almond-shaped, nearly closed eyes, and one white, curved stroke along each side of the Mask, curving from the chin up into eyebrow shapes, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit includes voluminous, fluffy hair that goes past the shoulders, and a red hairband tied around the forehead, with fluffy, messy bangs hanging over it on one side, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's sixth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a long, red scarf with yellow stitching, mostly falling around the player's left shoulder, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is the Electric Guitar. It is mainly colored black, with blue and yellow accents, as well as glowing blue strings, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total). The player stands while playing the Instrument, which plays 15 notes. Note that the player cannot move around while playing the Instrument, unlike all other Instruments played standing. The icon for this Instrument features a "fermata" symbol in its upper left corner. In music notation, this symbol indicates that one can play and hold a note for as long as one wants. The same principle applies to this Guitar, and players are able to hold any note for as long as they want as well. Once the sound of the initial strum fades away, a pleasant hum takes its place for as long as the note is held. The Electric Guitar plays the melody part on Music Sheets. Its pitch is the one octave lower than the standard Instrument (in C major, it covers C3 to C5). In Harmony Hall, the Electric Guitar can be found in the left room with all the other stringed Instruments, in its own niche in the center of the wall.

name: Memory_of_a_Lost_Village
summary: The Memory of a Lost Village is a Seasonal Shop from the Season of Revival. The Memory of a Lost Village is found within the left-most building in Aviary Village, marked outside by a sign with Revival's emblem. The collectibles offered by this Shop are an Outfit, a hair, and a Cape.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered at this Shop is a slim, sleeveless beige robe with a matching sash around the waist. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered at this Shop is a shoulder-length locs hairstyle decorated with colorful beads. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered at this Shop is navy colored and tattered with a red trim featuring a pronged design, two large rips at the left shoulder, and a red gradient interior. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

Season Friendship Tree.description: This Friendship Tree provides the collectibles sold by this Shop during the Season of Revival. This Tree can no longer be accessed. However, the items listed here will be available for purchase when the Shop returns as a Traveling Spirit - or in some other form. It is currently unknown how these items will return after the Season of Revival has ended. Because the Memory of a Lost Village was not a Seasonal Spirit, either the Traveling Spirit system would have to be modified to allow for non-Spirits, or else thatgamecompany will have to introduce another mechanism for obtaining past-Season cosmetics.

name: Memory_Whisperer
summary: The Memory Whisperer is a Regular Spirit in the Vault of Knowledge who offers the inline_text. The Memory Whisperer is found on a floating island on the Fourth Floor of Vault, at the small Manta skeleton surrounded by Red Candles. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit and two tiers (Cape Tier 2 Cape) of a Cape.

Memory.text: The Memory Whisperer can be found on a floating island on the Fourth Floor of Vault, at the small Manta skeleton surrounded by Red Candles. This Spirit does not have a conventional memory quest; there is no kneeling figure that needs to be lit up. Instead, the Spirit is triggered once the circle of Red Candles are lit. Players who have previously unlocked the inline_text can then interact with the icon that appears to summon a baby Cosmic Manta and be granted the Cosmic Manta Call.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a beige half-sleeve top with matching knee-length pants, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node.

Cape.description: The Memory Whisperer offers two standard-style white Capes; a Tier 1 and a Tier 2 version, costing and respectively. Both are permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node and second Wing Buff respectively. The Tier 2 Cape (and the second Wing Buff that unlocks it) are not needed to complete the Vault Constellation. These were both added to the Friendship Tree in Patch on April 5, 2022.

The fluffy collar is tipped in golden, bell-shaped ornaments. It is offered to all players for during the Season.

name: Migrating_Bird_Whisperer
summary: The Migrating Bird Whisperer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Migration who offers the inline_text Expression. The Migrating Bird Whisperer is found in the Wind Paths, at the top of a floating island, left of the main island. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Migrating Bird Whisperer can be found in the Wind Paths, at the top of a floating island, left of the main island. This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and a 12-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Migrating Bird Whisperer can be seen sitting in the gras alongside the Light Whisperer, watching Birds fly by. Suddenly, the Spirits jump to their feet as they spot an injured Bird, separated from the flock, just above their island. The Migrating Bird Whisperer quickly runs towards the Bird and gently catches it. They bring it to the base of the small island, inside the Light Whisperer's workshop, where they carefully placd the Bird on a pillow. After some rest, the Spirits bring the Bird outside and let it fly free, where it is welcomed by their flock. Uplifted by their good deed, the Bird Whisperer frolicks across the field, before they stop and watch the swarm fly away, touched by this wonderful moment. At the end of the memory, the Migrating Bird Whisperer happily runs across the grass before watching the huge swarm of Birds fly across the sky, completely in awe. Touched by this wonderful moment, they place their hands above their heart.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a long teal dress with elbow-length sleeves. The front of the skirt features a wide scalloped notch at the bottom, revealing an underskirt. The scallop and sleeve-ends are outlined with triangle-shaped patterns. The dress has a v-necked high collar, and golden bands around one ankle. It is offered to all players for during the Season.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is asymmetrical, with a feathered edge and a decorative upper layer slung around the shoulders. The shoulder cloth is orange with a squared off zig-zag trim in yellow. It is a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season.

name: Migrating_Butterfly_Charmer
summary: The Migrating Butterfly Charmer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Migration who offers the inline_text Expression. The Migrating Butterfly Charmer is found in the Wind Paths, on the main island, right of the Flight Guide, on a ledge near a dock. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Facepiece and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Migrating Butterfly Charmer can be found in the Wind Paths, on the main island, right of the Flight Guide, on a ledge near a flying-boat dock. This Spirit has a standard memory with 8 memory fragments and a 13-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Migrating Butterfly Charmer can be seen in the middle of a solo picnic, as a Butterfly flies onto their arm, startling the Spirit. The Butterfly flies off and the Spirit stumbles after them. After a bit of a chase, the Spirit comes across a big swarm of more Butterflies, joined by the one they just followed. Fascinated, the Migrating Butterfly Charmer follows the swarm down the hill, completely in focus. The Spirit attempts to reach the Butterflies by jumping up, but instead they stumble further down the hill, which they eventually tumble down. At the foot of the hill, the Spirit sits on the ground, dizzy from their turbulous journey, but happily surrounded by Butterflies. At the end of the memory, the Migrating Butterfly Charmer sits on the ground while their head turns from dizzyness. They shake it out and stand back up, to surprisingly see an even bigger swarm of Butterflies flying up into the sky near them. Happy about such a special moment, they raise up their arms and take in the scenery.

Face Accessory.description: The Face Accessory offered by this Spirit is a pair of curled bug antennae with yellow, glowing tips. It is a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is an orange cape with a scalloped edge and collar. The hem is patterned with yellow teardrops, and crescents that follow the edge. The collar is a deeper orange, and also scalloped. The interior has a scalloped gradient. It is offered to all players for during the Season.

The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit and a Hairpiece.

Memory.text: The Migrating Jelly Whisperer can be found in the Wind Paths, on the main island, to the left of the Flight Guide, behind an opening in the ground. This Spirit has a standard memory with 9 memory fragments and a 12-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Migrating Jelly Whisperer can be seen sneaking up on some Jellyfish. Once they're close, they climb up a ledge and jump into the middle of the unsuspecting Jellyfish flock, which immeditately scurry away, though not very far. The Whisperer watches as the Jellyfish leave, before the trying their luck again as they carefully follow the creatures to their new spot. This time, the Jellyfish spot the Spirit earlier, but as they begin to fly away, the Whisperer reaches out after them. The flock stops and turns around, coming back to the Migrating Jelly Whisperer. At last, their wish is granted as the flock lifts them up in the air, where the Spirit floats and dances amongst their newly found friends. At the end of the memory, the Migrating Jelly Whisperer stands by the Jellyfish, jumping and performing pirouettes in the air. They stop their joyous dance to watch another group of small and big Jellyfish pass by and fly high up into the sky.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a square-neck top and apron over cinched shorts. The cap-sleeved top has a zig-zag crop that reveals a yellow undershirt. The waist cloth is apron-like, colored orange with blue and yellow edges. One wrist has golden bands, and the ankles feature leg scrunches with ball-shaped decorations. It is a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season.

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Spirit is a pair of golden, dome-shaped earmuffs. The earmuffs are not connected by a headband. Each muff is lined with fur and features a pair of red and blue pointed ribbons attached to the center. It is offered to all players for during the Season.

name: Migrating_Manta_Whisperer
summary: The Migrating Manta Whisperer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Migration who offers the inline_text Expression. The Migrating Manta Whisperer is found in the Wind Paths, on top of a high mountain at the right and back of the area, near the Talented Builder. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Hair, and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Migrating Manta Whisperer can be found in the Wind Paths, on top of a high mountain at the right and back of the area, near the Talented Builder, by a gate above the chime workshop. This Spirit has a standard memory with 8 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Migrating Manta Whisperer can be seen conducting a Manta race, with the Backflipping Champion and Proud Victor as contestants, each kneeling on one of the Light Creatures. The Whisperer raises two hand-held flags to signal the Spirits to get ready, but they accidentally fly off early. After panicking a bit, the Whisperer manages to catch up to the Spirits, and continues to signal them to "set", and finally, "go!". During the race, the Spirits are accompanied by more Mantas that fly alongside them. While the Migrating Manta Whisperer continues to navigate the contestants and Manta herd around the area, the Backflipping Champion leads the race the entire time. But then, shortly before the end, the Proud Victor catches up and flies through the goal post as victor of the race. At the end of the memory, the Migrating Manta Whisperer strikes a pose while navigating the Spirits with the flags. Shortly after, they applaude the Backflipping Champion and Proud Victor, which bow in return. Then, they turns around to see a swarm of Mantas fly across the area, quietly stunning the Spirits with their presence.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a white and gold sleeveless top and knee-high boots. A shoulder sash tucks loosely into the slim-fitting pants. Decorative bands wrap around the upper arm, and manta-shaped ornaments hang from a belt chain. It is a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a tall mohawk with a braided tail. The braid is wrapped in an orange cord and the end is shaped like a manatee's tail. Manta-shaped tattoos adorn one of the shaved sides. It is offered to all players for during the Season.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this spirit is a flared shoulder armor with two prominent tails. Each tail consists of one white strip, trimmed in gold, underneath a shorter red strip. It is a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season.

name: Mindful_Miner
summary: The Mindful Miner is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of AURORA who offers the inline_text Expression. The Mindful Miner is found standing on the left side of the Coliseum in Valley of Triumph, by the AURORA Guide. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, a Hair, and a Cape. Players can view their memories by completing the second Quest at the beginning of the Underground Cavern, next to the Hairtousle Teen Spirit, just before the butterfly jars.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit consists of a plain white sleevesless top, white balloon pants with yellow accents, a yellow belt and a fringe sash around it, as well as yellow bands around the upper arms and a white band around the neck, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is bare-faced with one leaf-shaped and one stem-shaped green line under each eye, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is made of wavy and curly hair shaped into a voluminous mohawk-like hairstyle with braids going up the scalp sides and two small three-strand braids hanging down at the front sides, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit consists of a collared, flat, rectangle-shaped vibrant green cape with golden accents and white feathered shoulder embellishments, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season after unlocking the Friendship Tree's sixth node ( total).

name: Modest_Dancer
summary: The Modest Dancer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Performance who offers the inline_text. The Modest Dancer is found in the Village Theater, behind the second building from the player's immediate right when entering from Village of Dreams. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, a Hair, and the .

Memory.text: The Modest Dancer can be found in the Village Theater, behind the second building from the player's immediate right when entering from Village of Dreams. This Spirit has a standard memory with 9 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Modest Dancer can be seen sneaking behind a row of buildings towards a small clearing. They make sure no one is following them, and once they are alone, they are seen performing different dance moves. Suddenly, the Forgetful Storyteller finds the Modest Dancer and approaches the Dancer to say hello. Startled, the Dancer rushes out of the clearing. The Storyteller follows the Dancer, and takes them by the sleeve to encourage the shy Dancer to continue their routine behind the row of buildings. The two walk back to the clearing, Dancer seeming more reluctant than the Storyteller. The Forgetful Storyteller attempts to get the Dancer to open up, and the two continue the dance routine together. At the end of the memory, the Modest Dancer puts their hands over each other on their lap and shyly sways from left to right in response to Storyteller's request to dance, and the two Spirits dance as a duet.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit includes a red wrap-dress with mid-length sleeves and a multicolored piece of fabric tied around the waist, navy-blue pants, and golden sandals, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is round and light blue with a pointed nose, wide eyes, and a big, decorative, dark blue marking over the top half of the face, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a fitted red hood with an orange border and yellow stitching around it, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

name: Nesting_Atrium
summary: The Nesting Atrium is a Seasonal Shop from the Season of Nesting. The Nesting Atrium was found within the Nesting Workshop in Aviary Village, marked outside by a sign with Nesting's emblem. Unlike typical Seasonal Spirits, there is no need to first relive a spirit memory to access this Shop and it does not offer an Expression. The collectibles offered by this Shop are a Hair, a prop_h, a prop_b, and a prop_f.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Shop is short with sideswept bangs and two longer sections, tied with gold bands, that hang down on each side of the head. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Props.description: This Seasonal Shop offers a total of three Props: a Hanging Lamp, a Branch, and a Floor Light.

=Hanging Lamp=.description: The Prop offered by this Shop is a light in a shallow lamp shade made of pale wood, suspended from a thin pole. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces and functions as a light source. Once placed, the player can interact with the item to switch the light off and on. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

=Branch=.description: The Prop offered by this Shop is a pale branch that is decorated with multiple small lights and suspended from two thin poles. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces and functions as a light source. Once placed, the player can interact with the item to switch the light off and on. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

=Floor Light=.description: The Prop offered by this Shop is a light inside a brazier made of pale wood. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces and functions as a light source. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

name: Nesting_Loft
summary: The Nesting Loft is a Seasonal Shop from the Season of Nesting. The Nesting Loft was found within the Nesting Workshop in Aviary Village, marked outside by a sign with Nesting's emblem. Unlike typical Seasonal Spirits, there is no need to first relive a spirit memory to access this Shop and it does not offer an Expression. The collectibles offered by this Shop are a Cape, a prop_b, a prop_c, and a prop_p.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Shop is an angular blue cloak that only covers the player's back, with a pale blue trim and orange interior, somewhat reminiscent of a blueprint or pattern. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Props.description: This Seasonal Shop offers a total of three Props: a Bed, a Chair, and Paintings.

=Bed=.description: The Prop offered by this Shop is a bed made with a pale wood frame, featuring a curved headboard and yellow bedsheets and pillows. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces and seats a single player. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

=Chair=.description: The Prop offered by this Shop is a rounded chair made with pale wood and a yellow pillow on its seat. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces and seats a single player. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

=Paintings=.description: The Prop offered by this Shop is a set of three small paintings with pale wood frames that depict a grassy dome, a Manta, and clouds (reminiscent of the scenery in Daylight Prairie). It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Nesting_Nook
summary: The Nesting Nook is a Seasonal Shop from the Season of Nesting. The Nesting Nook was found within the Nesting Workshop in Aviary Village, marked outside by a sign with Nesting's emblem. Unlike typical Seasonal Spirits, there is no need to first relive a spirit memory to access this Shop and it does not offer an Expression. The collectibles offered by this Shop are a Hairpiece, a prop_c, a prop_s, and a prop_r.

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Shop is a chunky yellow pencil placed behind the player's left ear. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Props.description: This Seasonal Shop offers a total of three Props: a Couch, a Shelf, and a Spice Rack.

=Couch=.description: The Prop offered by this Shop is a double-seater couch made of pale wood, featuring a curved back and three yellow pillows on its seats. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces and seats two players. Unlike most other chairs, this item does not offer the ability to Chat with other players. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

=Shelf=.description: The Prop offered by this Shop is a short shelf made of pale wood with two small jars and a folded yellow towel on the lower rack. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

=Spice Rack=.description: The Prop offered by this Shop is a wall-mounted spice rack made of pale wood, decorated with three small jars, hanging wooden spoons, and a hanging herb sprig. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

name: Nesting_Solarium
summary: The Nesting Solarium is a Seasonal Shop from the Season of Nesting. The Nesting Solarium was found within the Nesting Workshop in Aviary Village, marked outside by a sign with Nesting's emblem. Unlike typical Seasonal Spirits, there is no need to first relive a spirit memory to access this Shop and it does not offer an Expression. The collectibles offered by this Shop are a prop_t, a prop_b, a prop_h, and a prop_p.

Props.description: This Seasonal Shop offers a total of four Props: a Table, a Bathtub, a Hanging Planter, and a Painting.

=Table=.description: The Prop offered by this Shop is a table made from a pale tree stump and decorated with a small yellow placemat, a potted plant, and two white mugs. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces and allows two players to stand and drink from. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

=Bathtub=.description: The Prop offered by this Shop is a water-filled bathtub made from a pale, hollowed out tree stump with a yellow towel hanging from a branch extended from its side. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces and seats a single player. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

=Hanging Planter=.description: The Prop offered by this Shop is a small hanging planter made of pale wood that contains a non-descript pale green plant. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

=Painting=.description: The Prop offered by this Shop is a large painting with a pale wood frame that depicts the Nesting Guide standing with the Elder of the Forest in a wooded area. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

name: Nightbird_Whisperer
summary: The Nightbird Whisperer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Moments who offers the inline_text. The Nightbird Whisperer is found in the Prairie Peaks, in a bird-filled cave to the left of the entrance of the area. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, Footwear, a Hair, and a Hairpiece.

Memory.text: The Nightbird Whisperer can be found in the Prairie Peaks, in a bird-filled cave to the left of the entrance of the area, on the left side of the biggest monolith in the middle of the cave. This Spirit has a standard memory with 11 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Nightbird Whisperer can be seen birdwatching with a notebook in hand, chasing eagerly after their subjects. To better observe a bird landed on the ground, the Spirit hides behind one of the many nearby monoliths. At this point the Jolly Geologist arrives, walking joyfully through the area, and startles the bird into taking flight by coming too close. The Nightbird Whisperer comes out of hiding to invite the Jolly Geologist to join their birdwatching, guiding them towards an alcove to observe from together. At the end of the memory, the Nightbird Whisperer lets out a loud bird's call that echoes through the cave and a bird responds, flying towards the Spirit duo.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a pair of beige cargo shorts with an orange and blue cloth tied around the waist and a sleeveless top. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Shoes.description: The Shoes offered by this Spirit are a pair of brown hiking shoes with mismatched white socks - one with a blue horizontal stripe in the middle and the other with a yellow one. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a pair of lopsided pigtails with mismatched hair ties - one orange and the other blue. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Spirit is a green leaf cradling a dew drop that sits on top of the player's head. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

name: Nodding_Muralist
summary: The Nodding Muralist is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Enchantment who offers the inline_text Expression. The Nodding Muralist is found on the left end of the Forgotten Ark in Golden Wasteland when facing its front. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Nodding Muralist can be found on the left end of the Forgotten Ark in Golden Wasteland when facing its front. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 5 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Nodding Muralist can be seen painting murals on different sections of the Forgotten Ark, even using a ladder in certain areas. At the end of the memory, the Snoozing Carpenter approaches the Nodding Muralist who stands in front of a freshly completed mural. They start applauding the Muralist, which comes to step besides them. Satisfied with their work, the Muralist nods in agreement.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit includes a version of the Base Mask with a shiny golden square replacing the glowing hole on the forehead, as well as a purple mouth veil with a yellow fringe at the bottom, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit includes a cone-shaped purple hat with yellow embroidery around the bottom and poofy, wavy hair that goes past the shoulders, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).
