The hints given before the [[Nodding Muralist]]'s first appearance were: {{Collapse |id=mw-customcollapsible-TSHint |label=First Visit Hints |content=
* Makes a mean pot pie * Gets creative in their cooking...sometimes with unfortunate results * Does not like classical music * Is reminding you to hydrate * Loves decorative pastries * Comes from a galaxy far far away... * Hates bananas * Is chronically late to appointments * Has...wait for it.....two hands * Likes bad knock knock jokes * Can't stand cold weather * Is probably not skybot * Doesn't have a favorite color...because they like ALL the colors! * Is 5 crabs stacked in a trench coat * Is asking all you skykids to be patient * Has........2 eyes * Won't be put down by Seraph * Hates beans * Has a secret friend tree with their homemade pot pie that you can buy
}} The hints given before the [[Nodding Muralist]]'s second appearance were: {{Collapse |id=mw-customcollapsible-TSHint |label=Second Visit Hints |content=
* Is the best at cheering people up * Likes to work with the krill cat in their lap * Has learned to read an ancient language * Always gives their full attention * Always wins at playing 20 questions game * Is trying out embroidery * Always loves seeing rainbows * Enjoys cozy clothing * Always carries around their tools * Tends to misplace things * Is a great partner in group projects * WILL pet every krill cat * Likes to stop and observe the clouds * (Small elaboration onto the last hint... it's not that there are clouds where they're from, but the action that they are doing part of that hint which is more important) * Does like candy corn, but their favorite Mischief sweet is nougat
}}

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Spirit consists of two silver feather-like pieces attached to the side of the head. At the bottom they merge into a curl, from which hangs a large, dark blue diamond. The diamond glows when other Sky kids are nearby, or when someone nearby uses a friendship interaction expression. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is round and gray-blue. It has a high collar with silver lining, which curls along the back of the Cape. At the bottom back, it fades into black with sparkles - the interior is black as well. It was available to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

name: Oddball_Outcast
summary: The Oddball Outcast is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Passage who offers the inline_text Expression. The Oddball Outcast is found in the Isle of Dawn, on the far right side of the Passage Stone, past the small cavern where Isle WL 4 is located, near the cloud wall. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Neckpiece, and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Oddball Outcast can be found in the Isle of Dawn, on the far right side of the Passage Stone, past the small cavern where Isle WL 4 is located, near the cloud wall. (Note: Meditate next to the Passage Stone campfire and turn Isle of Dawn to nightfall in order to see this Spirit.) This Spirit has a standard memory with 6 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Oddball Outcast can be seen playing alone with a small ball, tossing it between their feet like a hacky sack. The Spirit accidentally drops the ball down the nearby hill and runs to chase after it. A little bit further away, three adolescent Spirits are playing with a much larger ball and one wanders over to invite the Oddball Outcast to come join their group. The Spirit declines and so, shrugging, the group of adolescents resume their game. As the group disappears in the distance, the Oddball Outcast finds themself alone once again. At the end of the memory, the Oddball Outcast finally recovers their wayward ball and resumes their game of hacky sack, content to play alone while the group of adolescents leave.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a beige robe with rectangle-shaped parts on the sides, and sleeves, dyed magenta, a brown belt, dull-purple pants, and brown boots with a white fur trim and purple string tied around them, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Neck Accessory.description: The Neck Accessory offered by this Spirit is a white, fluffy, spiky, faux fur neck collar, which is tied together in the front by a brown string, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a short cut, spiked in the front, with faded sides and back, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

name: Overactive_Overachiever
summary: The Overactive Overachiever is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Passage who offers the inline_text Expression. The Overactive Overachiever is found in the Isle of Dawn, between the entrance of a semi-hidden cave on the left side of the area, and a pillar near another cave. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair, a Cape, and the Instrument.

Memory.text: The Overactive Overachiever can be found in the Isle of Dawn, between the entrance of a semi-hidden cave on the left side of the area, and a pillar near another cave. (Note: Meditate next to the Passage Stone campfire and turn Isle of Dawn to nightfall in order to see this Spirit.) This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, two young Spirits can be seen racing each other up a hill, with the Overactive Overachiever watching from a distance. At the end of the race, the victor jumps in the air in celebration of their win. The Overactive Overachiever then steps closer to wave and invite the pair to another race. All three Spirits return to the bottom of the hill to begin the race, with the Overactive Overachiever quickly passing them and taking the lead. At the top of the hill, the two defeated young Spirits rest, winded after their tiring race, while the Overactive Overachiever climbs a bar that is protruding from a tall rock nearby. At the end of the memory, the Overactive Overachiever shows off their boundless energy by performing one-handed pull-ups. The other young Spirits watch on in disbelief, glancing at each other with a defeated expression.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit includes layered side-bangs, which hang a bit into the face, and hair that reaches past the chin, is curled outwards at the ends, and is tied up in a half-up, half-down hairstyle with a magenta and golden band. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is made of fur and consists of multiple black and brown layers, as well as a white, furry collar piece with small, decorative, red and golden pieces of fabric hanging down under it in the front, and red inner lining. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is the Manta Ocarina. It is a Manta-shaped, white vessel flute with yellow and blue accents. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total). The player is standing while playing the Instrument, which plays 15 notes. The Manta Ocarina plays the wind part on Music Sheets. Its pitch is the same as the standard Instrument (in C major, it covers C4 to C6).

name: Peeking_Postman
summary: The Peeking Postman is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Dreams who offers the inline_text Expression. The Peeking Postman is found in the Village of Dreams, behind a building in front of the Dreams Guide. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, Shoes, a Mask, a Cape, and the .

Memory.text: The Peeking Postman can be found in the Village of Dreams, behind a building in front of the Dreams Guide. This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and a 15-minute time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Peeking Postman can be seen striding alongside the back of the buildings in the Village with a sled full of packages to be delivered. They coincidentally spot the Bearhug Hermit walking in the snow and promptly hide behind a building, peeking at the Spirit. After the Hermit has gone a bit further, the Peeking Postman is greeted by the young Skater, and the two unite in their pursuit of the Bearhug Hermit. They carefully follow the Spirit on their hike up a hill, when the Hermit suddenly turns around and spots their two pursuers, making them jump up in surprise. At the end of the memory, the Bearhug Hermit waves at the young Skater and the Peeking Postman. The Peeking Postman immediately hides under their Cape and takes a few moments before regaining confidence and letting their temporary shelter fall.

levels.description: will make your avatar lift up their left arm and hide behind their cape, before peeking outside. Your avatar will remain in this peeking position until you move; when you do, your avatar will bring down their arms, joining their hands at their chest. Each motion is accompanied by high whisle notes, except for when the avatar is not moved during the Expression.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with light pink circles adorning your avatar's cheeks and two red heart flying up during the last part of the Expression, once the avatar has been moved.

will make your avatar hesitantly take a small step to the side, before turning their back and lifting up their cape just enough so they can hide behind but still peek over it. Your avatar will remain in this peeking position until you move; when you do, your avatar will move down their cape and timidly wave their left hand in greeting. Each motion is accompanied by high whisle notes, except for when the avatar is not moved during the Expression.

makes the same motion as Level 3 with lots of red hearts flying up before your avatar hides under their cape, as well as two pink circles adoring their cheeks, and a small trail of white sparkles appearing at their hands at the end.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a black tunic with a red collar and three straps across the chest paired with knee-length red pants, all featuring gold accents, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total). In the Patch, the boots attached to the Outfit were removed and became a separate cosmetic item. The Shoes offered by this Spirit are knee-length black boots with a gray crisscross pattern and gold accents.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is shaped like the head of a rabbit and colored red, with black and yellow accents, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit features a red zigzag scale pattern, adorned with a few thin red pieces of fabric evenly spaced out along the Cape's trim, yellow accents, as well as a straight, fluffy black scarf hanging down the back that is adorned with a big pom-pom at the bottom, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Piggyback_Lightseeker
summary: The Piggyback Lightseeker is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Lightseekers who offers the inline_text. The Piggyback Lightseeker is found in a semi-hidden cave on the left side of Isle of Dawn, behind a Constellation Gate that requires players to have relived the memory of three Hidden Forest Spirits. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Piggyback Lightseeker can be found in a semi-hidden cave on the left side of Isle of Dawn. In the side of a large dune facing the shore, a tunnel with a Constellation Gate can be found, requiring players to have relived the memory of three Hidden Forest Spirits to enter. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 6 memory fragments and a 6-minute overall time limit. In order to collect the last two fragments, players have to pass a flooded area, which can be overcome by slowly swimming alongside a wall, carrying the light alongside it. As their memory unfolds, the Piggyback Lightseeker can be seen making their way through the cave, guiding the Rejecting Voyager and another Spirit to bring each an orb to an offering vessel. At the end of the memory, the Piggyback Lightseeker motions the player to jump on their back.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is round and plain beige, with one blue line and a dot at the outer end under each eye, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a high bun secured with a long grey hairpin, and two small hair strands, which are brushed outwards to each side, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Cape.description: Not to be confused with Cape. The Cape offered by this Spirit is blue with a rounded trim and has big petal-like shapes and purple accents between them and the bottom hem, which is decorated with evenly spaced out, small purple orbs, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Playfighting_Herbalist
summary: The Playfighting Herbalist is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Enchantment who offers the inline_text. The Playfighting Herbalist is found past the Forgotten Ark, in a set of ruins on the left side of the map. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, a Cape, a Prop, and the .

Memory.text: The Playfighting Herbalist can be found past the Forgotten Ark, in a set of ruins overgrown with Darkness Plants on the left side of the map. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 6 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Playfighting Herbalist and their friend, the Scarecrow Farmer, can be seen collecting mushrooms growing among the ruins of a boat. At the end of the memory, the Scarecrow Farmer sneaks up on the Playfighting Herbalist and scares them as a prank. The frightened Spirit drops their gathered mushrooms into the Polluted Water below, rendering them inedible. The Playfighting Herbalist slowly turns around and playfully attacks the Farmer in retaliation, as the Scarecrow Farmer crouches down, arms thrown up, in an attempt to shield themselves from their friends attack.'

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit includes a version of the Base Mask but with a shiny golden square replacing the glowing hole on the forehead, and an orange mouth veil with a fringe, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a pair of thick pigtails with purple hair ties and a wide purple forehead band with gold accents, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a magenta with a short, asymmetrical orange layer and a string of tassels layered on top, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a glowing, floating, yellow orb, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces and provides a small bit of illumination. It appears as a backpack on its owner's back when carried. This item was not available during the Season of Enchantment. Instead, it was added to the Playfighting Herbalist's Friendship Tree during their first visit as a Traveling Spirit on October 28, 2021.

name: Pleading_Child
summary: The Pleading Child is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Remembrance who offers the inline_text Expression. The Pleading Child is found in the Repository of Refuge, on the player's right upon entering, at the very top of the area on the perimeter after flying through the opening in the ceiling. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, Footwear, a Neckpiece, and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Pleading Child is found in the Repository of Refuge, on the player's right upon entering, at the very top of the area on the perimeter after flying through the opening in the ceiling. This Spirit has a standard memory with 5 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Pleading Child goes out to play with another taller Spirit, presuembly their friend or guardian, which carries a square-shaped portable table on their back. The two Spirit settle down on the ground and begin playing with their plush toys over the table, the Pleading Child with a Crab plush, and the other Spirit with a Manta one. Suddenly, the accompanying Spirit spots two soldiers from afar, one of which points at the two and the other carrying a big spear in their hands. Quickly they are besides their targets and arrest the older Spirit to take them away, while the Pleading Child tries to go after and beg the soldiers to let the Spirit go, but they have no chance against the big soldier with the spear keeping them from following. At last, the soldiers and the other Spirit are gone, leaving the Pleading Child alone, sobbing besides their destroyed table and the plush toys laying on the ground. At the end of the memory, the Pleading Child puts their palms together and pleads with all their might at the soldiers, but they ignore the little Spirit and leave them behind, making them realize that all their pleading has no effect. Defeated and hopeless, the Pleading Child lets their head fall and covers their face with their hands, crying.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is composed of a pale yellow long sleeve shirt with darker yellow accents, and a pair of green, knee-lenghted shorts over orange leggings, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Shoes.description: The Shoes offered by this Spirit are ankle-high brown boots with orange shoelaces, crossed once, costing from the Traveling Spirit. In the Patch, the boots attached to the Outfit were removed and became a separate cosmetic item.

Neck Accessory.description: The Neck Accessory offered by this Spirit is a large orange scarf that is completely wrapped around the neck and tied off to one side, with faint triangle markings near frayed ends, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was offered to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hairstyle offered by this Spirit is a round brown cap with a short visor that sits crookedly on top of short hair, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

name: Pleaful_Parent
summary: The Pleaful Parent is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Belonging who offers the inline_text Expression. The Pleaful Parent is found to the right of the slope at the entrance of the Graveyard, past the rock cliffs with a Child of Light and next to the Bonfire. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Cape, and the Instrument.

Memory.text: The Pleaful Parent can be found near the slope at the entrance of the Graveyard, next to the Bonfire surrounded by Dark Crabs on the player's right when entering from the Graveyard Entrance. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 5 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. This Spirit memory requires players to make their way through territory patrolled by several Dark Dragons. To complete this memory safely, it is advised to bring at least one friend who can either draw away the Dark Dargons from the player or help collect lost Winged Light if they have been hit. Another strategy could be to learn the Dark Dargons' routes and act accordingly, however, there are certain stretches where the player will be exposed and unprotected for a prolonged time, making it difficult to avoid the Dark Dragons. As their memory unfolds, the Pleaful Parent can be seen chasing their companion Crab through the Graveyard, occasionally hiding from the watchful eyes of the Dark Dragons. When they reach the far side of the area, the Spirit can be seen diving after the Crab and missing. They return back to the bonfire, where the Crab stands on top of the Pleaful Parent's head. At the end of the memory, the companion Crab runs off as the Pleaful Parent puts their hands on their head in shock. The Spirit tries to run after the Crab, but it disappears into the dense green fog. The Pleaful Parent then drops to their knees and extends their left arm, as if they were pleading, "Don't go!". The player then comes up behind the Pleaful Parent and rings a small bell; when the Pleaful Parent turns around and is surprised to see the player, the player is prompted to copy (and, thus, learn) the same pleaful expression.

levels.description: will make your avatar hold their hands to their chest and drop down to their knees with a dropped head, before raising it again and stretching their trembling left arm forward, while a prolonged dramatic violin sound effect plays.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with a glowing blue trail of light following the motion of your avatar's left hand.

will make your avatar hold their hands to their chest and let themselves fall down to their knees with a dropped head, letting their arms go with the impact of the fall, after which their upper body drops forward once again, with their hands weakly supporting their weight on the ground, before stretching their trembling left arm forward, while a prolonged dramatic orchestra sound effect plays.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with a glowing blue trail of light following the motion of your avatar's left hand.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is round and plain beige, similar to the Base Mask, with a mustache on the lower half of the face and yellow ornaments decorating the forehead, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a dark blue-green with faint diamond markings near the collar, a beige interior, and two golden horizontal lines around the bottom edge, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is the Guitar, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is colored red with yellow ornaments in the shape of the symbol in the front, and black in the back. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total). The player sits while playing the Instrument, which plays 15 notes. The Guitar plays the melody part on Music Sheets. Its pitch is one octave below the standard Instrument (in C major, it covers C3 to C5). In Harmony Hall, the Guitar can be found in the left room with all the other stringed Instruments, on the left-most side. It is also available in the Village Theater, at the front left of the stage, where it can be used by all players who have completed the third Quest of the Season of Performance.

name: Pointing_Candlemaker
summary: The Pointing Candlemaker (formerly Pointing PilgrimIn Patch , both the Pointing Candlemaker and Ushering Stargazer Spirits were renamed to better reflect their updated memory stories.) is a Regular Spirit in Isle of Dawn who offers the inline_text Expression. The Pointing Candlemaker is found by the Sand Dunes, just outside the caves to the left of the large ramp that leads to the Temple. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Pointing Candlemaker can be found by the Sand Dunes, just outside the caves to the left of the large ramp with the Spirit Gate at its base. They are the first Regular Spirit for nearly all players because it is effectively required as part of completing the initial tutorial. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 4 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Pointing Candlemaker is seen teaching two other Spirits about what candles are, how they are made, and what they are used for. After showing them the second cave Mural that depicts Isle of Dawn and its Elder, the Pointing Candlemaker invites them to a boat waiting outside the cave. At the end of the memory, the two Spirits have boarded the boat filled with jars and candles. The shorter Spirit raises both arms in excitement while the other Spirit claps, and the Pointing Candlemaker points towards their next destination: the Isle Temple.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a short, simple hairstyle with a cowlick, available to be collected for free. It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node.

name: Polite_Scholar
summary: The Polite Scholar is a Regular Spirit in the Vault of Knowledge who offers the inline_text. The Polite Scholar is found at the far left of the floating stone platforms on the Third Floor of Vault. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Polite Scholar can be found at the far left of the floating stone platforms on the Third Floor of Vault, opposite of the gazebo structure. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 4 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Polite Scholar traverses the floating platforms towards a gazebo, poised and elegant as they walk. At the end of the memory, the Polite Scholar stands in the middle of the gazebo, hands clasped in front of them. A large tree then sprouts up from a neighboring platform, stretching high above the gazebo.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a beige half-sleeve top with matching knee-length baggy pants, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a clean bald cut, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fourth node.

name: Pouty_Porter
summary: The Pouty Porter is a Regular Spirit in the Hidden Forest who offers the inline_text Expression. The Pouty Porter is found at the far end of Forest's Brook, in the entrance of a tunnel to the left of the bridge. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and two tiers (Cape Tier 2 Cape) of a Cape.

Memory.text: The Pouty Porter can be found at the far end of Forest's Brook, in the entrance of a tunnel to the left of the bridge. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 4 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. All of the memory fragments are sheltered from the rain. As their memory unfolds, the Pouty Porter is seen picking up a heavy ball and laboriously carrying it through the tunnel, carefully navigating over obstacles along the way. Eventually, they arrive at the opening on the other side. At the end of the memory, the Spirit bends over to try picking up another heavy object. When they fail, the Pouty Porter angrily stomps their foot before crossing both arms over their chest and turning away.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a medium length of hair on the left side of a shaved head, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node.

Cape.description: The Pouty Porter offers two standard-style teal Capes; a Tier 1 and a Tier 2 version, costing and respectively. Both are permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node and second Wing Buff respectively. The Tier 2 Cape (and the second Wing Buff that unlocks it) are not needed to complete the Hidden Forest Constellation. These were both added to the Friendship Tree in Patch on December 15, 2020. Note that while the Capes' color is very similar to the special Beta Cape and Founder's Cape, the Pouty Porter's Capes do not grant the wearer any ability to open Cape-locked Constellation Gates.

name: Praying_Acolyte
summary: The Praying Acolyte is a Regular Spirit in the Vault of Knowledge who offers the inline_text Expression. The Praying Acolyte is found on the First Floor of Vault, behind the four-player door that requires the inline_text Expression to open. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and two tiers (Cape Tier 2 Cape) of a Cape.

Memory.text: The Praying Acolyte can be found on the First Floor of Vault, to the right of the lantern-powered elevator and behind the four-player door that requires the inline_text Expression to open. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 5 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Praying Acolyte tends to various graves in the area, praying at some tombstones and placing candles at others. The Spirit's last stop is at the top of a ledge overlooking the field of graves. At the end of the memory, the Praying Acolyte looks down upon the small graveyard from atop the ledge. They appear to be also admiring the star-like particles hovering above and press their hands together in respectful prayer.

will make the same motion as Level 3 with a yellow glow surrounding both hands and light particles following their movements.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a long straight cut with a small blue clip at the end of a lock of hair on the left side, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node.

Cape.description: The Praying Acolyte offers two standard-style blue Capes; a Tier 1 and a Tier 2 version, costing and respectively. Both are permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node and second Wing Buff respectively. The Tier 2 Cape (and the second Wing Buff that unlocks it) are not needed to complete the Vault Constellation. These were both added to the Friendship Tree in Patch on February 6, 2021.

title: Princess
name: Princess
summary: The Princess is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of the Nine-Colored Deer who offers the inline_text Expression. The Princess is found in the Crescent Oasis, in the round chamber hidden behind the throne room in the Royal Palace. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, a Hair, and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Princess can be found in the Crescent Oasis, in the round chamber hidden behind the throne room in the Royal Palace. This Spirit has a standard memory with 8 memory fragments and a 10-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Princess can be seen lounging on a mat at the center of the chamber while Mantas and Birds fly overhead. As the Spirit falls asleep, they begin to dream of the Nine-Colored Deer and of chasing after the spectral creature as it prances gracefully through the air. When the Princess eventually wakes, it's to the sight of the Feudal Lord approaching their resting place. At the end of the memory, the Princess rises from their mat and rushes to greet the Feudal Lord, eager to share the contents of their dream - and of a desire to make it become a reality.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a red robe with long sleeves, a black belt, a blue collar and cuffs, and a golden band around the player's neck. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is the player's bare face with a blue, flower-shaped mark on the forehead and a red crescent mark beneath both eyes. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a loosely pulled back bun tucked within a golden crown piece that is bracketed between a pair of horizontal hairpins with yellow tassels hanging from their ends. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a short yellow shawl with blue accents and three tassels hanging from the back edge. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's sixth node ( total).

name: Prophet_of_Air
summary: The Prophet of Air is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Prophecy who offers the inline_text Expression. The Prophet of Air is found in the Cave of Prophecies, near the entrance to the Trial of Air. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, a Cape, and an Prop.

Memory.text: The Prophet of Air can be found in the Cave of Prophecies, near the entrance to the Trial of Air. This Spirit has a standard memory with 8 memory fragments and a 5-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Prophet of Air can be seen educating a younger pair of Spirits about the history of the Cave. The Prophet of Air first scolds the young Spirits for arriving late before directing them to a seating area at the center of the Cave of Prophecies. Together, they sit with a larger group of Spirits listening intently to the lessons being provided by all four of the Prophets. The group then splits up as the Prophet of Air takes their students aside, leading them towards the entrance of the Trial of Air. The lesson continues as all three Spirits test their equilibrium on top of the floating rock platforms. At the end of the memory, the Prophet of Air teaches the younger Spirits about balance by demonstrating how to perform a handstand.
Memory.file_name: 00 ID Seasonal Spirit - Prophet of Air.png
Memory.alt_text: Relive the Prophet of Air's memory

levels.description: will make your avatar lean forward into a handstand while a wooden tapping sound effect plays. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your character. Exiting this Expression will make your avatar split their legs to bring them back down in a gymnastic dismount.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with sparkles following your avatar's feet and a blue trail light following their hands on the dismount.

will make your avatar lean backwards into a handstand and repeatedly complete a full turn while a metallic tapping sound effect plays. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your character. Exiting this Expression will make your avatar split their legs to bring them back down over their head in a gymnastic dismount.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with trails of golden sparkles following your avatar's feet.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is shaped like the head of a bat and made of is stone, with cyan-colored markings all over it, as well as small sections of hair near the ears, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is parted down the middle and consists out of two high twisted buns whose braided ends hang down the back of the head and are decoratively tied with several little blue hair bands, as well as a small chin-long braid on each side at the front of the face, tied off with a blue hairband, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is purple with a dark purple furry collar and a trim in a similar shape as that of bat wings, that is bordered by a darker purple line and has little decorative stones hanging from the the tips, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a glowing blue wall painting of the air element symbol, i.e., a small decoration that appears on the targeted surface, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. The Prop appears as a backpack on its owner's back when carried. This item was not available during the Season of Prophecy. Instead, it was first introduced during the Prophet of Air's first visit as a Traveling Spirit on May 12, 2022.

name: Prophet_of_Earth
summary: The Prophet of Earth is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Prophecy who offers the inline_text Expression. The Prophet of Earth is found in the Cave of Prophecies, near the entrance to the Trial of Earth. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, a Cape, an Prop, and .

Memory.text: The Prophet of Earth can be found in the Cave of Prophecies, near the entrance to the Trial of Earth. This Spirit has a standard memory with 8 memory fragments and a 5-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Prophet of Earth can be seen educating a younger pair of Spirits about the history of the Cave. The Prophet of Earth first greets the young Spirits before directing them to a seating area at the center of the Cave of Prophecies. Together, they sit with a larger group of Spirits listening intently to the lessons being provided by all four of the Prophets. The group then splits up as the Prophet of Earth takes their students aside, leading them towards the entrance of the Trial of Earth to continue the lesson. All three Spirits stretch their muscles before starting to climb the steep terrain - only for the clumsiest student to slip and nearly fall before the others could catch them. At the end of the memory, the Prophet of Earth teaches the younger Spirits about resilience by decisively brushing a hand over both shoulders.
Memory.file_name: 00 ID Seasonal Spirit - Prophet of Earth.png
Memory.alt_text: Relive the Prophet of Earth's memory

levels.description: will make your avatar brush their hand twice over the left shoulder and once over the right, while tambourine sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with small dust clouds appearing from the brushing motions.

will make your avatar raise both their arms up in front of them and brush off the right one, then the left, as well as their lap, before tilting their neck from side to side as if to crack it, and hop up once, while more elaborate tambourine sound effects play.

makes the same motion as Level 3, with a shower of white light particles falling as your avatar brushes off their arms, and large dark dust clouds forming around their body as they brush off their lap.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a stone spider mask with yellow markings and many small glowing eyes, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a double side bun hairstyle, tied with blue hairbands, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a webbed purple cape with indigo accents and grey decorations around the trim, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a wall painting of the earth element symbol, i.e., a small decoration that appears on the targeted surface, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. The Prop appears as a backpack on its owner's back when carried. This item was not available during the Season of Prophecy. Instead, it was first introduced during the Prophet of Earth's first (official) visit as a Traveling Spirit on February 3, 2022.

name: Prophet_of_Fire
summary: The Prophet of Fire is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Prophecy who offers the inline_text Expression. The Prophet of Fire is found in the Cave of Prophecies, near the entrance to the Trial of Fire. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, a Hair, a Prop, a Prop_s, and the .

Memory.text: The Prophet of Fire can be found in the Cave of Prophecies, near the entrance to the Trial of Fire. This Spirit has a standard memory with 8 memory fragments and a 5-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Prophet of Fire can be seen educating a pair of younger Spirits about the history of the Cave. The Prophet of Fire first greets the young Spirits before directing them to a seating area at the center of the Cave of Prophecies. Together, they sit with a larger group of Spirits listening intently to the lessons being provided by all four of the Prophets. The group then splits up as the Prophet of Fire takes their students aside, enthusiastically leading them towards the entrance of the Trial of Fire. The Spirit takes a seat on a rocky ledge to continue the lesson. At the end of the memory, the Prophet of Fire teaches the younger Spirits about courage by pounding their chest and pumping a fist with pride.
Memory.file_name: 00 ID Seasonal Spirit - Prophet of Fire.jpg
Memory.alt_text: Relive the Prophet of Fire's memory

levels.description: will make your avatar pound on their chest twice with one hand and then raise the other to flex their biceps, while drum and cymbal sound effects play.

makes the same motion as Level 1, with a golden glowing sparkles bursting from your avatar's hand as they pound their chest, and white sparkles bursting from their other hand as they flex their muscles.
will make your avatar hunch forward to flex both arms downwards, lean back to pound their chest with both hands a few times, and lastly give a slight nod, while drum sound effects play.

makes the same motion as Level 3, with trails of golden sparkles following the motion of your avatar's hands as they flex their muscles, and several purple starburst effects appearing on their chest as they pound on it.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a pair of wide, baggy gray pants with a light blue wrap-top with mid-lengthed sleeves, as well as simple dark-gray boots with pointy tips, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is stone-gray and shaped like a lion's head, with decorative red markings all over it, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit consists of short dreadlocks, some of which poke up from the head, as well as shaved sides which fade as they come closer to the ears, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Fire Cauldron.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a round, stone-gray fire cauldron like those seen throughout the Cave of Prophecies, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. When lit, its flame will recharge the player's wings. It appears as a miniature cauldron on its owner's back when carried. This item was not available during the Season of Prophecy. Instead, it was introduced during the Prophet of Fire's first visit as a Traveling Spirit on December 9, 2021.

Fire Sticker.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a glowing wall painting of the fire element symbol, i.e., a small decoration that appears on the targeted surface, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. The Prop appears as a backpack on its owner's back when carried. This item was not available during the Season of Prophecy. Instead, it was first introduced during the Prophet of Fire's second visit as a Traveling Spirit on August 3, 2023.

Memory.text: The Prophet of Water can be found in the Cave of Prophecies, near the entrance to the Trial of Water. This Spirit has a standard memory with 8 memory fragments and a 5-minute overall time limit. levels.description: will make your avatar lift up their hands to chest level and pat the air two times before taking a deep breath accented by lifting up their right hand with the breath, while a light metal wind chime sound effect plays; first in reverse on the inhale and then normally on the exhale.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with a faintly glowing light around your avatar's head as they inhale.

will make your avatar assume a wide stance and take a very deep breath, accentuating their motion by slowly holding up their hands together over their head and then bringing them back down as they exhale, while a wooden wind chime sound effect plays; first in reverse on the inhale and then normally on the exhale.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with a triple-layered golden glowing ring appearing around your avatar's head as they inhale, and a simple glowing blue circle as they exhale.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is blue and shaped like a sea turtle, with stone-like decorations near the neck and dark blue rounded markings near the bottom front, as well as a section of white fur hanging down at the back, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. The Prop appears as a backpack on its owner's back when carried. This item was not available during the Season of Prophecy. Instead, it was first introduced during the Prophet of Water's second visit as a Traveling Spirit on November 10, 2022.

name: Proud_Victor
summary: The Proud Victor is a Regular Spirit in the Valley of Triumph who offers the inline_text. The Proud Victor is found at the very top of the Coliseum stadium seating, to the left of the Temple entrance. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask and two tiers (Cape Tier 2 Cape) of a Cape.

Memory.text: The Proud Victor can be found at the top of the Coliseum stadium, to the left of the Temple entrance when facing the Temple from the center podium. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 5 memory fragments and a 4-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Proud Victor slides down the walkway in between sections of seating on the left side of the Coliseum. At about halfway down the walkway, the Spirit trips, and slides the rest of the way down the stadium and into the center ice rink. The Proud Victor then continues to slide around the perimeter of the rink. At the end of the memory, the Proud Victor stands at the center podium, having recovered from their fall down the walkway. They look around bashfully and quickly cross their arms against their chest.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is actually a non-Mask, costing . When it is equipped, you will see your avatar's bare face, blank of any detail except for your closed eyelashes. It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's first Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fourth node.

Cape.description: The Proud Victor offers two standard-style red Capes; a Tier 1 and a Tier 2 version, costing and respectively. Both are permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node and second Wing Buff respectively. The Tier 2 Cape (and the second Wing Buff that unlocks it) are not needed to complete the Valley of Triumph Constellation. These were both added to the Friendship Tree in Patch on December 15, 2020.

name: Provoking_Performer
summary: The Provoking Performer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Gratitude who offers the inline_text Expression. The Provoking Performer is found to the left of the Forest's Brook, in a tunnel entrance on ground level, semi-hidden between trees. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, and the .

Memory.text: The Provoking Performer can be found to the left of the Forest's Brook, in a tunnel entrance on ground level, semi-hidden between trees. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 5 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Provoking Performer can be seen dancing their way through the tunnel, striking a final pose at the end. To collect the last memory fragment, the player will have to step outside and walk over under the tree quickly, or else the poulluted rain will extinguish the Spirit's light. At the end of the memory, the Provoking Performer lifts their arms, steps forward with one leg to the player, swings one outstretched arm around, and rolls their head.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is an orange-colored, square-shaped head of a creature with one horn on each corner, a zigzag-shaped mouth with golden teeth and two fangs sticking out, two small white eyes on each side, and square-shaped, carved-out details, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a round orange hat with a cylinder-shaped top, one decorative band at each side and the back, and yellow details, that is sitting on top of tied-up hair, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

name: Radiance_Greeting_Shaman
summary: The Radiance Greeting Shaman is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Radiance who offers the inline_text Expression. The Radiance Greeting Shaman was found in the Aviary Village, to the left of the Village Plaza's Constellation Table. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Hair, and a Hairpiece.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a beige robe-like garment. This Outfit features a boxy fit with pale triangular lines running down the closure and sleeves. The front is slightly asymmetrical, and two cinching knots hang from the waist. A pair of matching loose trousers complete this Outfit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's seventh node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a pale blue zigzag pattern with triangles, printed on a shaved head. It can be paired with Head Accessories and Hair Accessories. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's sixth node ( total). The entire cosmetic is dyable as one section.

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Spirit is two tied ribbons with a golden gem that sits on the side of the head. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

name: Radiance_Leaping_Dancer
summary: The Radiance Leaping Dancer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Radiance who offers the inline_text Expression. The Radiance Leaping Dancer was found in the Aviary Village, to the left of the Village Plaza's Constellation Table. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, Shoes, a Hair, a Cape, and a Prop.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is an off-white tunic, with draping beige sleeves and pants underneath. The pants cinch just above the ankle. A sash with golden diamond-shaped ornaments is looped loosely from the tunic's waistbelt, and features similar pale accents to the sleeves. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Shoes.description: The Shoes offered by this Spirit are a pair of high boots with a decorative strip running the entire height of the boots to the toe. The uncolored version of this cosmetic is dark brown on the height of the boot with paler tan decorations. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's seventh node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a short-cropped bob hairstyle with stylized choppy bangs. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a beige, gold-rimmed mantle that splits into three kite-shaped tails, both with pale diamond-shaped patterns. Two floating ribbons attach at the mantle and loop around the arms. The ribbons and cape sections are tipped with a gold diamond ornament each. The uncolored version of this Cape is beige, with a paler cream for the two outer tails, and off-white for the ribbons. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's sixth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a large red curtain attached with red string between two wooden poles, and with a yellow triangular ribbon, decorated with white ornaments, hanging on both sides. When carried on a player's back, the Prop appears as two poles wrapped with the red curtain and tied together with the ribbon. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

summary: The Radiance Provoking Performer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Radiance who offers the inline_text Expression. The Radiance Provoking Performer was found in the Aviary Village, to the left of the Village Plaza's Constellation Table. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, Shoes, a headpiece, a Cape, and the Instrument.

Memory.text: The can be found <describe location>. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with <number> memory fragments OR a carry-Spirit memory, with a <number>-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Spirit(s) is/are seen <describe other spirits in memory>. At the end of the memory, <describe how spirit uses the emote>. -->

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a white sleeveless top with ballooning skirt-like pants. The beige pants have two paler stripes on the front of each pleat. Two thick sashes are tied at the belt and drape around each side of the waist. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Shoes.description: The Shoes offered by this Spirit is a short pair of boots with cuffs decorated with triangular patterns. A rectangular shape covers the shoe's instep/tongue. The uncolored version of this cosmetic is off-white and with darker tan decorations. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's seventh node ( total).

Head Accessory.description: The Head Accessory offered by this Spirit is a design of angular, wave-like lines and triangles on the left temple. The base coloration for this cosmetic is a golden-yellow. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total). This cosmetic is dyeable as one section, costing . These dye costs are the base rates, multiply by 2 if mixing colors. For further details, see Dyes.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit consists of a thin, X-shaped piece of fabric, whose upper parts are draped over the shoulders and cross in front of the chest. The rest of the main piece hangs down the back; between the X's intersection, another stripe of fabric runs down below it. The Cape is decorated with contrasting zig-zag patterns and angular shapes. The uncolored version of this Cape is beige, with darker and lighter shades of tan for the decorative shapes. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's sixth node ( total).

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit a pair of golden cymbals. The handles feature flat orange tassels with yellow tips. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

name: Rallying_Thrillseeker
summary: The Rallying Thrillseeker is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Sanctuary who offers the inline_text Expression. The Rallying Thrillseeker is found in the Sanctuary Islands, next to a geyser located inland on the left side of the main island. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Rallying Thrillseeker can be found in the Sanctuary Islands, next to a geyser located inland on the left side of the main island. This Spirit has a collection memory with 9 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. This Spirit requires players to to use the nearby geysers to collect light fragments in the air  similar to the Manta Whisperer's memory in Valley of Triumph. As their memory unfolds, the Rallying Thrilseeker can be seen briefly jumping into the geyser. At the end of the memory, the Sanctuary Guide, Rallying Thrillseeker, and the Grateful Shell Collector watch two Mantas fly past by. They all cheer and clap.

levels.description: will make your avatar raise their right arm and do a fist pump, while a triumphant trumpet sound effect plays.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with a white light trail following the avatar's hand and purple lightburst appearing around the hand at the end.
will make your avatar jump up and pump their arms up three times, while a triumphant trumpet, cheering, and clapping sound effects play.

makes the same motion as Level 3 with a glowing exclamation mark flickering over your avatar's head at the start, white light trails following their hands, and a cloud of white, wide-spread sparkles rotating around your avatar.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a white, Manta-inspired one piece jumpsuit that goes over most of the body from neck to toes, with a light-pink triangle-shaped collar and Manta wing-like accents at the lower arms and hands, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a short, brushed-back hairstyle with a strand of hair hanging down in the front and shaved-off faded sides, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

name: Reassuring_Ranger
summary: The Reassuring Ranger is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Moments who offers the inline_text Expression. The Reassuring Ranger is found in the Prairie Peaks right next to the Moments Guide, hidden behind the raised platform where the area's Map Shrine is located. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Facepiece, a Hairpiece, and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Reassuring Ranger can be found in the Prairie Peaks right next to the Moments Guide, hidden behind the raised platform where the area's Map Shrine is located. This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Moments Guide and the Reassuring Ranger can be seen climbing the nearby hills. As they ascend, they reach a steep section and the Moments Guide stays behind, completely frozen by fear. The Reassuring Ranger goes back to reassure their companion and together they finally reach their destination. Side by side, they pause to catch their breath, gazing out at the awe-inspiring beauty that unfolds before their eyes. The Prairie Peaks lay below them, a tapestry of vibrant greens and earthen tones. At the end of the memory, the Reassuring Ranger holds the Moments Guide by their shoulders, quietly admiring the beauty of the Prairie Peaks, side by side.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is black with a protruding nose, angled eyes, and orange outlines above the eyes and below the jaw that resemble facial hair. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Face Accessory.description: The Face Accessory offered by this Spirit is a yellow wheat stalk or stem, placed on the lower half of the face of the holder. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Spirit is a tan triangle-shaped cowboy hat with a lighter hatband with brown triangle ornaments. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is beige and colored orange near the tattered trim, with a blue line and triangle shapes above it, that is shaped like a long asymmetrical poncho, with a blue piece of fabric and a smaller, orange one above it tied in the front. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Rejecting_Voyager
summary: The Rejecting Voyager is a Regular Spirit in Isle of Dawn who offers the inline_text Expression. The Rejecting Voyager is found in front of a cave, left of the Isle's Temple entrance.The Rejecting Voyager was moved in Patch . The Spirit was originally located behind a now-removed Spirit Gate in the cave left of the Temple. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Facepiece and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Rejecting Voyager can be found in front of a cave, left of the Isle's Temple entrance. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 3 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Rejecting Voyager is seen guiding another Spirit carrying a pickaxe further down the tunnel. The pickaxe wielding Spirit pauses to point at a blank section of the wall, to which the Rejecting Voyager denies by crossing their arms in an "X". The pair moves on to another section of wall that features a Mural of the Elder of the Isle surrounded by flying Creatures. At the end of the memory, the Rejecting Voyager gestures towards the Mural and confirms it to also be off limits to the Spirit with a pickaxe, firmly shaking their head and waving both arms in a negative motion.

levels.description: will make your avatar lean back slightly and raise both arms to form an "X", waving them side to side while shaking their head.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with a pale red "X" over their head.
will make your avatar turn to the side and face backwards while raising an arm perpendicular with a pushing motion.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with a red "X" over their head.

Face Accessory.description: The Face AccessoryThis item was recategorized from a Mask to a Face Accessory as a result of the Closet category expansion in Patch . offered by this Spirit is a silver horizontal head guard (closely resembling the Elder of the Isle's Face Accessory), costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fourth node.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a short length of hair on a shaved head, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node.

name: Remnant_of_a_Forgotten_Haven
summary: The Remnant of a Forgotten Haven is a Seasonal Shop from the Season of Revival. The Remnant of a Forgotten Haven is found within the left-most building in Aviary Village, marked outside by a sign with Revival's emblem. The collectibles offered by this Shop are shoes, a Hairpiece, and a Cape.

Shoes.description: The Shoes offered at this Shop are a pair of simple beige sandals. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered at this Shop is a red ribbon with long tails tied to the back of your head. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered at this Shop is magenta with gold accents, a small tassel hanging from the back edge, and an orange interior. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Season Friendship Tree.description: This Friendship Tree provides the collectibles sold by this Shop during the Season of Revival. This Tree can no longer be accessed. However, the items listed here will be available for purchase when the Shop returns as a Traveling Spirit - or in some other form. It is currently unknown how these items will return after the Season of Revival has ended. Because the Remnant of a Forgotten Haven was not a Seasonal Spirit, either the Traveling Spirit system would have to be modified to allow for non-Spirits, or else thatgamecompany will have to introduce another mechanism for obtaining past-Season cosmetics.

name: Resourceful_Recluse
summary: The Resourceful Recluse is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of The Two Embers - Part 1. The Resourceful Recluse is found in The Last City, in an alcove in the wall to the right of the Marketplace. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, a prop_t, and a prop_p.

Memory.text: The Resourceful Recluse can be found in The Last City, tucked away from the other merchants in a quiet alley on the right side of the Marketplace. Unlike other Spirits, the Resourceful Recluse has no memory that can be relived, but rather a Seasonal Quest dedicated to them. With the Spirit's home in shambles, unable to build it back up all by themselves, players complete a series of tasks, helping the Spirit bring their home back to its full glory. Players can interact with the Resourceful Recluse upon completion of the second Quest.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a short-sleeved shirt tucked into a pale green sash. The pants are covered with a loose, yellow wrap of fabric held by a belt. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a long, bushy white beard and mustache, attached to a simple gray mask. It was available to all players during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's first node. ( total).

Props.description: This Spirit offers a total of two Props: a Tea Stall and a Vine Plant.

Tea Stall.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a tea table stall made of stoneTwo seats are on one side, and the teapot and third seat are on the other. The awning and stools are red with white accents. When placed, it functions as a three-player Chat item after players have selected the teacup icon at least once. When carried on its owner's back, it appears as a stone teapot with pale accents. It was available to all players during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Vine Plant.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a twisting, silvery branch with many twigs coming off it. It is covered in pale green leaves and round, white flowers. When carried on its owner's back, the Prop appears in its original form, though more simplified. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Respectful_Pianist
summary: The Respectful Pianist is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Rhythm who offers the inline_text Expression. The Respectful Pianist is found at the back of the Wasteland's Graveyard, in a round hollow boulder between the large Darkness Tree and the passage to the Battlefield. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, and the Instrument.

Memory.text: The Respectful Pianist can be found the Wasteland's Graveyard in a round hollow boulder between the large Darkness Tree and the passage to the Battefield. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 4 memory fragements and a 15-minute overall time limit. This Spirit memory can be difficult to complete, as several Dark Dragons roam the area. It is advisable to wait before a Dark Dragon has just passed before advancing to the next memory fragement. Bringing a friend as a precaution can also be of help in case you are attacked by a Dark Dragon, or for luring them away. Another thing to note is to preferably not burn the Dark Plants leading up to the cave containing butterflies, as they can act as a helpful staircase towards the last memory fragement. Alternatively, players can carefully and slowly fly alongside the outer wall, carrying the light with them. As their memory unfolds, the Respectful Pianist can be seen making their way across the Graveyard, ending on a high ledge above the tunnel filled with butterflies and a Darkness Plant in its center. At the end of the memory, the Respectful Pianist puts a hand to their chest and bows their head towards the player in a solemn acknowledgment, as if respecting them for walking into danger to free them.

levels.description: will make your avatar bow their head and place their right hand over their chest, while a gong and trumpet fanfare sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with a ring of warm yellow light circling your avatar's hand when they place it on their heart.

will make your avatar kneel down on their right knee, with their left elbow on their left knee, bow their head, and place their right hand over their chest, while a louder gong and trumpet fanfare sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with a ring of warm yellow light circling your avatar's hand when they place it on their heart.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is in the shape of a duck and in a white color, with a light-orange colored beak and accents, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is styled with a section of hair at the top sticking up straight, and the rest of the hair evenly fanned outwards around their lower head, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is the Winter Piano, costing from the Traveling Spirit. Its shape is similar to that of the Instrument, with a piano wing attached to the top. It is colored white, with golden accents along the sides and the Rhythm Symbol in the middle of the wing. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total). The player sits while playing the Instrument, which plays 15 notes. The Winter Piano plays the melody part on Music Sheets. Its pitch is one octave above the standard Instrument (in C major, it covers C5 to C7), making it the highest-pitched Instrument available in the game, along with the Instrument. In Harmony Hall, the Winter Piano can be found on the back wall, behind and to the left of the front counter, in an alcove below the standard Piano.

name: Royal_Hairtousle_Teen
summary: The Royal Hairtousle Teen is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of the Blue Bird who offers the inline_text Expression. The Royal Hairtousle Teen is found at the Blue Bird Theater in the Elevated Clearing from Hidden Forest. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Headpiece, and a Cape.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a dark blue tailcoat over a high-collared shirt and loose trousers. The coat has white outlines and rolled-up sleeves. It also features a white V-shaped line from the shoulders to the chest. The shirt and pants are white, tucked into boots with a similar V-shaped pattern at the front. It was available to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Head Accessory.description: The Head Accessory offered by this Spirit is a pair of red earmuffs with silver wing-shaped pieces attached around them. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a red, pleated off-shoulder Cape with a silver bird-shaped piece snaked around the collar. Silvery lines with diamond decorations run from the bird head around to a wing-shaped fastener on the other shoulder. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Saluting_Captain
summary: The Saluting Captain is a Regular Spirit in the Golden Wasteland who offers the inline_text Expression. The Saluting Captain is found behind the shipwreck at the center of Crab Fields. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and a Prop Prop.

Memory.text: The Saluting Captain can be found behind the shipwreck and near its front end at the center of Crab Fields. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 5 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. Beware the many Dark Crabs that populate the area and the single Dark Dragon patrolling the shipwreck. As their memory unfolds, the Saluting Captain sits within the hull of the ship before leaving for the deck by climbing the stairs nearby. Here, the Saluting Captain stands at the edge of the ship with a hand raised in a solemn salute, watching as several other Spirits sail away in smaller boats along the Polluted Water. At the end of the memory, the Saluting Captain gazes towards the sky, snapping their legs together and performing a sharp salute.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a close-cropped cut, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node.

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a long wooden staff with a diamond-shaped tip, costing . It is a non-placeable Prop that cannot be used to decorate Shared Spaces. When activated, it shoots off a burst of colorful fireworks with a bang. After 5 shots, there is a 10 second cooldown before it can be activated again. There are also firework Spells with similar effects to this Prop. The more common one is a Fireworks Spell that is available as a 1 Candle Blessing. It only allows ten fireworks to be fired off and does not give you a staff. The less common one is a Prop Spell available during Days of Fortune that gives you and your friends the Fireworks Staff for 30 minutes.

name: Saluting_Protector
summary: The Saluting Protector is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Gratitude who offers the inline_text Expression. The Saluting Protector is found in Golden Wasteland's First Krill Area, on the left under the collapsed bell structure. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Cape, and the .

Memory.text: The Saluting Protector can be found in Golden Wastelands Graveyard Entrance, aka First Krill Area, under the collapsed bell structure to the players left if they enter from the Broken Temple. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 6 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. This memory can be difficult to relive due to the Dark Dragon patrolling the small area in a circle. Patience is key to successfully reliving this Spirit memory, and it is encouraged to use the unlimited time limit to the player's advantage. Bringing a few friends along would be a good idea, as they can help recharge the player's Cape and can collect their lost Winged Light if they do get hit by the Dark Dragon. Alternatively, there is a minor bug that can be used to make reliving this Spirit's memory significantly easier, especially for solo players. When re-entering the Spirit's area from any entrance into the Crab Fields, the Dark Dragon defending the First Krill Area will often fail to spawn in, removing the primary threat of the area and greatly speeding up the process of reliving the Spirit's memory. As their memory unfolds, the Saluting Protector can be seen dancing on top of the ruined bell structures to the left, right, and middle sides of the central structure. They continue up the ruins, and continues to dance until they reach a smaller area at the top of the ruins, to the player's left. Finally, they pose at the center of the area at the top of a gently sloped ramp, their feet close together and their hands posed in front of their stomach. At the end of the memory, the Saluting Protector commends the player for making the long trek across the ruins. They raise their left hand to their forehead and quickly move their hand forwards in a dismissive, but respectful, saluting gesture.

levels.description: will make your avatar bring their left hand up against their forehead briefly before sharply bringing it forward, while a drumroll and xylophone riff play.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with a burst of small sparkles radiating from your avatar's left hand.
will make your avatar stomp their left foot before repeating the same motion as seen in Level 1, while a similar drumroll and xylophone riff plays, with the rhythm being repeated a second time.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with a burst of small sparkles radiating from your avatar's left hand.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a long, orange-colored head of a creature with a horn at the top, a pointy snout, golden teeth, and yellow details, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is made of white fur and in a similar shape to that of a maple leaf, with a fluffy piece around the neck, a beigeThere was a time when the lining color was orange due to a bug. interior, and an orange band with yellow triangles on each shoulder, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).
