name: Sassy_Drifter
summary: The Sassy Drifter is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Gratitude who offers the inline_text. The Sassy Drifter is found at the far right of Isle of Dawn. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Sassy Drifter can be found at the far right of Isle of Dawn, amongst the hills where the clouds touch the sand. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 5 memory fragments and a 4-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Sassy Drifter can be seen walking towards the clouds and then sits down to enjoy the scenery. At the end of the memory, the Sassy Drifter assumes a position with their weight shifted onto the left leg and their hand propped up on their left hip, as they stare off to the right.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is white, shaped like the head of a weasel, and is decorated with orange and yellow accents, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a golden bell-shaped hat with a yellow band tied around its tip, sitting on top of tied up hair, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

name: Scarecrow_Farmer
summary: The Scarecrow Farmer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Enchantment who offers the inline_text Expression. The Scarecrow Farmer is found far past the Forgotten Ark, on the near side of the farm fields by the polluted pond. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Scarecrow Farmer can be found directly behind the Forgotten Ark, near a small patch of barren farmland where the red light is found. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 6 memory fragments and a 5-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Scarecrow Farmer can be seen pouring water over a patch of farmland, appearing to plant seeds in the ground before heading back to the pool to refill their water jar. They take the jar back to their little farm, only to realize that birds have started to gather around the seeds. Immediately the Scarecrow Farmer hurries to their seeds and shoos the birds away. At the end of the memory, the Scarecrow Farmer walks by their patch of farmland, only to spot that a flock of birds has gathered around their planted seeds. They shake their head before rushing to the birds and scare them away by going in a crouched position and throwing up their arms.

levels.description: will make your avatar rapidly hop forward in a crouched standing position with their back hunched, throw up their arms, and wiggle them around in circles, while a jaw harp sound effect plays.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with red clouds of fire bursting from your avatar's hands.

will make your avatar take a big leap forward, straddling their legs and arms wildly in the air, before landing and only continuing the motion with their arms as seen in Level 1, while more muted jaw harp and drum sound effects play.

makes the same motion as Level 3, with small purple clouds appearing around your avatar as they leap in the air, followed by a big exclamation mark flickering under them before they land, and vertical purple beams of light appearing in front of them and spreading outwards as they land on the ground.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a version of the Base Mask, with a shiny golden square replacing the glowing hole on the forehead, and a purple looped scarf that covers the neck and the lower half of the face, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a big, floppy, purple hat with yellow embroidery around the bottom and a yellow tassel hanging from the hat's tip, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

name: Scaredy_Cadet
summary: The Scaredy Cadet is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Assembly who offers the inline_text Expression. The Scaredy Cadet is found to the right side of Forest's Brook, just past the pavilion with the Message Shrine. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, a Prop, and the .

Memory.text: The Scaredy Cadet can be found to the right side of Forest's Brook, just past the pavilion with the Message Shrine. This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. Note that some fragments are exposed to the polluted rain, so be quick to collect them. As their memory unfolds, the Scaredy Cadet and the Marching Adventurer can be seen working together to build a hammock. They appear to be short of a few pieces, and the Adventurer encourages the Cadet to venture through the Forest's Brook to go find more supplies. The two Spirits walk along the Brook until the Adventurer spots some extra hammock parts on the other side of the water. The Adventurer crosses the Brook with ease, while the Cadet remains on the opposite side, frightened of the water. At the end of the memory, the Marching Adventurer beckons to the Scaredy Cadet, encouraging them to cross the Brook. The Cadet dips one foot into the water, but quickly pulls their foot out and shakes the water off of it.

levels.description: will make your avatar slowly extend their right hand before quickly pulling it away and shaking it rapidly, only standing on their left foot as they shake your hand. While your avatar slowly sticks their right hand out, a string crescendo plays in the background, and when they pull their hand away, the crescendo breaks into a loud but quick horn accent.

makes the same motion as Level 1, with white light particles flicking out from your avatar's hand as they pull it away, as well as white trails of light following the motion of their hands as they go to stand up straight again.

will make your avatar step forward tentatively with their right foot before quickly pulling their foot back towards their body, quickly hopping from foot to foot and shaking their head from side to side afterwards, before shaking their foot as though something were stuck to it. Similarly to Level 1, a string crescendo will play as your avatar sticks their foot out, continuing until they pull it away. At this point a similar but louder horn sound effect will play.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with white light particles flicking out from your avatar's foot as soon as it touches the ground, right before they pull it back.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is round and stone-gray, with a thick vertical yellow stripe going through the right eye, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit includes shoulder-length, thick, downwards-hanging dreadlocks under a yellow scarf with green accents, tied together in the back and covering the forehead to the back of the head, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a blue hammock, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used in Shared Spaces. It is a one-person chat item, which means that used by itself it does not allow players to chat, but when placed near a chat table (or any other chat Prop) it allows someone sitting in the hammock to join the conversation at the table. It appears as a disassembled hammock with the fabric tied to several sticks on its owner's back when carried. It was available to all players during the Season from the fifth node ( total).

name: Scarred_Sentry
summary: The Scarred Sentry is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of The Two Embers - Part 1 who offers the inline_text. The Scarred Sentry is found in The Last City, before the Temple gates, at the back of the Marketplace. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, Shoes, a Hair_c, a Hair_p, a Cape, a Prop_c, and a Prop_s.

Memory.text: The Scarred Sentry can be found in The Last City, before the large Temple gates, guarded by two sentries, at the back of the Marketplace. Unlike other Spirits, the Scarred Sentry has no memory that can be relived, but rather a Seasonal Quest dedicated to them. With the Spirit traumatized from recent events and unable to move, players complete a series of tasks, helping the Spirit gain back their bravery and defend against instruders. Players can interact with the Scarred Sentry without completing any Quests. However, only if no Quest is active can they be interacted with, which can be done by starting a Quest from the Season of The Two Embers - Part 1, teleporting Home, and then using the Return Shrine to go back to The Last City. Now no Quest will be active and the player can explore the area freely.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a purple and green tunic with rolled-up sleeves, gloves, and a simple sword at the belt. The bottom edge of the tunic reveals a matching undershirt with a golden triangle-patterned trim. The Outfit's loose pants are cinched at the knee. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Shoes.description: The Shoes offered by this Spirit are a pair of thick brown boots with criss-crossing straps. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hairstyles.description: This Spirit offers a total of two Hairstyles: a Cracked Helmet and a Plummed Helmet.

=Cracked Helmet=.description: Not to be confused with the Plummed Helmet. The first Hair offered by this Spirit consists of a damaged helmet and a high bun. The helmet is black, and the silver rim around the nose- and cheek-guards is chipped. The bun is tied with a red band and leaves the hair's ends peeking out. It was available to all players from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

=Plummed Helmet=.description: Not to be confused with the Cracked Helmet. The second Hair offered by this Spirit consists of a round helmet and a high ponytail. The helmet is dark gray, with a mute silver rim around the protruding cheek-guards and v-shape between the eyes. The ponytail is tied high at the back and a bit feathered. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a long, burgundy cape over wide neck armor. The armor piece is pale brown with silver outlines and an emblem at the chest. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Props.description: This Spirit offers a total of two Props: a Sentry Shield and a Sentry Spear.

=Sentry Shield=.description: The first Prop offered by this Spirit is a worn, dark green shield with silver edges. The center is decorated with a silver emblem: a four-pointed star with a wide top arm, surrounded by four diamonds. When equipped, the shield is held with one arm at the sideupon selecting its prop_c icon at the bottom of the screen, the avatar jumps and holds up the shield in front of them. It cannot be placed and therefore cannot be used in Shared Spaces. When carried on its owner's back, the Prop appears in its original form. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

=Sentry Spear=.description: The second Prop offered by this Spirit is a wide-bladed spear with a glowing diamond in the center. The shaft has two cord-wrapped grips. When equipped, the spear is held with one arm at the sideupon selecting its prop_s icon at the bottom of the screen, the avatar performs a spin trick with it. It cannot be placed and therefore cannot be used in Shared Spaces. When carried on its owner's back, the Prop appears in its original form. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's sixth node ( total).

name: Scolding_Student
summary: The Scolding Student is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Assembly who offers the inline_text Expression. The Scolding Student is found in the third area of the Forest Clearing in Hidden Forest, to the left of the exit gate, below the first treehouse steps. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Scolding Student can be found in the third area of the Forest Clearing in Hidden Forest, to the left of the exit gate, below the first treehouse steps. This Spirit has a standard memory with 5 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. Players should be wary of the rain; it is advised to bring a friend to recharge or an umbrella if you have one. As with any spirits under the rain, it will expire if left too long under the rain, so be sure to collect the memory in time before it fades away. As their memory unfolds, the Baffled Botanist can be seen hiding behind the treehouse and looking at the Scolding Student, who seems to be examining different natural things around the threehouse. At the end of the memory the Baffled Botanist can be seen kneeling in front of a lantern with their back to the Student. The Student scolds them but the Botanist stands up, turns around, and gives the light to the Student. The Scolding Student seems moved by the offering.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a round stone-grey mask with a small yellow triangle centered above the eyes, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit consists out of two three-strand braids that lay in the front, curtain bangs, and a green ribbon that is tied in a bow on top of the head and intertwines into the braids, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a green and shaped like big droplets, bordered by a yellow edge, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Seed_of_Hope
summary: The Seed of Hope is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of AURORA who offers the inline_text Expression. The Seed of Hope is found standing on the left side of the Coliseum in Valley of Triumph, by the AURORA Guide. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a mask, a hair, a cape and the . Players can view their memories by completing the fourth Quest inside the broken temple in the Battlefield of the Golden Wasteland.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is bare-faced with two straight, red lines under and next to each eye, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a medium-length, brushed-back, mohawk-like hairstyle that is divided in the middle, with two hair strands in the front, held by wide red hair bands, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a flat yellow cape with feathered shoulder embellishments, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's sixth node ( total).

name: Sense_of_Self
summary: The Sense of Self is a Seasonal Shop from the Season of Moomin. The Sense of Self is found on a grassy mound to the right in Moominvalley Glade. Unlike typical Seasonal Spirits, there is no need to first relive a Spirit memory to access this Shop and it does not offer an Expression. The collectibles offered by this Shop are Shoes, a Neckpiece, a Hairpiece, and .

Shoes.description: The Shoes offered by this Shop are orange and covered by white leg warmers decorated with a small diamond near the hem. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Neck Accessory.description: The Neck Accessory offered by this Shop is a small silver bell attached to an orange ribbon that wraps around the player's neck. When equipped, this item adds a gentle bell jingling sound effect to the player's movements. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's third node. For information about the Bell Call, please visit here.

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Shop is a yellow bow tied to the back of the player's head. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Shivering_Trailblazer
summary: The Shivering Trailblazer is a Regular Spirit in Hidden Forest who offers the inline_text Expression. The Shivering Trailblazer is found within the first gated courtyard in Forest Clearing where players first encounter rain, in the back left corner. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Shivering Trailblazer can be found within the first gated courtyard in Forest Clearing where players first encounter rain, in the back left corner. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 5 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. It is also the first memory introduced where the Spirit can be damaged (in this case, by the rain). As their memory unfolds, the Shivering Trailblazer and another Spirit are seen dashing through Forest Clearing, taking shelter beneath the roof of the gated courtyard and the hollow tree roots beyond in a desperate attempt to avoid getting soaked by the rain. At the end of the memory, the Shivering Trailblazer stands in front of a stone lantern tucked beneath the hollow roots of a tree. Chilled by the relentless rain despite their best efforts, the Spirit lets out a mighty sneeze and shivers miserably.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a beige half-sleeve top that covers a pair of matching shorts, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a long, wispy haircut with bangs that cover the left eye, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Spirit's Wing Buff and the Friendship Tree's fifth node.

name: Shushing_Light_Scholar
summary: The Shushing Light Scholar is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Lightseekers who offers the inline_text Expression. The Shushing Light Scholar is found on the Fourth Floor in Vault of Knowledge, on a floating platform to the left of the Isle of Dawn Constellation. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Shushing Light Scholar can be found on the Fourth Floor in Vault of Knowledge, on a floating platform to the left of the Isle of Dawn Constellation. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 10 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. In order to complete this Spirit Memory, players will have to carry the light up to the top of a series of platforms, which can pose to be difficult, as there is a high risk the light will fall down between a gap. It will be of help to exhibit patience and let the light touch the next platform before each jump, assuring that it will not fall down. For some higher plaforms, carefully coordinated flying can make it easier to advance. As their memory unfolds, the Shushing Light Scholar can be seen making their way up to each platform, periodically assuming a praying pose throughout their journey. At the top, they once again stand a praying position alongside two other spirits. At the end of the memory, the Shushing Light Scholar shushes the player by bringing their hand up to their mouth.
Memory.file_name: 05 VK Seasonal Spirit - Shushing Light Scholar.jpg
Memory.alt_text: Relive the Shushing Light Scholar's memory

levels.description: will make your avatar slightly bend their knees and raise their right hand up to their mouth, while a "shhh" sound plays, overlayed with rhythmical clicking sounds.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with a few white sparkles flying up as your avatar raises their hand.

will make your avatar slightly bend their knees and raise their right hand up to their mouth while looking around, before bending their knees even further and bring both arms at shoulder level and motioning them up and down twice, while first a "shhh" sound, and then squaking sounds play.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with a few white sparkles flying up as your avatar raises their hand, and a small trail of light following each of their hands as they motion them up and down.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is round and beige, with a sharp blue triangle on the forehead, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: Not to be confused with Cape. The Cape offered by this Spirit is blue with a rounded trim, big petal-like shapes, and purple to yellow faded accents between the shapes and the bottom hem, which is decorated with evenly spaced out, small, glowing yellow orbs, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Sky_Beta_Season_Draft
summary: The Migrating Bird Whisperer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Migration who offers the inline_text Expression. The Migrating Bird Whisperer is found in the Wind Paths, at the top of a floating island, left of the main island. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Migrating Jelly Whisperer can be found in the Wind Paths, on the main island, to the left of the Flight Guide, behind an opening in the ground. This Spirit has a standard memory with 9 memory fragments. As their memory unfolds, the Migrating Jelly Whisperer can be seen sneaking up on some Jellyfish. Once they're close, they climb up a ledge and jump into the middle of the unsuspecting Jellyfish flock, which immeditately scurry away, though not very far. The Whisperer watches as the Jellyfish leave, before the trying their luck again as they carefully follow the creatures to their new spot. This time, the Jellyfish spot the Spirit earlier, but as they begin to fly away, the Whisperer reaches out after them. The flock stops and turns around, coming back to the Migrating Jelly Whisperer. At last, their wish is granted as the flock lifts them up in the air, where the Spirit floats and dances amongst their newly found friends. At the end of the memory, the Migrating Jelly Whisperer stands by the Jellyfish, jumping and performing pirouettes in the air. They stop their joyous dance to watch another group of small and big Jellyfish pass by and fly high up into the sky.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a square-neck top and apron over cinched shorts. The cap-sleeved top has a zig-zag crop that reveals a yellow undershirt. The waist cloth is apron-like, colored orange with blue and yellow edges. One wrist has golden bands, and the ankles feature leg scrunches with ball-shaped decorations. It is a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season.

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Spirit is a pair of golden, dome-shaped earmuffs. The earmuffs are not connected by a headband. Each muff is lined with fur and features a pair of red and blue pointed ribbons attached to the center. It is offered to all players for during the Season.

name: Sky__Cinnamoroll_Pop-Up_Cafe
summary: A village isn't complete without a cafe, and it's finally time to open one in Sky. From Saturday, April 27, 2024 at 00:00 PDT (UTC-7) until Friday, May 17, 2024 at 23:59 PDT (UTC-7), join the collaboration event for the grand opening of Aviary Villages new cafe, featuring the beloved Sanrio character Cinnamoroll! This shy but friendly pooch knows a thing or two about cafes, and hell be in Aviary Village for a special three-week celebration welcoming Sky Kids to the newest gathering place in the kingdom.

name: Slouching_Soldier
summary: The Slouching Soldier is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of The Little Prince who offers the inline_text Expression. The Slouching Soldier is found to the player's immediate right in the Starlight Desert's giant jar, that is found to the right of the entrance from the Vault of Knowledge. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair, a Cape, and the .

Memory.text: The Slouching Soldier can be found to the player's immediate right in the Starlight Desert's giant jar, that is found to the right of the entrance from the Vault of Knowledge. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 8 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Slouching Soldier recalls several events in their life that lead them to drink dark water in a jar to cope. First, the Slouching Soldier stumbles with their left hand outstretched in front of a group of other Spirits standing on a hill: the Saluting Captain, Backflipping Champion, and Fainting Warrior. The Soldier then stands on that same hill, holding a jar. They walk back down the hill and hunch over their dropped jar. Over on the next hill, the Slouching Soldier runs over to a few Star Lamps as offered by the Star Collector. The Spirit sits where those Star Lamps once were, burying their face into their arm. They stumble along with a jar in hand. Once again, the Soldier flounders towards a scene at the top of the largest hill. At the top, a parental Spirit stands with two scared Spirit children, one in each arm. The Soldier carries another jar. At the end of the memory, the Slouching Soldier flings the empty jar to the ground and drops to their knees and hands. The Little Prince enters the scene and asks, "Why are you drinking the dark water?" "So that I may forget," the Soldier replies, without looking up. "Forget what?" "Forget that I am ashamed." "Ashamed of what?" The Slouching Soldier stands up, covers their face, and runs off shouting, "Ashamed of drinking the dark water!" The Little Prince watches on as the Soldier grabs another jar and contemplates aloud, "Grown-ups are certainly very, very odd." The jar is tossed aside and the Soldier slouches in despair.

levels.description: will make your avatar slouch by hanging their head and dangling their arms, before looking up to the left once, and going back to slouching again, while melancholy accordion sound effects play. Your avatar will stay in this slouching position until they are moved.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with a brightly glowing, translucent blue circle appearing around your avatar's head.

will make your avatar slouch to the side with their head hanging and arms swaying, sway back and forward once, and finally let themsleves fall forward with their face down, while more elongated melancholy accordion sound effects play. Your avatar will stay in this lying position until they are moved; upon doing so, they will fully push themselves up with their hands, still swaying a little once they stand.

makes the same motion as Level 3, with a few small, white sparkles spiraling around your avatar's head, as well as a trail of small, white sparkles following the motion of their head while they are falling and standing up again.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is short and messy in zig-zag waves that only cover the right side of the head, with completely shaved sides and back, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is dark-gray and tattered, with a round black collar resembling shoulder pads, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Slumbering_Shipwright
summary: The Slumbering Shipwright is a Regular Spirit in Daylight Prairie who offers the inline_text Expression (not to be confused with Prairie's other weary worker, the ). The Slumbering Shipwright is found in Prairie Villages on the larger middle island, behind a two-player door. The only collectible offered by this Spirit is a Hair.

Memory.text: The Slumbering Shipwright can be found in Prairie Villages on the larger middle island, behind a two-player door. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 4 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Slumbering Shipwright is seen moving throughout their workstation with a hammer in hand, dutifully repairing the broken boat half that sits at the center of the room. At the end of the memory, the Spirit hammers away at the boat while starting to nod off, missing a few strikes as they nearly fall asleep standing up. A Butterfly perched on top of the boat flutters off, catching the Slumbering Shipwright's attention as it moves towards the nearby bed. The Spirit sleepily stumbles after it, stretching with a huge yawn before flopping down on their back to settle in for a rest.

makes the same motion as Level 3 with light particles following your avatar's right hand and a pale white "Z" flashing near their head.

name: Sneezing_Geographer
summary: The Sneezing Geographer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of The Little Prince who offers the inline_text Expression. The Sneezing Geographer is found in the Starlight Desert, on top of the giant pile of books floating in the clouds at the far end of the area, relative to the Vault of Knowledge's entrance. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Sneezing Geographer can be found in the Starlight Desert, on top of the giant pile of books floating in the clouds at the far end of the area, relative to the Vault of Knowledge's entrance. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 6 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Sneezing Geographer can be seen studying illustrations of the stars, clouds, and the mountain on which the Eye of Eden rests. They look out in the sky and wander from book to book, deep in thought. The Spirit then climbs up a flight of stairs to gaze at the open pages of a book as big as themself, which shows an illustration of the Little Prince, speaking with another Spirit, and each of the Spirits of the Season of The Little Prince, as well as the Seasonal Guide, The Rose, on the Prince's home planet. At the end of the memory, the Geographer sneezes before continuing to pore over the book. The Little Prince approaches the Geographer, says hello, and asks, "What are you reading?" The Geographer then admonishes the Prince. "Don't interrupt please. I'm studying a visitor from another planet." The Prince scratches his head in confusion, as the illustration in the book depicts him, the "visitor from another planet", and mentions that "Grown-ups sure are interesting."

levels.description: will make your avatar hold their hands to their chest and lean back quickly further and further with their eyes closing as they prepare to sneeze, before sneezing once. During the sneeze, their arms fly up to the sides and their Cape lifts up, before they stand still and finally wipe across their face with their right arm. Three high-pitched notes play while your avatar leans back, and finally, a fourth, louder eighth note plays as they sneeze, ended with a quieter note as they wipe their face.

makes the same motion as Level 1, with a bunch of round, green light particles bursting out from your avatar's face as they sneeze, which quickly turn yellow, then orange, and finally a red color as they fall to the ground.

will make your avatar lean far back and cover their face with their left hand to prepare to sneeze, before pausing briefly. Right after, they will sneeze so heavily that they jump up in the air with their feet spread wide apart and their arms lifted straight to the sides, before landing again and shaking out their head. A similar 3-note procession will play, but the fourth note that can be heard as your avatar sneezes is a much louder triplet note.

makes the same motion as Level 3, with a trail of glowing, golden light particles following the motion of your avatar's hands as they prepare to sneeze, and a bunch of round, green light particles bursting out from their face as they sneeze, which quickly turn yellow, then orange, and finally a red color as they fall to the ground.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a tall, cone-shaped, blue-gray, pointed hat with long ear flaps, and a wide, black band around the lower half of the hat, embellished with lighter blue-gray, symmetrical detailing, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is heavy and dark-gray, with fabric pooling up towards the top in the back, and a black band on each opening side of the Cape, decorated with light blue-gray, symmetrical detailing, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Snoozing_Carpenter
summary: The Snoozing Carpenter is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Enchantment who offers the inline_text Expression. The Snoozing Carpenter is found in front of the Forgotten Ark, on the player's left side when entering the area. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Snoozing Carpenter can be found in front of the Forgotten Ark, on the player's left side when entering the area. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 6 memory fragments and a 10-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Snoozing Carpenter can be seen reading an instruction manual on how to build the cloth coverings seen across the Ark. The Spirit then gets to work building more tent-like coverings, and works down the length of the Ark until they get closer to the bow of the ship. Once they reach the front end of the ship, they lean against a large stone vase for support. At the end of the memory, the Snoozing Carpenter looks out across the Ark, seeing all the work they have done. They turn around afterwards and prop themself up against the large vase, nodding off as they do.

levels.description: will make your avatar repeatedly and slowly let their head fall and lift it up again, each time letting it fall deeper and softly sway it from side to side, while gentle lullaby plays until reaching the end position. Your avatar will remain like this until they are moved, causing them to quickly shoot up straight to the sound of an alarm and look around with their arms slightly lifted in front of them.

makes the same motion as Level 1, with a flock of small light particles spiraling around your avatar's head, spreading out more and more during the Expression. Once your avatar has finally let their head fall and does not lift it again, several "Z" letters will quickly flicker and overlap each other in front of your avatar, accompanied by a soft snoring sound. When they wake up, a flock of small white clouds will sudddenly appear.

will make your avatar let their head fall on their chest, collapse to the ground with their arms weakly supporting them, and let their head touch the ground, while a longer lullaby plays. Your avatar will remain in this position until they are moved, causing them to wake up to an alarm sound effect, put their palms on the ground and look around left and right before assuming a crouched position and finally standing up, still looking from side to side while squeaking sound effects play.

makes the same motion as Level 3, with a trail of white light particles following your avatar's head, as well as small, white, individual "Z"-shaped letters floating up from their head, with snoring sound effects.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit a half-up half-down bun hairstyle of wavy hair with a decorative thin purple band tied around the head horizontally, and a golden band coming from the bun in the back over the middle-part, and ending with a small tassel hanging down the forehead, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is yellow-orange with a purple interior, a wide purple band at the end, embroidered with yellow thread, and evenly spaced out, small yellow tassels hanging down the trim, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Sparkler_Parent
summary: The Sparkler Parent is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Belonging who offers the inline_text Expression. The Sparkler Parent is found at the entrance of the maze in the Valley Temple. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, and a Prop.

Memory.text: The Sparkler Parent is found in the Maze in the Valley Temple, on the player's left as soon as they enter the Temple, blocked by a Spirit Gate that requires the player to have relived at least one Regular Spirit from Golden Wasteland. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 10 memory fragments and a 20-minute overall time limit. If the player has not relived at least one Regular Spirit from Golden Wasteland yet, they can also enter through the Maze's exit, which is not blocked by any barrier. The Maze's exit is also located at the player's left when entering the Temple, but higher up on the third section from left to right. To relive the Sparkler Parent's memory, players will journey through the dark Maze. To help see more clearly through the darkness, players can bring out their candle from the Menu, or activate a Glow Spell. At several points throughout the memory, it is required to drop down a level, which can best be done by carefully dropping or flying down a wall or edge while pulling the light with them. Crabs can also be found in some areas, which can be stunned by letting out a Deep Call. As their memory unfolds, the Sparkler Parent can be seen making their way through the maze while holding a lantern to light the way. Having reached their destination in a small room with several boxes, pots, and decorative candles, they pick up a box with small fireworks, candles, and sparklers in it. Outside of the maze, they showcase some sparklers to the Boogie Kid and Confetti Cousin, who each have their hands brought together and lean forward in awe. At the end of the memory, the Sparkler Parent lights sparklers and waves them through the air, before the Boogie Kid and Confetti Cousin repeat the same. The player then grabs a bell from underneath their cape and rings it, causing the Sparkler Parent to stop. They bring their hand to their chin and think for a short while, before they raise up their arm in epiphany, with a glowing exclamation mark blinking above their head.

levels.description: will make your avatar position themselves sideways, before pulling out a sparkler from their hands and waving it through the air like the infinity symbol with their outstretched left arm, with their focus locking on their hand's motion, while a sound similar to igniting a match and a sparkler burning down and twinkling sound effects play. This action is continued for as long as you don't move your avatar.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with a glowing white trail of light following the motion your avatar's left hand.

will make your avatar pose in certain directions with their sparkler, according to which buttons you press on a 3x3 pop-up menu while sparkler sound effects and varying calm notes, similar to the {{Spirit Item|Tinkering Chimesmith|Instrument|inline_text}}, play. This pop-up menu is similar to the menu used by the player to hit specific notes when playing an [[Instrument]], but smaller.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with a glowing white trail of light following the motion of your avatar's left hand.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is round and plain beige, similar to the Base Mask, with yellow ornaments decorating the forehead, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is medium-lengthed, with a rounded look at the bottom, side bangs to the left, and a pair of red hair clips pinning back hair above the ear on the right side, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a pinwheel with a white stick and four sections colored white, blue, yellow, and red respectively, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. When carried on a player's back, the Prop appears in its original form, but without the stick. This item was not available during the Season of Belonging. Instead, it was added to the Sparkler Parent's Friendship Tree, during their third visit as Traveling Spirit on December 23rd, 2021.

name: Spinning_Mentor
summary: The Spinning Mentor is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Dreams who offers the inline_text Expression. The Spinning Mentor is found in Village of Dreams between two buildings near the Dreams Guide. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Spinning Mentor can be found in the Village of Dreams, nestled in a corner formed by two buildings near the Dreams Guide. This Spirit has a standard memory with 8 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Spinning Mentor, who can be seen seen sitting on the perimeter of the ice rink, is approached by the young Skater. The Mentor proceeds to guide the Skater through various techniques they will need to use on the ice. The Mentor advises the Skater to keep their knees bent, and helps work them through the steps needed to perform a spin. When the Skater falls, the Mentor helps them up, and the two are also seen skating together. At the end of the memory, the young Skater seems to have fallen and is sprawled across the ice. The Spinning Mentor beckons for the young student to rise, and the Mentor proceeds to give a demonstration of the spin that the Skater is trying to master. The Skater, amazed, claps for the Mentor, who politely bows and gestures for the Skater to give it a try. The Skater successfully skates into a spin, and the Mentor nods approvingly.

levels.description: will make your avatar throw their hands up to their left before crouching down into a sit spin with one leg out. The sit spin then transitions to a variation of an upright spin, with your avatar reaching up with one hand, raising their body, and craning their head back towards a raised foot. Your avatar will remain spinning until you move; when you do, your avatar will spin out and quickly come to a stop with both hands extended to maintain balance. When your avatar initially throws their hands up, a bright and quick staccato note plays in the background. As you spin, a gentle twinkling noise can be heard.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with a green light trail following one of your avatar's hands and a blue light trail following the other.

will make your avatar leap into an upright spin with both feet touching the ground and an arm extended above your head. Your avatar will remain spinning until you move; when you do, your avatar will slowly spin to a stop, with their left foot extended slightly and both arms held out to the side. A quick staccato note plays at the beginning of the Expression, similar to note heard at the beginning of Level 1. During the spin, the same gentle twinkling noise plays in the background.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with green light trails following your avatar's hands and feet, plus a blue light trail that spins up and down the length of their body as they turn.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is shaped like the head of a quail, consisting mostly out of the colors black and red with yellow accents, as well as a small beak and a black head plume, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit includes long hair that is pulled in a high ponytail but not looped through fully, creating a looped bun with a long tail, as well as one looped hair strand at the front of each side of the face, tied together with small red hairties, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit includes fluffy, black, inner fur lining that envelopes the wavy bottom and straight top hems as well, with smooth dark-red fabric covering most of the exterior, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Spirit_of_Adventure
summary: The Spirit of Adventure is a Seasonal Shop from the Season of Moomin. The Spirit of Adventure is found on a grassy mound to the right in Moominvalley Glade. Unlike typical Seasonal Spirits, there is no need to first relive a Spirit memory to access this Shop and it does not offer an Expression. The collectibles offered by this Shop are a Hair, a Cape, a Instrument, a Prop, and .

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Shop is a short, feathered cut with side-swept bangs. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Shop has a green-brown gradient and worn-down appearance, featuring a collar and a pair of pockets stitched to the front. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's fourth node.

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Shop is the Harmonica. It has a gray rectangular body and is decorated by a lighter gray symbol. When carried on its owner's back, the Instrument appears in its original form. It was offered to all players for during the Season, from the Friendship Tree's second node. The player is standing while playing the Instrument, which plays 15 notes. The Harmonica plays the wind part on Music Sheets. Its pitch is the same as the standard Piano (in C major, it covers C4 to C6).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Shop is a tall, conical green tent with light green accents. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. Once placed, the player can enter the tent and crawl around inside on their elbows and knees. When carried on its owner's back, it appears as an oversized brown bag with a rolled-up green canvas secured beneath the top flap. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

title: Spirit of Mural
name: Spirit_of_Mural
summary: The Spirit of Mural is a Seasonal Guide (also known as Quest Giver) from the Season of the Nine-Colored Deer who offers Quests and cosmetics. The Spirit of Mural is found at the Crescent Oasis, in front of the Mural by the pool of water. The Ultimate Guide offered a necklace_u, a outfit_u, a hair_u, and a cape_u for Season Pass holders. This Ultimate Guide also provides new cosmetics in the Quest Tree, available to all players: a mask and a hairpiece.

name: Spring_Camping
summary: Fancy a relaxing little camping getaway? From Monday, March 4, 2024 at 00:00 PST (UTC-8) until Sunday, March 10, 2024 at 23:59 PDT (UTC-7), join Spirits from the Season of Assembly for a short Spring Camping trip in Daylight Prairie above the eight-player door to see them and make a campsite of your own! For the duration of the event, Scaredy Cadet appears in Aviary Village, offering to teleport players directly to the campsite. During their week-long camping trip, the Assembly crew will bring a fire that shares Social Light with everyone, as well as a special Shared Spaces Shrine that encompasses the entirety of the area and offers a range of items for everyone to useincluding a couple of new Props that could build something a little sturdier than just a tent. Head over with friends or find new ones there, and you might also catch a glimpse of a mysterious creature who sometimes can be spotted in the area, too.

name: Star_Collector
summary: The Star Collector (formerly the Shrewd Merchant) is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of The Little Prince who offers the inline_text Expression. The Star Collector is found on the broken boat in the Jellyfish Cove sub-area within Starlight Desert, accessed through a cloud tunnel to the left of the Garden of Roses. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Neckpiece, a Cape, and a Prop.

Memory.text: The Star Collector can be found on the broken boat in the Jellyfish Cove sub-area within Starlight Desert, accessed through a cloud tunnel to the left of the Garden of Roses. This Spirit has a collection memory with 8 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Star Collector can be seen dashing between the two split halves of the broken boat as stars twinkle merrily in the night sky. At the end of the memory, the Star Collector sits at a desk covered in star lamps and counts the many stars overhead, chuckling to themself with glee at the numbers. The Little Prince then enters the scene and asks the Spirit, "What do you do with these stars?" The Star Collector puts their hands on their hips, nodding as they proudly answer, "I own them. Five-hundred-and-one millions of them." "Why owning the stars?" The curious Little Prince asks as the Spirit continues to count. "It makes me rich," The Star Collector says. Unsatisfied with their response, the Little Prince questions them once more, "Why do you want to be rich?" Chuckling as if the answer was obvious, the Star Collector replies, "To buy more stars." The Little Prince tilts his head and contemplates aloud, "The grown-ups are certainly altogether extraordinary."

levels.description: will make your avatar hunch slightly and bring both hands up to chest level to rub them together a few times with their eyes squinted, while a light flute sound effect plays.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with trails of glowing, yellow sparkles following your avatar's hands, and a few small, white sparkles fizzling widely around their head.

will make your avatar look over both shoulders with their hands held at chest-level, before then hunching forward to rub them together next to their head with their eyes squinted, while a low flute sound effect plays.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with trails of glowing, yellow sparkles following your avatar's hands, and a few small, white sparkles fizzling widely around their head.

Neck Accessory.description: The Neck Accessory offered by this Spirit is a black necktie with a silver pendant shaped like the 's symbol, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a black cape with a matching fluffy fur trim and collar, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a gray lamp shaped like a four-pointed star, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. When activated, the lamp glows gently and fills the surrounding space with luminescent particles, like little stars. Upon being touched on the screen, these particles will burst outwards from the touching point and slowly recover back. Other players can not see that another player has touched the particles. Note that this Prop does not illuminate the area or recharge the player's Cape. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Stealthy_Survivor
summary: The Stealthy Survivor is a Regular Spirit in the Golden Wasteland who offers the inline_text. The Stealthy Survivor is found in the Graveyard, in a tunnel to the left of the largest cave structure. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and two tiers (Cape Tier 2 Cape) of a Cape.

Memory.text: The Stealthy Survivor can be found in the Graveyard, in a tunnel to the left of the largest cave structure. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 4 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. Beware the Dark Dragon that patrols nearby, as it occasionally crosses the path of the Spirit's memory. As their memory unfolds, the Stealthy Survivor cautiously traverses the dangerous landscape, watching their surroundings closely as they head into the large structure. At the end of the memory, an alerted Dark Dragon passes its gaze over the entrance of the structure. The Stealthy Survivor flattens themself in a crouch against the wall of the structure, hiding as they wait for the Dark Dragon's beam of red light to leave.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is long, pulled-back locs, costing . It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node.

Cape.description: The Stealthy Survivor offers two standard-style black Capes; a Tier 1 and a Tier 2 version, costing and respectively. Both are permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node and second Wing Buff respectively. The Tier 2 Cape (and the second Wing Buff that unlocks it) are not needed to complete the Golden Wasteland Constellation. These were both added to the Friendship Tree in Patch on June 28, 2022.

name: Stern_Shepherd
summary: The Stern Shepherd is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of The Two Embers - Part 1 who offers the inline_text. The Stern Shepherd is found in The Last City, at the very back of the area, in front of the Manatee enclosures. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, a Hair, a Prop, and the .

Memory.text: The Stern Shepherd can be found in The Last City, at the very back of the area, in front of the Manatee enclosure. Unlike other Spirits, the Stern Shepherd has no memory that can be relived, but rather a Seasonal Quest dedicated to them. As the city is besiged by Dark Creatures, this Quest gives players a series of tasks, helping the Spirit and themselves enter the Temple safely. Players can interact with the Stern Shepherd without completing any Quests.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a loose, high-collared shirt and thick skirt over pants and laced boots. A green, fringed belt is strung over the shoulder and a coil of rope hangs at the waist. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is smooth and gray, with a hammered bronze frame holding a pale blue inlay on the forehead, both shaped like a wide upside-down teardrop. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is inspired by a Manateeit is a long layered cut, with thick, round bangs, all tipped yellow at the ends. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a long, wooden staff with pale stripe markings. It is slightly crooked and the top features wide v-shapes made of differently-colored wood fused together. When equipped, players can select an icon at the bottom of the screen to make nearby Manatees follow themselecting the icon again will make them leave. It only functions within areas where Manatees liveonce the player exits the area, the Manatees will disappear. It cannot be placed and therefore cannot be used in Shared Spaces. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Stretching_Guru
summary: The Stretching Guru is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Gratitude who offers the inline_text Expression. The Stretching Guru is found in the large central cavern of the Prairie Caves, on a stepped hill to the player's left when entering from the Butterfly Fields. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Stretching Guru can be found in the large central cavern of the Prairie Caves, on a stepped hill to the player's left when entering from the Butterfly Fields. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 6 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. Note that certain memory fragments require flying and carrying the light into the air to advance. As their memory unfolds, the Stretching Guru can be seen moving across the cave and up the stepped slope on the other side, dancing and striking poses. The memory ends outside the tunnel leading to the Cozy Hideout. At the end of the memory, the Stretching Guru lowers their head before stretching their arms upwards, making their hands meet at the top.

levels.description: will make your avatar lower their head before stretching their arms out above their head and touch their hands together, while instrumental notes play.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with a white ring of light encircling each of your avatar's hands.

will make your avatar perform the same motion as in Level 1 but at a quicker pace, before letting their upper body fall down, hands still joined together, and stand up straight again with their arms swinging up with the motion, while instrumental notes play.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with a white ring of light encircling each of your avatar's hands during the first half of the Expression.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a wide, orange, cone-shaped hat with a yellow tip, sitting on tied-up hair, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is orange with yellow details, a big rounded trim, and a fluffy brown fur interior that goes over the bottom edge and includes a V-shaped neckpiece, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Stretching_Lamplighter
summary: The Stretching Lamplighter is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of The Little Prince who offers the inline_text Expression. The Stretching Lamplighter is found in the Starlight Desert, in the left front hole of a giant lamp tower hidden in the clouds, towards the left side of the area. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Stretching Lamplighter can be found in the Starlight Desert, in the left front hole of a giant lamp tower hidden in the clouds, towards the left side of the area. This Spirit has a standard memory with 9 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Stretching Lamplighter can be seen stretching before running about the lamp with a long, blue pole in hand, repeatedly turning the light on and off. Eventually they pause to take a break from their tireless work, pole leaning against the wall as the Spirit bends over their knees to catch their breath. At the end of the memory, the Stretching Lamplighter straightens to stretch their arms out forward and then backwards. The Little Prince enters the scene and exclaims, "You look exhausted! Why do you keep turning the light on?" The Spirit continues to stretch as they explain, "I have an order to turn the light on when it is off." Head tilting with confusion, the Little Prince asks, "Then why do you turn it off after turning it on?" "I have another order to turn the light off when it is on," the Stretching Lamplighter replies. "Then you are unlucky," concludes the Little Prince with a hand to his chin. The Stretching Lamplighter continues to stretch out their sore muscles, unbothered by their endless task. "Orders are orders."

levels.description: will make your avatar stretch their arm across their neck by bending one arm around their neck and holding its upper part with their other hand, repeat it on the other side, before twisting their upper torso to one side, then the other, while a squeaky sound effect followed by simple guitar strums plays.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with a trail of glowing, golden sparkles following the movement of each of your avatar's hands.

will make your avatar lean backwards with both hands holding their lower back, before falling into a sideways crouch to first stretch their left, and then the right leg, and finally crouch down, and push themselves up straight with their hands supporting their weight on their knees, while a deeper squeaky sound effect followed by jaunty guitar strums plays.
makes the same motion as Level 3, a trail of glowing, golden sparkles following the movement of each of your avatar's hands.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a straight, dark blue cap with gray accents, a chin strap, and a short visor, sitting on top of closely trimmed hair, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such cannot be worn over other Hairstyles.

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is black with a gray interior and accents, and a collar piece that covers the neck, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Talented_Builder
summary: The Talented Builder is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Flight who offers the inline_text Expression. The Talented Builder is found in the Wind Paths, on the lower of a pair of floating islands to the right of the main island when coming from the area's main entrance. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Neckpiece, a Hair, and the .

Memory.text: The Talented Builder can be found in the Wind Paths, on the lower of a pair of floating islands to the right of the main island when coming from the area's main entrance. They are located next to the bottom of a set of stairs on their island. This Spirit has a standard memory with 9 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Talented Builder can be seen hard at work building a boat figurehead in their workshop. Once finished, they cheerfully carry the object over to a Manta-driven boat to travel towards the main island, where they arrive to find another Spirit waiting by a larger boat docked for repairs. The Talented Builder then climbs up onto the boat and affixes the figurehead onto the boats bow before presenting their finished work to the other Spirit, which cheerfully throws their arms into the air. At the end of the memory, the Talented Builder steps back from their repairs, dusts off their hands, and gestures towards the boat as they present it to the other Spirit. The Spirit responds by thanking them, clasping their hands gratefully and bowing their head.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a blue, long-sleeved, wrapped tunic with white accents, a blue belt, and furry sleeve cuffs, off-white balloon pants with a "V"-shaped, yellow line rounding the legs towards the bottom, followed by a blue color filling out the rest, and blue fur-trimmed boots, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Neck Accessory.description: The Neck Accessory offered by this Spirit is a fluffy white neck ruff, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a tall blue trapper hat with a white inner fur lining and a pair of yellow and blue feathers sticking out the top, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's sixth node ( total). Note that this item is considered a Hair, not a Hair Accessory, and as such it can not be worn over other Hairstyles.

name: Tearful_Light_Miner
summary: The Tearful Light Miner is a Regular Spirit in Hidden Forest who offers the inline_text Expression. The Tearful Light Miner is found in a cave near the end of Boneyard, to the right of the broken bridges leading to the Temple. The only collectible offered by this Spirit is a Hair.

Memory.text: The Tearful Light Miner can be found in a cave near the end of Boneyard, to the right of the broken bridges leading to the Temple. There are four openings in the roof of the cave, in addition to the two ground-level entrances that are blocked by Darkness Plants. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 5 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. All of the memory fragments are sheltered from the rain. As their memory unfolds, the Tearful Light Miner and three other Spirits are seen trapped within the cave by the Darkness Plants covering the entrances. Several large boulders then collapse and pin down two of the unfortunate Spirits, and the Tearful Light Miner and remaining Spirit desperately attempt to free them from the rubble - to no avail. Some time later, a pair of grave markers made of small stones are stacked in the center of the cave in honor of their memory. The desolate Tearful Light Miner rests with the other surviving Spirit, who has since been engulfed by a Darkness Plant that the player must burn. They do not survive, and the Tearful Light Miner is once again left behind with another addition to the grave markers. At the end of the memory, the Tearful Light Miner remains the sole survivor of the tragedy. Filled with grief over their fallen companions, they cover their face with their hands and weep.
Memory.alt_text: Relive the Tearful Light Miner's memory

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a simple long, straight hairstyle that reaches the player's shoulders, costing . Note that this style is similar, but considerably shorter in length than the hair offered by the Levitating Adept. It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node.

Friendship Tree.raw:
{{Friendship Tree Info | regular}}

This Spirit's Friendship Tree contains two [[Wing Buffs]] to unlock. The second Wing Buff unlocks the ability to upgrade the [[#Expression|Expression]] two more times, for a total of five upgrades. Only the Tearful Light Miner and the {{Spirit|Waving Bellmaker|inline_text}} have two Wing Buffs and five Expression upgrades.

name: Tender_Toymaker
summary: The Tender Toymaker is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of The Two Embers - Part 1. The Tender Toymaker is found at the Marketplace in The Last City, between some stalls on the left side. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an outfit, a hair, a prop_c, and a prop_m.

Memory.text: The Tender Toymaker can be found at the Marketplace in The Last City, between some stalls on the left side (after completing Quest #1). Before that, they can be found resting under a tent, across from the player's starting point in the area, though they cannot be interacted with. Unlike other Spirits, the Tender Toymaker has no memory that can be relived, but rather a Seasonal Quest dedicated to them. Showcasing the life of the weary Spirit, struggling to make a day as a Toymaker merchant, this Quest gives players a series of tasks, helping the Spirit get back into the active Marketplace as a merchant. Players can interact with the Tender Toymaker upon completion of the First Quest.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit consists of four layers: a green, long-sleeved dress, an outer dark green dress covered with a green shoulder mantle, and a beige apron tied around the waist. The apron holds a paintbrush pouch and the bottoms of the mantle and dress sleeves are decorated with triangle patterns. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a beige scarf wrapped around the head and neck, decorated with pale triangles around the face hem. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Props.description: This Spirit offers a total of two Props: a Crab Figurine and a Manatee Toy.

=Crab Figurine=.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a wooden carved Crab toy, partially colored yellow with white accents. It has four stick legs, large, moon-shaped claws, and a star ornament on the forehead. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

=Manatee Toy=.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a wooden carved Manatee toy, painted with white and yellow. Its tail and fins are tied to the body with string. When equipped, the toy can be interacted with by clicking its prop_m icon at the bottom of the screenthe avatar will hold it up in front of them, move it in a wave motion and shake its tail, which triggers the fins to be moved as well. It cannot be placed and therefore cannot be used in Shared Spaces. When carried on its owner's back, it appears in its original form. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

name: The_Cellist's_Beginnings
summary: The Cellist's Beginnings is a Seasonal Shop from the Season of Duets. The Cellist's Beginnings is found in the Concert Hall in Aviary Village, within the curtained hallway behind the stage after completing the first Seasonal Quest. Unlike typical Seasonal Spirits, there is no need to first relive a spirit memory to access this Shop and it does not offer an Expression. The collectibles offered by this Shop are an Outfit, a Hair, and a Prop.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Shop is a light gray sleeveless dress with a scalloped collar piece and maroon leggings. name: Thoughtful_Director
summary: The Thoughtful Director is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Rhythm who offers the inline_text Expression. The Thoughtful Director is found on the First Floor of the Vault of Knowledge, to the right of the elevator and behind the four-player door that requires the inline_text Expression to open. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Cape, and the Instrument.

Memory.text: The Thoughtful Director can be found on the First Floor of the Vault of Knowledge, behind the four-player door to the right of the elevator. This Spirit has a carry spirit memory with 7 memory fragments and a 10-minute overall time limit. In order to open the door on the Vault's First Floor, players will first need to unlock the inline_text Expression from the Levitating Adept. Four players are needed to open the gate and once all four are present, interact with the Telekinesis prompt on the stones in front of the door together to unlock the room beyond it. As their memory unfolds, the Thoughtful Director can be seen making their way through the tunnel behind the 4-player door and into the open room beyond it, entering a closed door tucked into the back-left corner. Light the two braziers sitting in front of the door to open it. The Spirit continues to ponderously travel through the winding tunnel and meets the Praying Acolyte kneeling in prayer along the way, who joins their journey onwards. Near the end of the tunnel, the two Spirits meet the Polite Scholar and together, the three Spirits walk the last few steps to the ledge overlooking the open room. At the end of the memory, the Thoughtful Director looks out into the large open room where their memory began, back turned to the player. They bring a hand up to tap at their chin, swaying side to side and lost in their thoughts.

levels.description: will make your avatar look up slightly, bring their right hand up to their chin and hold the elbow with their left, before turning their body from side to side a few times and tapping their chin with the right hand, while two xylophone sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with a big glowing question mark appearing over your avatar's head.

will make your avatar bring their right hand up to their chin and loosely hold the elbow with their left, before looking down with their knees bent, head turning from side to side before straightening and raising their right hand in the air in epiphany, while three xylophone sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 3, with a big glowing light bulb symbol appearing over your avatar's head as they raise their arm.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is white and resembles an owl, with a wide face, a pair of stubby horns, a small beak, and bronze accents, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is pale blue and resembles the plumage of a bird, with a yellow hem and a purple interior, as well as a long, triangular, pale blue neckpiece with a gold ornament shaped like the emblem on it, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is the Xylophone (or Lithophone), costing from the Traveling Spirit. Its five bars are alternately colored in a lighter and slightly darker blue. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total). The player kneels while playing the Instrument, which plays 15 notes. The Xylophone plays the melody part on Music Sheets. Its pitch is one octave above the standard Instrument (in C major, it covers C5 to C7), making it the highest-pitched Instrument available in the game, along with the Instrument. In Harmony Hall, the Xylophone can be found on the back wall, behind and to the left of the front counter, next to the alcove containing the two pianos.

}} The hints given before the [[Thoughtful Director]]'s second appearance were: {{Collapse |id=mw-customcollapsible-TSHint |label=Second Visit Hints |content=
* Is a harsh but fair critic * Gets stressed over finding the perfect birthday gifts * Has kept their first plant alive * Is on the 2nd draft of their new mystery project * Likes to gift flowers to those they care about * Is stubborn * Has a restless soul * Found all 900 Korok seeds in Zelda: Breath of the Wild without any guides

name: Timid_Bookworm
summary: The Timid Bookworm is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Sanctuary who offers the inline_text. The Timid Bookworm is found on the first floating island when entering Sanctuary Islands from the Bird Nest. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Hair, a Cape, and the .

Memory.text: The Timid Bookworm can be found in the Sanctuary Islands, on the underside and on the back of the first floating island when entering the area from the Bird Nest. This Spirit has a standard memory with 9 memory fragments and a 15-minute time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Timid Bookworm can be seen sitting on the ground with a book before they spot the Sanctuary Guide a few steps away, which is holding out their hand in the air. They approach the Guide carefully and observe how a butterfly sits on their outstretched hand. The two Spirits then make their way up the floating island, stopping at a floating Jellyfish once, before arriving at the very top, where a big swarm of butterflies flocks around the Sanctuary Guide, while the Timid Bookworm watches in awe a few steps away. At the end of the memory, the Timid Bookworm sits quietly near the Sanctuary Guide, reading a book. The Sanctuary Guide holds out their left palm to allow a butterfly to land, which makes the Timid Bookworm look up from their book and stand up, shyly holding their right arm. The butterfly then flutters away from the Guide and the Timid Bookworm reaches up with both arms to try and catch it, but the little creature has already flown out of their reach. A little embarrassed, the Timid Bookworm shyly holds their right arm.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is made of a big three-strand braid in the back, two smaller braids in the front, tied with small yellow bands, as well as short choppy bangs, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is orange and shaped like a butterfly, with a white edge and interior, as well as little tails on the hind wings, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).
