name: Tinkering_Chimesmith
summary: The Tinkering Chimesmith is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Flight who offers the inline_text. The Tinkering Chimesmith is found in the Wind Paths, on a set of stone steps on the main island, next to the Flight Guide. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Hair, a Hairpiece, and the Instrument.

Memory.text: The Tinkering Chimesmith can be found in the Wind Paths, on a set of stone steps on the main island, next to the Flight Guide. When entering from the area's main entrance, let yourself be guided by the wind and fly straight until you arrive at the main island. Your landing point should be at or near the bottom of a set of stone steps near the Flight Guide, at the top of which the Tinkering Chimesmith can be found. This Spirit has a standard memory with 10 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Tinkering Chimesmith can be seen climbing up the stone steps, hanging chimes from each stone arch on their way up the mountain. On the second arch, they drop their hammer while hanging the wind chimes but they continue their work and travel on upwards, where they reach the top of the mountain, which holds a big stone arch. The Spirit pauses at the foot of the stone arch and uses their hands to measure where they want their bells to hang from. Once their work is finally - and successfully - done, the Chimesmith stores their tool on a Manta-driven boat and boards it, before taking off in direction of another, smaller island, not far away. This island, which is positioned at a higher altitude than the Talented Builder's neighboring island, is home to their workshop, where they are seen pondering their work and curling up next to their worktable. After a little rest, the Spirit continues their work by tinkering with the chimes hanging from the pillars supporting their little abode and observing them from below. At the end of the memory, the Tinkering Chimesmith stands beneath the wind chimes hanging in their workshop, which clank and ring against one another, creating a beautiful melody. Lost in thought, the Spirit observes the chimes while enjoying the wonderful sounds.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit includes an orange top with mid-length sleeves and beige details, a yellow apron with orange details, tied with a blue string around the waist, yellow pants with an arrow-shaped blue line near the bottom, and simple orange boots with yellow cuffs, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit consists of thick, fluffy hair that drapes down past the shoulders, with the top section of the hair tied back in a small ponytail with a broad blue band, and one ponytail in the front on each side, tied by broad blue hair bands, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair Accessory.description: The Hair Accessory offered by this Spirit is a set of two white-, blue-, and yellow-colored feathers of two different sizes, clipped together on the left side of the head, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by this Spirit is the Kalimba, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is shaped like a chime or bell, with a white body, golden keys, and blue and gold accents. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total). The player kneels while playing the Instrument, which plays 15 notes. The Kalimba plays the melody part on Music Sheets. Its pitch is the same as the standard Instrument (in C major, it covers C4 to C6). In Harmony Hall, the Kalimba can be found on the back wall, behind and to the left of the front counter, next to the alcove containing the two pianos.

name: Tiptoeing_Tea-Brewer
summary: The Tiptoeing Tea-Brewer is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Remembrance who offers the inline_text Expression. The Tiptoeing Tea-Brewer is found in the Repository of Refuge, in an opening in the wall of the balcony high up on the player's left when entering the area. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Hair, and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Tiptoeing Tea-Brewer can be found in the Repository of Refuge, in an opening in the wall of the balcony high up on the player's left when entering the area. This Spirit has a standard memory with 9 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Tiptoeing Tea-Brewer can be seen standing beside a bed where another Spirit, presumably their loved one, lies in sickness. The Tea-Brewer then puts a kettle on the stove and goes out the door with a basket hanging from their arm. On their way, they come across a few soldiers in front of a fortress with an opening in the wall. The Tiptoeing Tea-Brewer carefully sneaks past it behind their backs. Finally at their destination, they pick a few herbs near a tree and lay them in their basket. On the way back home, they carefully tiptoe past the soldier's gate again. Having arrived at home, they go on to prepare their loved one a tea with the picked herbs, when suddenly they let the kettle fall as they see that the other Spirit lies motionless in bed. The Tea-Brewer immediately rushes to their side, weeping, leaving the kettle shattered to pieces on the ground. At the end of the memory, the Tiptoeing Tea-Brewer peeks out from the opening in the wall behind the soldiers' backs before slowly and quietly tiptoeing their way past them.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit is a long-sleeved, orange maxi dress with a green apron, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a small ponytail on the side with fluffy, side-swept bangs under an orange head scarf that is tied on the opposite side of the ponytail, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is short, brown, and shaped like a leaf with a second yellow layer underneath that is shifted slightly to the right, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was offered to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

name: Tournament_of_Triumph
summary: A brand-new event called the Tournament of Triumph opened in the Realms for the first time! From Monday, July 29, 2024 at 00:00 PDT (UTC-7) through Sunday, August 18, 2024 at 23:59 PDT (UTC-7), players could join a rotating series of games that had them running, leaping, soaring, and even scampering through some of the best-known places in Sky! For the duration of the event, the Crab of Triumph appeared in Home and Aviary Village, offering to take players directly to a special version of the Coliseum. Each day until the day of the closing ceremony, players could take part in two different games to enjoy some lighthearted and friendly competition with fellow Sky Kids. Complete games to score points for your assigned team and earn event currencyalong with some extra Light to reward your efforts. On the final day on August 18, fly to the closing ceremony in the Coliseum to celebrate the winning team under the thunderous roars of the crowds.

name: Troupe_Greeter
summary: The Troupe Greeter is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Rhythm who offers the inline_text Expression. The Troupe Greeter is found in the middle of Isle of Dawn, to the right of the stone ramp farthest away from the Temple.The Troupe Greeter was originally found directly next to Passage Stone at the center of Isle, but was moved a few feet away in Patch to make room for the newly added bonfire and Passage Stone meditation circle. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, and the .

Memory.text: The Troupe Greeter can be found in the middle of Isle of Dawn, to the right of the stone ramp farthest away from the Temple.The Troupe Greeter was originally found directly next to Passage Stone at the center of Isle, but was moved a few feet away in Patch to make room for the newly added bonfire and Passage Stone meditation circle. This Spirit has a standard memory with 5 memory fragments and a 10-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Troupe Greeter can be seen traveling across the sand dunes of the Isle, steadily heading towards the Temple. The Spirit eventually reaches the island in the clouds and steps inside the entrance hallway of the building, pleased to have reached their destination. At the end of the memory, the Troupe Greeter twirls a hand while sweeping their arm backwards, gesturing towards the Temple doors as if to welcome the player inside.

levels.description: will make your avatar twirl their right hand as they sweep their arm backwards with their left arm tucked behind their back, twisting their body to face the same direction of the movement, while harp sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with a white trail of light following the gesturing hand.
will make your avatar sweep both arms backwards in succession, twisting their body and taking a step to face the same direction of the movement, while harp sound effects play.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with green trails of light following both hands, as well as a white trail of light towards the end.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit consists out of a light-blue wrap top with mid-lengthed sleeves and a purple belt, dark-grey balloon pants, and purple boots with a white fur-trim and golden ornaments, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit resembles the head of a bird with a thick down-curved beak and yellow accents, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Troupe_Juggler
summary: The Troupe Juggler is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Rhythm who offers the inline_text Expression. The Troupe Juggler is found in the Ice Rink in Valley of Triumph, within the open tunnel on the player's right-handed side when entering the area. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Hair, a Cape, and a Prop.

Memory.text: The Troupe Juggler can be found within an open tunnel next to a two-player door, on the right-hand side of the Ice Rink in Valley of Triumph. This Spirit has a standard memory with 4 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Troupe Juggler can be seen leisurely strolling all the way down to the end of the tunnel. At the end of the memory, the Troupe Juggler whips out little spheres of light from within their Cape, first juggling two with one hand, then switching to juggling three with two hands, and finally throwing all of the spheres into the air and catching them all in a dramatic finish.

levels.description: will make your avatar take out spheres of light from under their Cape and begin to juggle, first with just their right hand before switching to both hands, then toss all three spheres high into the air to spin around and catch them with a jaunty pose as a rolling accordion tune plays in the background.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with sparkles popping out of the sides of each sphere.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with larger spheres of light and sparkles popping out the sides of each sphere.
makes the same motion as Level 1, with larger spheres of light, sparkles popping out the sides of each sphere, and light particles floating up from your avatar's juggling hands.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit features a light-blue wrap top with mid-lengthed sleeves, a pair of dark-blue balloon pants with a scarf-like fur-trimmed piece of fabric tied around the waist, and simple dark-blue boots, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is an upward-pointing hairstyle that resembles an ice cream swirl with a yellow streak, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a purple cape with a white fur trim and collar piece, which features the Season of Rhythm's symbol, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a small square-shaped stone brazier, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used to decorate Shared Spaces. When lit, its flame will recharge the player's wings. It appears as a small brazier on its owner's back when carried. This item was not available during the Season of Rhythm. Instead, it was added to the Troupe Juggler's Friend Tree during their first visit as a Traveling Spirit on September 16, 2021, in conjunction with Days of Summer.

name: Tumbling_Troublemaker
summary: The Tumbling Troublemaker is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Passage who offers the inline_text Expression. The Tumbling Troublemaker is found in the Isle of Dawn, on the far right side of the Passage Stone, past the small cavern where Isle WL 4 is located. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a headpiece, a Hair, and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Tumbling Troublemaker can be found in the Isle of Dawn, on the far right side of the Passage Stone, past the small cavern where Isle WL 4 is located. (Note: Meditate next to the Passage Stone campfire and turn Isle of Dawn to nightfall in order to see this Spirit.) This Spirit has a standard memory with 6 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Tumbling Troublemaker can be seen dancing while two other young Spirits are busy collecting stones in a basket. The playful Spirit then juggles two stones while the other two carry their basket onwards across the dunes. Halfway down a small incline, the Tumbling Troublemaker trips and starts rolling alongside the stones they dropped. At the bottom of the slope, the Tumbling Troublemaker and the stones crash into the other two Spirits, knocking them down and causing their basket to go flying. At the end of the memory, the Tumbling Troublemaker raises their head, a little dazed, as the other two Spirits burst into laughter and shake their heads in dismay.

Head Accessory.description: The Head Accessory This item was recategorized from a Hair Accessory to a Face Accessory as a result of the Closet category expansion in Patch . It became a Head Accessory after the split of the Face Accessory category in Patch . offered by this Spirit is a pair of earrings that reach till shoulder level, consisting of a silver, crescent-shaped piece near the ear and two pieces of thin fabric tied to it, one piece colored maroon, the other yellow, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit includes short, spiky hair, and a wide maroon forehead band, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit includes a beige cape made of fur that goes to chest level and has two pom-poms attached on maroon drawstrings on the front, and a separate raccoon tail attached to the lower torso, colored in beige and brown stripes, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

name: Twirling_Champion
summary: The Twirling Champion is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Lightseekers who offers the inline_text Expression. The Twirling Champion is found on the left side of the Ice Rink, near the rock wall that surrounds the area. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, and the Instrument.

Memory.text: The Twirling Champion can be found on the left side of the Valley of Triumph's Ice Rink, near the rock wall that surrounds the area. This Spirit has a standard memory with 6 memory fragments and a 6-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Twirling Champion can be seen performing a series of complicated leaps and twirls all around the rink, repeatedly launching themself several feet into the air. After the impressive display ends, the Confident Sightseer and the Leaping Dancer are seen standing side-by-side with the Twirling Champion as all three Spirits wave to unseen onlookers and celebrate their skill. At the end of the memory, the Twirling Champion performs one last move, hopping into a simple twirl.

levels.description: will make your avatar hop into a small twirl that finishes with their arms extended and their left leg swept out to the side while a short percussion accent plays.
makes the same motion as Level 1 with a white ray of light and sparkles following the avatar's hands.

will make your avatar leap into a higher, faster twirl with more revolutions, finishing with their arms extended and their left leg swept even further out to the side while a longer, ascending percussion accent plays.
makes the same motion as Level 3 with a white ray of light following the avatar's hands and a burst of white light particles coming from the feet as they hit the ground.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is light gray and round with a blue triangle under each eye, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a topknot tied with a blue band and a long tail that's draped over a shaved section on the top of the head, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Instrument.description: The Instrument offered by the Twirling Champion is the Pan flutepatch (Panflute or Panpipes), costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is colored purple, fades into a dark gray tone towards the top, and has triangle-shaped accents on it. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total). The player is standing up while playing the Instrument, which plays 15 notes. Its sound is similar to the Flute but the Panflute's sound is deeper and echoes more. The Panflute plays the wind part on Music Sheets. Its pitch is the same as the standard Instrument (in C Major, it covers C4 to C6). In Harmony Hall, the Panflute can be found on the back wall, behind and to the right of the front counter in an alcove above the Horn.

name: Ushering_Stargazer
summary: The Ushering Stargazer (formerly Ushering MigrantIn Patch , both the Pointing Candlemaker and Ushering Stargazer Spirits were renamed to better reflect their updated memory stories.) is a Regular Spirit in Isle of Dawn who offers the inline_text Expression. The Ushering Stargazer is found by the Sand Dunes, behind a stone pillar between the Passage Stone and the ramp leading to the Isle Temple.The Ushering Stargazer was moved in Patch . The spirit was originally located behind the main ramp that leads to the temple. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit and a Hair.

Memory.text: The Ushering Stargazer can be found by the Sand Dunes, behind a stone pillar between the Passage Stone and the large ramp with a Child of Light leading to the Isle of Dawn Temple. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 6 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Ushering Stargazer is seen traveling across the land together with another Spirit. The Ushering Stargazer spots a falling star streaking across the sky and rushes ahead while their friend lags behind. What lands is not a star but a small child - curled up and unconscious. Concerned, the Ushering Stargazer urges their slow companion to hurry up and come closer. At the end of the memory, the two Spirits stand over the fallen child who begins to stir. The Ushering Stargazer and their friend give each other an uncertain glance, wondering what to do with their discovery.

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit is a simple ponytail tied back with a blue band, available to be collected for free. It is permanently available to all players after unlocking the Friendship Tree's first node.

The Vault Elder's Lantern is found in the Sky Cinema at Aviary Village, in the room to the left of the shop spirits and opposite the wardrobe room. The Ultimate Guide offers a necklace_u, a hairpiece_u, and a cape_u for Season Pass holders. name: Vestige_of_a_Deserted_Oasis
summary: The Vestige of a Deserted Oasis is a Seasonal Shop from the Season of Revival. The Vestige of a Deserted Oasis is found within the left-most building in Aviary Village, marked outside by a sign with Revival's emblem. The collectibles offered by this Shop are shoes, a Hair, and a Cape.

Shoes.description: The Shoes offered at this Shop are a pair of beige sandals with ankle-high cross straps. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered at this Shop is a short cut with sideswept bangs. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's first node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered at this Shop has a blocky purple gradient that fades from light to dark with gold accents, a fluffy white trim, and a white interior. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Season Friendship Tree.description: This Friendship Tree provides the collectibles sold by this Shop during the Season of Revival. This Tree can no longer be accessed. However, the items listed here will be available for purchase when the Shop returns as a Traveling Spirit - or in some other form. It is currently unknown how these items will return after the Season of Revival has ended. Because the Vestige of a Deserted Oasis was not a Seasonal Spirit, either the Traveling Spirit system would have to be modified to allow for non-Spirits, or else thatgamecompany will have to introduce another mechanism for obtaining past-Season cosmetics.

name: Warrior_of_Love
summary: The Warrior of Love is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of AURORA who offers the inline_text Expression. The Warrior of Love is found standing on the left side of the Coliseum in Valley of Triumph, by the AURORA Guide. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Hair, a Cape, and the . Players can view their memories by completing the third Quest at the beginning of the Citadel in the Valley of Triumph, next to the Manta Whisperer Spirit.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is bare-faced with two long, white, wavy lines under each eye and two small curved lines at the outer corner of each eye, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Hair.description: The Hair offered by this Spirit includes a large, loose braid on the back that ends with a golden ring, fluffy upturned bangs, and two strands of hair that have smaller golden rings tied in the middle, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a light-blue scarf with a golden ring tied to its end and white feathered shoulder embellishments, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's sixth node ( total).

name: Waving_Bellmaker
summary: The Waving Bellmaker is a Regular Spirit in Daylight Prairie who offers the inline_text Expression. The Waving Bellmaker is found in Prairie Villages on the larger middle island, at the bottom of the path leading to its bell tower. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask and a Hair.

Memory.text: <div> The Waving Bellmaker can be found in Prairie Villages on the larger middle island, at the bottom of the path leading to its bell tower. This Spirit is a standard memory quest with 2 memory fragments and an unlimited overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Waving Bellmaker is seen jauntily walking along the path towards the bell tower. The Spirit pauses at the base of the structure to peer up at the bell while shading their eyes from the sun with one hand. At the end of the memory, the Waving Bellmaker climbs the bell tower to clean the very top of the bell with a rag. At some point, a flying boat, heavily laden with jars and headed towards the Prairie Temple, passes by. The Spirit onboard waves to the Waving Bellmaker which prompts them to return the gesture, clinging to the bell to avoid falling as they stand.

name: Whale_Whisperer
summary: The Whale Whisperer is a Regular Spirit in Hidden Forest who offers the inline_text. The Whale Whisperer is found in the Boneyard, at the large Whale skeleton found to the left of the broken bridges, by the ruins of a building. The only collectible offered by this Spirit is .

Memory.text: The Whale Whisperer can be found in the Boneyard, at the large Whale skeleton found to the left of the broken bridges, by the ruins of a building. This Spirit does not have a conventional memory quest; there is no kneeling figure that needs to be lit up. Instead, the Spirit is triggered once all the Darkness Plants covering the skeletal remains have been burned away. As it is exposed to the rain, take care not to run out of light while burning the Darkness. All players in the area are then automatically granted the Whale Call.

name: Wise_Grandparent
summary: The Wise Grandparent is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Belonging who offers the inline_text. The Wise Grandparent is found on a square platform at the start of the The Archives in Vault of Knowledge. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are a Mask, a Cape, a Prop, and the .

Memory.text: The Wise Grandparent can be found on a square platform at the start of the Archives in Vault of Knowledge, in the large room before the maze. This Spirit has a standard memory with 9 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. Deep Calling is recommended to stunt the many Dark Crabs inhabiting the hallways of the Archives, to prevent them from attacking the player during the memory. As their memory unfolds, the Wise Grandparent can be seen ponderously exploring the maze-like Archives until they reach its end. At the end of the memory, the Wise Grandparent stands thoughtfully with their hands clasped behind their back. The player then grabs a bell from underneath their Cape and rings it, catching the attention of the Spirit. They bring their hand to their chin and think for a short while, before they raise up their arm in epiphany, with a glowing exclamation mark blinking above their head.

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is decorated with golden forehead ornaments and a thick voluminous beard, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was available to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is white with faint diamond markings near the collar and a yellow fringe at the bottom, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fifth node ( total).

Prop.description: The Prop offered by this Spirit is a small gray lantern in the shape of an elongated hexagon with a light-blue diamond shape on one side, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It is a placeable Prop that can be used in Shared Spaces. This item is purely cosmetic and does not offer any functionality, and cannot be lit despite its resemblance to the lanterns seen in the Vault of Knowledge. This item was not available during the Season of Belonging. Instead, it was added to the Wise Grandparent's Friendship Tree during their second visit as a Traveling Spirit on November 11, 2021.

name: Wounded_Warrior
summary: The Wounded Warrior is a Seasonal Spirit from the Season of Remembrance who offers the inline_text. The Wounded Warrior is found in an opening in the wall behind the Remembrance Guide. The collectibles offered by this Spirit are an Outfit, a Mask, and a Cape.

Memory.text: The Wounded Warrior can be found in an opening in the wall behind the Remembrance Guide. This Spirit has a standard memory with 7 memory fragments and a 15-minute overall time limit. As their memory unfolds, the Wounded Warrior can be seen at the war with another soldier. Their first battle is triumphant and they celebrate by waving their spears in the air and doing high fives. Along the way, they stop at a merchant. While the Wounded Warrior is selecting a potted plant to take home, they are attacked by two other enemies. Spears send pots flying everywhere, also killing the merchant instantly. The last scene shows the Wounded Warrior looking at the innocent deceased merchant, while the other compatriot encourages them to leave the scene. At the end of the memory, we can see a scene closer to the Wounded Warrior, kneeling and wounded, watching the disaster they have just witnessed, the death of an innocent, caught in the wrong place, at the wrong moment.

Outfit.description: The Outfit offered by this Spirit consists of a muddy-green long-sleeved top and balloon pants. The waist and left leg are wrapped in dressings, the other foot is dressed in a brown, high boot, and the top is ripped around the bottom hem, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was offered to all players during the Season from the Friendship Tree's third node ( total).

Mask.description: The Mask offered by this Spirit is a stone-gray mask with a crack, filled with blue crystal, coming from the left eye and partially going over the forehead, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's second node ( total).

Cape.description: The Cape offered by this Spirit is a short dark-brown, torn cape with black, broken armored shoulder padding, costing from the Traveling Spirit. It was a Season Pass exclusive item during the Season, available after unlocking the Friendship Tree's fourth node ( total).
